loans.name: Janeta

texts.en:
Janeta D. is 44 years old. She was born in the town of Vidin but her childhood passed in Vratza whrere she graduated her education. Janeta D. is married and has two sons.

For over ten years he has lived and worked in the capital city Sofia in the field of advertisement and PR consultancy. Three years ago she had to go back to Vratza because her parents were very old ad she had to look after them.

Then Janeta decided to establish an advertising agency in her native town. Janeta D. needs $ 1 000 for a mechanic knife for paper cutting and formatting.

loans.use: To buy a mechanic knife for paper cutting and formatting

loans.name: Miller

texts.en: I am a father of 3, aged 34 years. I am a painter. I also take care of my parents and my brother's children. I wish to earn more money through dairy farming.

loans.use: I will use the money to purchase a dairy goat.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is married with grown children. Her husband is physically handicapped so she is the only breadwinner in her family. Maya runs a small business at the market in Novaya Kahovka. She knits sweaters, dresses and other clothing items to sell. There are very few other businesses working in this sphere of manufacture and sales.

Maya is a typical entrepreneur in Ukraine, striving to make a better life for her family. She has been in business for five years and is very enterprising, decisive and determined. The realities of business ownership have been a superior teacher for her. Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have provided consistent help as she has worked to make her business a success.

Maya has requested a loan for $500 to buy extra measures of yarn so she can knit new clothes to sell. We believe Maya’s natural talent to assess the current market environment and take advantage of opportunities will stimulate her business’ growth and keep it sustainable and profitable, helping Maya to achieve independence and security in life.

loans.use: Maya would like to buy yarn to make new items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Xewoe

texts.fr:
Aged 44, Mrs. Xewoe A. has been a widow for seven years and has six children at home. She is therefore alone in taking care of their schooling and other family expenses. Illiterate, she tries to manage by having a small business selling palm oil. As the business makes very little money, she cannot make ends meet. Having mastered her work very well, she has a good sense of management that would allow her to handle a loan and make the repayments. She is once again asking for a loan of $800 to stock up on palm nuts from the production zones with a view to making a maximum profit that would meet the needs of her family. Let us help her realize this dream, since sending her children to school is very important to her.

Agée de 44 ans, Madame A. Xewoe est veuve depuis sept ans avec six (06) enfants en charge. Ce qui montre qu’elle est seule face à la scolarité de ses enfants et les autres charges de la famille. Analphabète, elle se débrouille avec son petit commerce de l’huile de palme. Le revenu de son commerce étant très faible, elle n’arrive pas à joindre les deux bouts. Ayant bien maîtriser son activité, elle a l’esprit de bonne gestion qui lui permet gérer les crédit et de bien les rembourser. Elle sollicite encore une fois, un crédit de $800 pour s’approvisionner en noix de palme dans les zones de production en vue de réaliser un profit maximum pour satisfaire les besoins de la famille. Aidons-la à réaliser ce rêve car la scolarisation de ses enfants, lui est très importante.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Preparation and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Vinesa

texts.en: Ms. M. is a 50-year old married woman with seven children. She likes to do her business because she knows she can get more profit from it. She works very hard in order to get more profit to raise her seven kids and satisfy the family needs. She believes that this kind of business is not worth it if the person running it is not very active. She is also aiming for another loan to extend the shop and add the necessary stocks such as junk foods, beer and cigarettes. She is very happy with the programme and wishes to stay long in it, as this is the only financial support for her business.

loans.use: Re-stock

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is 49 years old, lives in Mache District, Otuzco Province, La Libertad state. She has 7 children who all depend on her. Alejandrina completed elementary school.

She learned her business from her mother at a young age and also how to do a variety of activities. She has some cows, and when she milks them she makes the cheese and curd, put it is not enough to meet the orders she has so she also goes to different farms to buy them already made to later sell in Mache and Trujillo. She also raises animals (guinea pigs, chickens, turkeys) to sell. Along with these activities she grows some crops.

The business of buying and selling cheese and curd began with a loan the Communal Bank "Mujeres de Trabajo" sought from Manuela Ramos, and at that time she only sold the product she herself produced.

With the current loan from Manuela Ramos for 1300 soles (approximately US$433), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy food for her animals and turkeys to fatten and sell at Christmas.

Alejandrina dreams of having a house on the coast so that she can take her children there to study.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Alejandrina tiene 49 años de edad, actualmente vive en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, Departamento de La Libertad; tiene 7 hijos, todos dependen de ella. La señora Alejandrina estudió solo primaria completa.

Desde muy joven aprendió de su mamá el negocio y también a realizar varias actividades, tiene algunas vaquitas y cuando descargan leche ella misma prepara los quesos y la cuajada, pero no es suficiente para atender sus pedidos así que también sale a los diferentes caseríos a comprarlos preparados para vender luego en Mache y también en Trujillo, también cría animales (cuyes, gallinas, pavos) para luego venderlos. Paralelamente a estas actividades siembra algunas hortalizas.

El negocio de la compra y venta de quesos y cuajada lo inició con el primer préstamo que le otorgó Manuela Ramos en el Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Trabajo” ya que antes sólo vendía lo que ella misma producía.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,300.00 ($ 433 aprox.) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará alimento para sus animales y pavos para engordarlos y venderlos en la navidad.

La señora Alejandrina sueña con tener una casa en la costa para que pueda llevar ahí a sus hijos a estudiar.

loans.use: Purchase of animal feed and turkeys.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. sells clothes in an open market. She is 39 years old, is married with five children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned this business for 2 years and has 3 years experience in the business. She is an LAPO member and needs a loan of $600 to buy more clothes to sell. She wishes to pay back the loan in 8 months.

loans.use: Grace would like to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía T. has a small stand on Tumusla Ave. in the city of La Paz, where she sells sneakers, slippers, and sandals. She also owns several other stands located in the main market in the city of El Alto. She constantly travels to the city of Oruro and to the town of Desaguadero, where she buys merchandise to replenish her businesses. Sofía has three children, the youngest of whom is 6 years old. For this reason, it is necessary for her to invest more capital in maintaining her business and staying in the market. She needs to invest heavily because she faces stiff competition. Sofía’s objective is to sell her products wholesale, so she needs the loan in order to be able to buy products in the abovementioned places because buying wholesale is more economical than buying in smaller quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofía T., tiene un puesto de venta de zapatillas, pantuflas y sandalias en la Av. Tumusla de la ciudad de La Paz, al mismo tiempo es dueña de otros puestos ubicados en la principal feria de la ciudad de El Alto. Constantemente realiza viajes a la ciudad de Oruro y a la localidad de Desaguadero, de donde compra su mercadería para abastecer sus puestos. Actualmente Sofía es madre de 3 hijos, el menor de 6 años, por tal motivo, es necesario realizar una importante inyección de capital para poder mantenerse en el mercado, puesto que si bien el rubro necesita de una fuerte inversión, la competencia es mucha. El objetivo de Sofía es la venta de su mercadería al por mayor, por lo que ella precisa de capital para poder realizar la compra en los lugares ya mencionados, puesto que el precio de la compra al por mayor baja sustancialmente a comparación de la compra por unidades o docenas.

loans.use: To invest in her business and sell her merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Oliver's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Oliver N.. She is currently in the business of selling bitengi and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to buy more bitengi( tie-and-dye art & crafts material). Oliver is 29 years old and single. She has 2 children ranging from age 4 to 6 and her children go to school. Each week, Oliver makes approximately UGX 50,000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Oliver has taken a previous loan of UGX 200,000 from BRAC Uganda in order to buy better materials and the loan was paid back on time.

Oliver is joined in her small group by Harriet N., Harriet N., Prossy N., and Hajarah N.. Harriet N. runs a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 100,000 to buy more goods for her store. Harriet N. is in the dry cleaning business and is requesting a loan of UGX 400,000 to buy more equipment. Prossy N. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to expand her business. Hajarah N. is currently in the business of selling shoes and is requesting a loan of UGX 8,000,000 to buy more shoes.

loans.use: To buy more Bitengi(tie-and-dye art & crafts material)

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 21 years old and is single with two children. She  also takes care of  5 other people, ages 12-45 years old. Hawa began selling milk and bites in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $85 from her sales.  Hawa now hopes for a loan to buy more  items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Vilama Del Rocio

texts.es:
Vilma del Rocío T. C. is 33 years old and studied as far as sixth grade of primary school. She has one child who is still dependent on her. She lives in the province of Otuzco, in the department of La Libertad, Perú.

Her business is the purchase and sale of small livestock, such as pigs, calves, chickens and guinea pigs, which after fattening them up, she slaughters and sells the meat. She also sells wheat and barley grain as well as buys curd and cheese which she resells.

Through one of her relatives, she was able to join the "Mujeres del Olivo" community bank, where she obtained her first loan which she used to buy a sack of wheat grain, a sack of barley grain and small livestock. With another loan, which will be repaid in four months, she will buy pigs, chickens and guinea pigs.

Her greatest dream is to have her own house in the city of Trujillo

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Vilma del Rocío T. C. tiene 33 años de edad, estudio hasta el sexto grado de primaria. Tiene un solo hijo que aun dependen de ella. Vive en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

El negocio al que se dedica es la compra y venta de animales menores tales como: chanchos, huachos, gallinas y cuyes los cuales después de engordarlos sacrifica para vender la carne. Así también vende grano de trigo y cebada, además compra cuajada y queso para volver a vender.

Por medio de un familiar pudo integrarse al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Olivo” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró un saco de grano de trigo, un saco de grano de cebada y animales menores. Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 el cual cancelara en cuatro meses comprara 4 chanchos, gallinas y cuyes.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia en la ciudad de Trujillo

loans.use: Purchase pigs, chickens and guinea pigs for resale.

loans.name: Esteria

texts.en:
Mambo from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Esteria M.. She is not married but has been blessed with five children aged between 8 and 18 who live with her because they are orphans. In 1998, Esteria established her genge business. She now requires a loan in order to buy additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, where the owner sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Marina De Jesus

texts.es:
In the municipality of El Sauce, in the city of León, lives Marina de Jesús a hard working older woman who for many years has dedicated herself to farming with the objective of maintaining her humble home which is in much need of investment. Her need today results from living in an isolated area, where she does not have access to electric power. Therefore, she asked for the installation of a solar panel so she could have use of two lamps and a small television.

For this sole reason, she has asked for the support of CEPRODEL to obtain a loan with which to pay for the solar panel. Her wish is to continue working under improved conditions so she can have a better chance of getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León la señora Marina de Jesús es una ancianita muy esforzada que desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario con el objetivo de mantener su humilde hogar de habitación que tanto necesita de inversión. Hoy en día la necesidad que ella atraviesa es que debido a que vive en una zona muy alejada, donde no se cuenta con energía eléctrica, ella ha solicitado la implementación de un panel solar para tener acceso a dos lámparas y un pequeño televisor.

Por esta unica razon es que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el credito con el cual pagar el panel solar y de esta manera continuar con su actividad economica bajo mejores condiciones de vida para salir adelante.

loans.use: Pay for a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Tursunoy Y. is 49 years old. She is married with four children, who all go to school. Tursunoy sells fabrics for sewing the national dresses. She has been in this business for almost 13 years. The national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and beautiful. When you see all these national dresses it seems that you are admiring the scenery, which is awaking from a cold winter. It is a feast of green leaves and grasses, of bright red and yellow tulips in the mountains and a blue sky, which is so close to you in spring. At the same time the national dress is one of the most important items in the dowry of a girl.

Tursunoy has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients about which textiles to choose for this or that occasion. This is why she has her constant and loyal customers. Her eldest daughter helps her with the business. Also, Tursunoy’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various income levels; she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. She has two trading places, in two different markets.

All this allows Tursunoy to keep her clientele and to make a good income. The income that she derives allows her to educate all of her children at a high level. She hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they will be able to receive an adequate education.

Now, Tursunoy needs 3500 Somoni ($1025 USD) to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods she sells. Tursunoy promises to pay the loan in 4 months, without any violation. She expresses her gratitude to everyone for supporting her. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase the new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Shawki

texts.en:
Shawki is 42 years old and lives in the south of Lebanon. He owns a pastry shop next to his home. The good reputation of Al Majmoua in his neighborhood pushed Shawki to request a loan from the institution for the first time.

Shawki is trying to expand his business. He needs $1200 to purchase a new refrigerator for juice, as well as other equipment in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator for juice and other equipment

loans.name: Chhoy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoy M. is a 33-year-old vegetable seller who is also growing rice. She grows vegetables and sells them at the Dom Dek Market which is her local market. She earns approximately US$ 2.50 per day, while in the case of her husband, Mr. Och Vunn, 40 years old, his business is transporting chopped wood from the forest to sell, earning around US$ 6.00 per day. Mrs. Chhoy has four children, all of whom are students. They all live in Kean Sangkei Commune, Siem Reap Province.

To expand their farming business, Mr. Vunn has decided to seek a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a plowing-machine. The loan will increase their income to support their family's daily expenses adequately.

loans.use: To purchase a plowing-machine

loans.name: Mrs. Hout Srey Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people, who live in Chrolong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, formed a village bank and they plan to use the obtained loan for different purposes. Mrs. Hout S. is village bank president and owns a small grocery store in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Kong Kan, is a bean middleman who buys bean to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. Mrs. Hout S. is 40 years old and the mother of five children, who are all attending the local school. (Mrs. Hang S. did not come to accept the loan, but her husband did and is present in the picture instead). 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for inventory

loans.name: Delia Felicitas

texts.es:
Delia, tiene 62 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Luchadoras de Yungay, y vive junto a su esposo, quien es agricultor y la apoya en el negocio, en el jr. 28 de julio s/n, distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash.
Desde hace tres años tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes, el cual está ubicado en su domicilio. Todas las mañanas abre sus puertas para brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como 5 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de sal y 1 bolsa de azúcar.  
A pesar de su trabajo como autoridad, su más grande reto es hacer crecer su negocio, es por ello que sueña con superarse y ser mayorista.
texts.en:
Delia is 62 years old, has 5 children, and is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Luchadoras” of Yungay. She lives with her husband, who is a farmer and supports her in the business, at jr. 28 de julio s/n, Yungay district and province, in Ancash department. For three years she has had a grocery store business in her home. Every morning she opens her doors to provide the best service to her customers. With this loan for S/.800, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy basic needs products such as 5 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of salt, 1 bag of sugar. Her greatest goal is to grow her business, and this is why she dreams of being successful and become a wholesaler.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina O. sells foodstuffs such as onions at a place popularly called Air Force, near Shama. Dina has received a junior high education. She is married and has one child. Her husband is an artisan.

Dina has been selling foodstuffs since 2006. She is responsible for assisting her husband provide for the basic needs of their family. Her loan will be used as additional capital to increase her food sales and to pay transportation costs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest in her child's education.

loans.use: To increase her food sales

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 30 years old and is married with 2 children. She sells newspapers. She loves this business, which she started in 2001. 

Mercy is a LAPO client. She needs loan of N40,000 to purchase more newspapers to sell. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase newspapers to sell

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi: Chị Võ Thị Hà 43 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ chị chủ yếu làm may và buôn bán nhỏ. Sau khi được vay thêm vốn từ Quỹ tình thương chị đã đầu tư mở rộng kinh doanh thêm các mặt hàng điện nước. Công việc kinh doanh hiện nay đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra hàng tháng chị còn có thêm lương hưu nên kinh tế gia đình chị rất ổn định.   Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hành và mở rộng kinh doanh..
texts.en:
Ms. Vo Thi H. is 43 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 1999. Before joining the Fund, she was a tailor and petty trader. After receiving the loan from TYM Fund, she expanded her trade business to include electrical and water-supply supplies. The current business brings an income of VND3,000,000 per month to her family. Apart from this, she also receives pension, so the economic situation is very stable.

In this loan cycle, she wishes to borrow VND20,000,000 to buy more supplies and expand the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more supplies and expand the business.

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria es socia del Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa.
Luz Maria es conviviente, tiene cuatro hijos de 26, 17, 16 y 9 años,  los menores estudian en  colegio estatal.

La familia de Luz Maria tuvo un negocio, una polleria, ella de niña trabajaba allí con su papá, es donde le fue naciendo el gusto por el  negocio. Cuando su papá muere se reparten la herencia, cerrando la polleria. A la edad de 17  años tiene su primer hijo  y se va a vivir con su esposo, pero la necesidad económica era fuerte   y se dedico a trabajar en la venta de  sandwich  con su hermano, ellos venden  semanal mas de 280 sandwich de martes a domingo, los lunes descansan. Por las mañanas ella  se dedica a tejer en su casa chompas  a croché y  a palito, para una empresa que lo exporta a otro país.  
Desde que comenzó en Finca, ha sido una ayuda para surgir en su negocio, ahora tiene un carrito especial para los sandwich. Le gusta las reuniones, el compañerismo que hay entre las socias del Bancomunal.    
Luz María necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para invertirlos en  compra de panes, papa, aceite, para la preparación de los sandwich.
El sueño de Luz Maria es tener un restaurante, y una tienda bazar.
texts.en:
Luz Maria is a member of Bancomunal Maria Milagrosa. Luz Maria is a partner and has four children of 26, 17, 16, and 9 years. The younger children are studying in state school. Luz Maria's family had a business, a poultry shop. Since she was a girl, she has worked there with her father, and it was here that her taste for business was born. When her father died, the real estate was divided, closing the poultry shop. At the age of 17 years, she had her first son and went to live with her husband. However, the economic pressure was strong, and she worked to sell sandwiches with her brother. They now sell more than 280 sandwiches weekly from Tuesday to Sunday, resting on Mondays. In the mornings, she knits and crochets sweaters in her home for a business than exports them to another country. Since she started with Finca, she has received help to succeed in her business. Now, she has a special cart for the sandwiches. She likes meetings because of the fellowship that exists between the members of Bancomunal. Luz Maria needs a loan of $375 USD to invest in the purchase of bread, potatoes, oil to prepare sandwiches. Luz Maria’s dream is to have a restaurant and a bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread, potatoes and oil to prepare sandwiches

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana T. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and the mother of two children, both boys. She says both of her children are in the basic school. Diana’s husband is a motorcycle fitting mechanic. He has his workshop located at a strategic point. Diana lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region. Berekum is a busy business centre which is about twenty-five minutes' drive from Sunyani, the regional capital.

Diana sells footwear. She procures a variety of footwear (shoes, slippers, etc. for both men and women), from nearby cities and sells the goods in the local market. She also treks to nearby towns to sell. Diana has been in this business for six years. She wants a loan to increase her working capital so she can procure more goods. It is Diana’s desire to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy footwear for re-sale

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn G. is married with four offspring. She is currently engaged in selling fish caught by her husband and acquired from other fishermen. She asks for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 from Kiva's partner PMPC to finish building their new fishing boat and for additional capital in her fish-selling business.

She hopes that someday she can open a sari-sari (variety) store aside from her existing business to support the studies of her children. She said that Paglaum is always standing behind their financial needs.

loans.use: To finish building a new fishing boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: add to her inventory

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Мамадалиева Гульбахор- женщина 27 лет. Мать 2-х детей. Занимается купле-продажей скота Муж Гульбахора находится в Казахстане на заработках. Она сама ведет домашнее хозяйство. Она также является колхозницей. Ей помогает в этом бизнесе младший брат мужа. У Гульбахора дома есть дойная корова который приносит доход семейному бюджету. Гульбахор узнала о нашей программе и ей понравилась решила кредитоваться в нашей организации.
texts.en:
Gulbahor M. is 27 years old and is a mother of 2 children. She is in the business of selling livestock. Her husband works in Kazakhstan. So she manages the household on her own. Gulbahor also has a small farm and gets help running it from her brother in-law. She keeps a dairy cow to sell milk to bring in extra income for the family. Gulbahor learnt about the loan program and is very interested in participating and getting credit to buy more livestock so as to later sell it.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more livestock

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en:
Dupe A. is 32 years old and married with four children. She sells medicines and provisions.

She is requesting a loan of N40,000 to purchase more medicines and provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Awuor

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 35-year-old mother of six children. She is married to a casual worker (similar to a day-laborer in the US). Elizabeth used to run a salon but but now cooks mandazi (a donut-like pastry) because the salon was too expensive to keep up. She hopes to use this loan to re-stock her salon, which she will run out of her house in Nyalenda slum. Elizabeth tells us that she is struggling to pay school fees for her children right now and says if she receives her loan, she will work harder. She says her kids love going to school.

In this video, you can hear me greet Elizabeth saying "Idhi Nade", which is Luo for "How are you?" Elizabeth responds, "Adhi maber," meaning "very good." Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama's father. At the end, you will hear me fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying "Asante Sana" in Kiswahili, meaning "thank you" and "Erokamano", which in Luo means "thank you." The voices you hear in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post.

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. You can read more about K-MET’s work here.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Elizabeth Awuor from  Kenya

loans.use: To buy blow dryers, chemicals

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia A. is 37 years old. She is married and has four school-age children. Eugenia is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz city. To make a living, Eugenia raises crops--primarily planting and harvesting rice and corn to sell. Eugenia has been farming for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eugenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Eugenia is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children and to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in a farming business

loans.name: Maqbool Muhammad Sharif Group

texts.en:
Maqbool baji is a wife of M. S.. They have both been citizens of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore is famous for its Punjabi food and its historical places. M. has sold leather for the past 4 years. Currently, Maqbool baji is requesting a loan to advance her husband’s business.

Maqbool baji is the leader of a loan group that includes four other women.

Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies (sand, brick and cement) to sell.
Munawar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.
Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell.
Khalida baji wants a loan to buy material (minced meat, cooking oil and spices) for her food selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for doing so.

Note: Maqbool baji is seated in the second right side of the bajis. The photo also shows members of Khursheed baji's business.

loans.use: To buy leather to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella G. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 51 years old. Estrella is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a food stall selling a variety of fruits in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Estrella is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Estrella from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un pescador de 63 años de edad que vive con su esposa y su hijo menor en la caleta San José, una zona pesquera ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a la pesca de manera eventual, ya que es una actividad que no se realiza durante todo el año por las temporadas de veda, durante esas temporadas el se dedicaba a trabajar en un astillero cercano pero por su edad tuvo que dejar su trabajo y desde hace tres años tiene una mototaxi (un vehículo utilizado para el servicio de transporte) con el que gana el sustento diario para su familia.

Debido al constante uso, su vehículo ha empezado a sufrir desperfectos mecánicos, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a nuestra institución los cuales utilizará en el arreglo y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil para poder seguir sosteniendo a su familia.

Anteriormente Miguel ha tenido cuatro préstamos en nuestra Institución los cuales canceló en forma puntual, es una persona muy responsable que ha sabido mantener y sacar adelante a sus 10 hijos, 9 de los cuales ya están casados y tienen diversas ocupaciones en la zona en donde viven. El desea darle a su hijo menor la oportunidad de seguir estudiando y así poder asegurarle un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 63 year old fisherman. He lives with his wife and youngest child in the San José cove, a fishing region located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has devoted almost his whole life to fishing. This is temporary work. Because of the closed fishing season, he does not fish all year. During these seasons he worked in a nearby shipyard, but he had to leave that work due to his age. For three years he has had a “mototaxi” (a vehicle used for transportation), which he uses to earn the daily sustenance for his family. Due to its constant use, the vehicle has started to suffer from some mechanical problems. That is why he saw the need to ask the institution for a loan for 500 PEN. He will use the loan to fix and maintain his vehicle in order to continue supporting his family. Miguel has had four previous loans with the Institution. He repaid them punctually. He is a very responsible person who has known how to support and help his 10 children succeed. Nine of his children are married and have diverse jobs in the region where they live. He wishes to give his youngest child the opportunity to continue his education. This way he will be assured of a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of mototaxi

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn C. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old and is married. To make a living, Jenelyn grows and harvests a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jenelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn is requesting her first loan from PMPC, for 5000 PHP which she will use to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married to Oscar. They live harmoniously with their four children in the village of Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. They are striving hard to earn a living in order to support the education of their children. Their primary source of income is farming and they help each other in planting a variety of vegetables. 

Margarita is a fruit and vegetable vendor in the market and in their village.  Sometimes she roams around their village to sell her products, but most of the time she stays at her stall in the market. She now wants to request a loan amounting to PHP5,000 from KIVA loans. This will help towards the growth of her vending business. She hopes to strengthen her business so that she can meet the needs of their children. She hopes that her business will grow and the children will finish their studies.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Naraa

texts.en:
Naraa is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Uvs Province in Western Mongolia. She lives with her family in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her children attend secondary school and her husband is a taxi driver. 

Naraa owns and operates a noodle shop in her town. She produces flour noodles that are used in many popular Mongolian dishes. Before she began her shop in 2008, Naraa operated a cashmere and materials supply business. She still sells some cashmere to supplement her income, but she is focused on growing and expanding her shop to include sausage processing. Her noodle shop has brought her a lot of success and business experience in a very short amount of time. For the future, Naraa is focused on expanding her noodle shop and beginning to make sausage. 

She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~$2100 USD) loan to purchase equipment and supplies for the new sausage shop.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies for the new sausage shop.

loans.name: Lukaia

texts.en:
Lukaia is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of four children. All of her children are currently independent. She lives with her husband in a small village in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. 

Lukaia sells rice and stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about thirty years ago to take care of her entire family. Her food production is on a small scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. 

She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables, and rice to increase her efficiency and enable her to produce her stew in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy more rice, vegetables, meat, and firewood etc.

loans.name: Ismael Kato

texts.en:
Ismael is 30 years old, married and blessed with two children. He runs a retail business which is located at Imbuga in Eldoret.

Wanting to improve his business and profit margins, Ismael sought out a loan with KADET, a Kiva partner. With the loan he is taking from KADET, he intends to buy stock to sell, including paraffin and super oil. His dream is to prosper and provide for his family.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To add more stock of oil to his retail business

loans.name: Mylene Faith

texts.en:
Mylene Faith J.'s main source of income comes from preparing and selling cooked foods for daily meals. She is 24 years old, married and has one small child. She is from the village of San Juan Panaon. Mylene Faith has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Mylene Faith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mylene Faith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products

loans.name: Tugs

texts.en:
M. Tugs lives in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, called a "ger", in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. She operates a small clothing production business in her town. Tugs started her clothing business in 2007 after working at an animal hospital for several years. At first, her working capital was 200,000 tugrugs (approximately 140 USD), but she has quickly gained experience, stabilized her business and become well established in the local business community. Her many customers appreciate her business for the good quality and stylish clothes she makes. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,500,000 tugrugs (approximately 1050 USD). Tugs is working hard to continue her success and says, "I want to save enough money to provide for my grandson." She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrugs (approximately 1400 USD) loan to purchase fabrics and other materials for her business.

About XacBank

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/xacbank_mongolia

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&queryString=Mongolia&status=fundRaising&gender=All§ors[]=All®ions[]=All&sortBy=Expiring+Soon

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and other materials

loans.name: Acela

texts.es:
La señora Acela es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desD. hace 3 años atrás, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 7 hijos. Estudió secundaria incompleta y se dedica a la artesanía.
Acela nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar lana, bayeta e hilos.
Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su negocio y tener su propio capital.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Acela has been a member of the Lupazas Communal Bank for three years. It is in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 48, married, and has seven children. She has some high school education. She works with handicrafts. Acela tells us that she used the first loan she asked the Manuela Ramos Movement for, 500 PEN, to increase her capital. She will now ask for a loan for 2,000 PEN to be able to buy wool, fabric, and thread. Her dream for the future is to increase her business and to have her own capital. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the meetings with the members.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool, fabric, and thread

loans.name: Cesar Adolfo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Cesar tiene 38 años, es casado y tiene un hijo llamado Cesar Gabriel que tiene 2 años. El socio Cesar vive en la ciudad de Pisaq departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. Las reuniones de los socios se hace en la ciudad de Calca.  

El socio tenía se dedica a la compra y venta de artesanías. El socio nos cuenta que compra la artesanía en la ciudad de Pisaq de los artesanos como bisutería y collares de cerámica y después una vez al mes lleva la artesanía personalmente al país de Brasil específicamente a la ciudad de Sao Paulo donde ahí lo distribuye a las tiendas brasileñas y peruanas. Ya son 5 a 6 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más artesanías y para los gastos del viaje. 
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cesar is 38 years old, married, and has a two year old son named Cesar Gabriel. He lives in the city of Pisaq in the Department of Cusco and is a member of the Communal Bank “Mamacha Asunta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. The members conduct their Communal Bank meetings in the city of Calca.

Cesar buys and sells handicrafts. He says that he buys crafts from artisans in the city of Pisaq such as handmade jewelry and ceramic beads. Once a month he travels to Brazil, specifically the city of Sao Paulo, to distribute the merchandise to Brazilian and Peruvian stores in the area. He has been in this business approximately 5-6 years and has done very well because of the effort he puts into his work. Cesar is a working father and entrepreneur who wants to succeed on behalf of his family. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more handicrafts and pay for his traveling expenses.

Cesar is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handicrafts & pay for traveling expenses

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata D. est une femme de 31 ans elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 6 scolarisés. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KADIOR depuis 2 ans et demi et a 5 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Son objectif est de renforcer son activité de vente de tissus teintés afin de se procurer des revenus qui lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatoumata D. is a 31-year-old woman, married and mother of seven children, of which six are in school. She has been a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of KADIOR for two and a half years, and has been granted five successive loans. Her objective is to bolster her activity of selling dyed fabrics. This will generate income and allow her to participate in supporting her family.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolster her business activities

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon O. is 59 years old and lives in La Castellana, Negros Occidental. She is a widow and has been caring for her two children since 1985. She makes her living by selling soft drinks and frozen foods in the local markets. She is also a rice retailer - buying and selling sacks of rice. With her food business, she gets contracts from Iloilo in the province of Panay to the north of Negros Occidental.

Before joining Project Dungganon in 2002, Corazon sold products door-to-door, including ready-to-wear (used) clothing and Avon beauty products. With her loan from Project Dungganon, she was able to expand her frozen foods business and eventually move into the rice dealing business. Her current loan of 15,000 pesos will be beneficial in making investments in her business.

Corazon has a son and a daughter who have both graduated from college and are off on their own. She is incredibly proud of their achievements since they both chose to become public servants. Her daughter is a teacher in the national high school and her son is a policeman. Corazon has a 3-month-old grandson with her son.

Eventually, Corazon plans to move out from her present house and settle down in one of the nicer subdivisions. She has already bought a plot of land but cannot afford to build a home yet. She needs Php 100,000 – about $2,500 – to build a house. One day she will get that home while still being a member of Project Dungganon.

Corazon is a member of good standing. She is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her rice-selling and food-vending businesses

loans.name: Emilia Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Emilia del Rosario E. P., de 48 años de edad vive en el barrio de Guadalupe, ella es madre soltera de 3 hijos, el mayor de 26 años, el intermedio de 15 y el pequeño que vive bajo sus dominios.

Ella trabaja ofertando productos y realizabdo encuesta para El Banco Central de Nicaragua, ella solicita un prestamo para la compra de mayor producto de omnilife y de esta manera ir a ofertarlo a nuevos mercados a nivel ancional, esto le traería mejores condiciones económicas, con las que podra oprtar del capital necesario para futuros proyectos, o bien para la mejoría de las condicones de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilia del Rosario E. P., 48 years old, lives in the Guadalupe neighborhood. She is a single mother mother of three children, the eldest is 26, the middle child is 15, and the youngest still lives her her. She works selling products and administering surveys for the Central Bank of Nicaragua. She is applying for the loan to purchase more Omnilife products. Omnilife is a producer of health/nutrition products. She hopes that she will be able to offer her products to new markets and thus improve her finances. This would allow her to invest in future products or improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (health/nutrition)

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 36-year-old married man and the father of three young children. He has been working as a shoemaker for the past fourteen years and in 2000, he opened his own shoe shop in his town as his own business. He is the only one to take care of his family and its expenses. He produces shoes and he works on special designs upon request of his clients.

Today, Samir is requesting to borrow $800 to purchase leather and some supplies such as glue to make shoes before the summer collection.

loans.use: To purchase leather and some supplies such as glue

loans.name: Kuyange

texts.en:
Kuyange M. is currently in the business of selling food at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more rice and beans to cook and sell.  Kuyange is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more rice and beans to cook and sell

loans.name: Lucila Migdalia

texts.es: Lucila Migdalia tiene 47 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa, además de esto la venta de carne. Tiene la edad de 46 años. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos con Fundación. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar su condición económica pues es muy importante para el ingreso de su hogar, ya que es el único medio de ingreso que tiene. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. el sueño de Lucila es lograr establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Lucila Migdalia is 47 years old. She works selling clothing and also sells meat. This is not the first time she has received a loan from the foundation. She has three children. She has been concerned with improving her financial situation and the income from her business is very important for her household because it is the only income they have. She will use the loan to purchase necessary materials for her business. Lucila's dream is to start a mini-market in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for her business

loans.name: Molly Adrine

texts.en:
Secondhand clothes are in high favor with many people in Uganda. Not one to be left out of this lucrative opportunity which had presented itself in her home area of Nyakacwamba, Rukungiri, is A. Molly Adrine, an enterprising and lively 30-year-old woman, who made a decision to capitalize on it.

With the money Molly had saved working in a local market, she bought her first consignment bales of secondhand clothes. With these, she took root and, though her business has had its fair share of ups and downs, she has emerged as a resilient woman who has refused to buckle under any sort of pressure. With this kind of spirit, she has made enormous headway as manifested in the 300,000 Ugandan shillings she makes monthly.

Molly is a lady who likes taking the long view and, as such, she has drawn up a plan to expand her secondhand clothes selling business into a wholesale franchise. With this loan she is optimistic she will be empowered financially to see her dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used-clothes for her business

loans.name: Resilene's Group

texts.en:
Resilene B. is from the village of Brgy.Balete,Diadi,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 23 years old. Resilene is the group leader of an 11-member group taking out a loan from ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Resilene is married. To make a living, Resilene owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Resilene has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Resilene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Resilene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Resilene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Miriam Alexandra

texts.es:
Miriam de 36 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil, tiene tres hijos, ella tiene una distribuidora de waype (lo utilizan los albañiles con diluyente para quitar las manchas de pintura), por la falta de oportunidades Miriam empezó recolectando retazos y telas para elaborar los waype. 

Reparte a las ferreterías (almacén de venta de artículos de construcción) en todo Guayaquil, los waype los elabora con telas y retazos de tela, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00pm. La libra de waype la vende a $ 1.50. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas para los waype, en el futuro quiere tener un almacen de waype.
texts.en:
Miriam, 36, lives in the urban Orquídeas neighborhood of the city of Guayaquil. She has 3 children, and is a distributor of "waype," (waste cloth used for cleaning), which is used by bricklayers with thinner to remove paint stains. Lacking job opportunities, Miriam began gathering scraps and fabrics to make the waype. She distributes her product to the hardware stores (stores selling construction products) in all of Guayaquil. She makes the waype with fabrics and scraps of fabric, working from 7am until 10pm. She sells a pound of waype for $1.50. With the loan she wants to buy fabric for the waype. In the future she wants to have a waype store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric and fabric remnants

loans.name: Vuthy's Group

texts.en:
This group loan which consists of four people is located in Ta Loek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Vuthy C. is the leader of the loan group, who has selected by the members. With these loans, they hope to increase their income to improve their families' living conditions. 

Mrs. Vuthy C. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice on, while her husband, Mr. Chhoun Dul, is a bicycle and motorbike repairman, who can earn a small income to support his family. In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Vuthy C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase motorbike supplies for him to use. 

This couple has four children; two stay at home and also help their mother with farming while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase motorbike supplies

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 2 est d’une Association  de femmes mariées du village de Djigonso dans la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies et ont en moyenne 43 ans et au moins 8 enfants.
Elles  font essentiellement la culture du riz. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe   Benkadi 2 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement remboursé tous les  prêts solidaires,  elles ont décidé de virer au prêt de campagne puisse que leur activité principale  en hivernage est la culture du riz.
Rachelle Dembélé compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence de riz, des petits équipements  et des intrants agricoles. 
Elle s’approvisionne exclusivement  au grand marché de Yangasso ville. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est stockée pendant un certains  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Rachelle compte réaliser tout comme les autres membres du groupe, après écoulement de son produit agricole, un bénéfice de 35000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courant de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 Group is an association of married women from the village of Djigonso, San prefecture, in Ségou Region (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in extended traditional families. Their average age is 43; each has at least eight children. They are rice growers. Hoping to improve the efficiency of their farming operations, Benkadi 2 decided to take part in Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They have repaid their membership loans, decided to apply for a business loan. In the winter season their main activity is growing rice. Rachelle Dembélé plans on using her loan to buy rice seed, small tools and fertilizer. She will get them at the big market in Yangasso town. Once winter is over, she will keep what she has harvested long enough for the price to rise before selling it at the big market in Kimparana and in other local markets, mostly by selling it directly to customers but also wholesaling it. Her customers mostly come from large towns. After she has sold her produce, Rachelle (like other group members) hopes to realize a profit of 35,000 FCFA, to be used to service her loan and to pay for ongoing family expenses.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice seed, fertilizer and small farming tools

loans.name: Kamal Deen

texts.fr: B. Kamal Deen est né le 08 Septembre 1986 à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Deen vit seul et habite Ekpè depuis une dizaine d'année. Deen n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire, et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Deen exerce cette activité depuis trois ans, ce qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins. Deen achète ses produits de coiffure à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. En vue de renover son atelier de coiffure par l'achat de matériels de coiffure performents et adaptés pour le bon fonctionnement de son activité, Deen sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Kamal Deen B. was born September 8, 1986, at Ekpè, in the commune of Sèmè-Podji. He is single, and has lived at Ekpè for about ten years. He did not go past grade school. He has been a barber for three years, earning enough to meet his needs. He buys his barbering supplies at Dantokpa, Benin's international trade center. He is asking for his first loan from ALIDé so as to bring his shop up-to-date by buying barbering products suitable for running his business well.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clippers and hairdressing supplies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes A. is from Barangay 25, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Lourdes is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling various kinds of vegetables in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius M. is 43 years old. He is a resident of Changamwe Mombasa where he is a poultry farmer. Married to Virginia Rujuru who supports his income, they have two children. Having been in this farming business for four years, Julius hopes to buy chicks and chick mash with the loan from KADET. With the anticipated profit, he wants to buy a juice blending machine. In the future, he hopes to open up a hotel (restaurant) and supply it with the chickens he raises.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chick mash

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Mrs. S. is 26 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, where she works in a factory sewing clothes. In addition to her job, she raises poultry in a cage behind her house and sells the matured poultry in bulk to a middle trader. She is married with two young children; both are enrolled in primary school. Her husband, Choun Kna, (pictured) works with her in the business and also works in construction. S. will be using her loan to repair/decorate her old house which often cracks during the approaching rainfall season.

loans.use: To repair/decorate her old house

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a young woman who has two sons and five daughters, her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. One of her sons works in the grocery store the family owns, where they sell food supplies such as milk, coffee, sugar, salt, oil, wheat, etc.

Muna came to FATEN and received $800 to purchase a larger amounts of food supplies, since her stocks were mostly consumed during the month of Ramadan. Her store is supplying the area with a variety of supplies that are not available in most small supermarkets.

Muna's son who works in the store appears in the picture here as Muna is not comfortable having her picture online.

loans.use: Purchase food supplies

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie D. is a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner MFI (microfinance institution) of Kiva in the Philippines. Determined to improve their standard of living, she joined ASHI. She also believed that by joining she does not only have access to capital but can also further be empowered by good values and principles. She will meet new friends as well. 

She used her first loan to begin a business buying and selling Ready-to-Wear clothes (RTW) and assorted personal products. For her second loan, she is applying for 9,500.00 Philippine pesos as additional capital for her business. She wants to buy more stock, especially now that the Christmas season is fast approaching. 

She is planning to buy more RTW clothes, toys and other gift items for her customers. This additional capital will earn her more profit that can help her husband with their daily financial needs. 

Her dream is to be able to provide quality educations for their four children until they finish college and earn a degree. As of now, her eldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 5 months old. Three of her children are in grade school. The couple has started saving for the future of their children and with this new additional capital, they can increase their savings as well. She is hopeful that ASHI and Kiva will continue their partnership in providing financial assistance to her until she reaches her goals.

loans.use: To buy additional Ready-to-Wear clothes, toys, gift items

loans.name: Las Esforzadas Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  “Las Esforzadas” se conforma por 21 socias, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talcahuano. Sus principales negocios son de almacenes de abarrotes, arriendo de disfraces, fotografías, artesanías en vidrio y cerámica, producción y venta de sillones, venta de pinches y frutos secos.

Marisol, quien es la secretaria de este grupo, se ubica en la foto en 1º fila, en 2º lugar de izquierda a derecha. Ella vende ropa de guagua, niño y adulto, por encargos en su casa y a domicilio, hace 4 años. Viaja a comprar su mercadería a Santiago (capital de Chile) 2 veces al mes. Tiene un hijo de 6 años. 

Con este préstamo comprará la ropa encargada y además ropa de temporada primavera – verano. 
Está contenta, debido a que a contar de fin de año arrendará 2 puestos en un centro comercial nuevo. En uno venderá ropa de niño y en el otro, ropa de adulto. Su sueño es seguir ampliando su negocio hasta llegar a no depender de los préstamos para crecer.  
Marisol ha sentido un gran apoyo y preocupación de parte de la asesora de Fondo Esperanza. Además agradece  los préstamos, los cuales le han servido para mantener y hacer crecer su negocio.
Talcahuano es una comuna y ciudad-puerto de la Región del Biobío, al sur de Chile.Es conocida como primer puerto militar, industrial y pesquero del país. Su nombre en mapudungun significa "Cielo Tronador". Posee un paisaje natural  muy atractivo, debido a la combinación de ríos, mar, planicies fértiles, vegas y los cuerpos montañosos, con una hermosa vegetación. Su economía gira en torno a dos puertos, la Base Naval, y un Barrio Industrial con empresas siderúrgicas, refinería de petróleo, petroquímica, cemento, gas, etc. 

La foto pequeña fue agregada porque la cara de una socia no se veía bien en la foto grupal.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Esforzadas" [Determined Women] is made up of 21 members belonging to the city of Talcahuano. Their primary businesses are grocery stores, costume rental, photography, glass and ceramic handicrafts, the production and sale of sofa chairs, hair accessory sales and dried fruit. 

Marisol, who is the group's secretary, is the located in the photo in the first row, second place from right to left. She sells clothing for babies, children and adults, by special order at her home and also by delivery which she has done for four years. She travels to purchase her merchandise in Santiago (capital of Chile) twice a month. She has a six-year-old son. 

With this loan she will purchase the clothing that has been ordered and additional clothing for the spring-summer season. She is happy because as of the end of the year she will be renting two posts in a new shopping center. At one she will sell children's clothing and at the other, clothing for adults. Her dream is to continue growing her business to the point at which she no longer needs the loans in order to grow. 

Marisol has felt tremendous support and caring on the part of the consultant from Fondo Esperanza. Furthermore she appreciates the loans which have allowed her to maintain and expand her business. 
 
Talcahuano is a municipality and port city of the Region of Biobío, in the southern part of Chile. It is known for being the country's first military, industrial and fishing port. Its name in mapudungun means "Thundering Sky". It is possessed of a very attractive natural landscape, owing to the combination of rivers, ocean, fertile plains and meadows and the mountains arrayed in beautiful vegetation. Its economy revolves around two ports, the Naval Base and an Industrial zone with iron and steel companies, petroleum refineries, petrochemical activity, cement, natural gas, etc. 

The small photo in the corner was added because one group member's face was not clearly visible in the group photo.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for the spring-summer season

loans.name: Amparo De Jesús González

texts.es:
La Señora Amparo de Jesús G., inicia realizando su compra en el mercado la terminal desde 6 am, luego se traslada a su puesto de venta   ubicado en la esquina de INISER a ofertar sus productos y finaliza a las 4 pm.

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de manzanas, uvas Frutas, Golosinas, y Cigarros ya que se aproxima la navidad.

La Señora G., con los créditos que le ha brindado CEPRODEL  se siente muy conforme por que ha logrado a incrementar su negocio y con sus ganancias ha realizado mejora en  su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Amparo de Jesús G. starts at 6 a.m., making her purchases at the La Terminal market.  Then she goes to her sales booth, which is located on the same corner as INISER [Nicaraguan Institute of Insurance and Reinsurance], and offers her products until she finishes at 4 p.m.

This loan is being used to buy apples, grapes, other fruits, and cigarettes, since Christmas is approaching.

Ms. G. feels very satisfied with the loans that CEPRODEL has offered her, as they have made it possible for her to grow her business.  She has used her earnings to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, other fruits, candy, and cigarettes

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Joven Alfredo G. de 26 años de edad, es soltero, cuenta con una peluqueria, realiza corte para damas, caballeros y niños, Anexo depilaciones en general,  Manicura y Pedicura.
Alfredo se acerco a la Fundación y solicito apoyo crediticio para la compra de una motocicleta que le va a ayudar a ir y venir de su domicilio a su peluquería, además de hacer cortes a domicilio.
       Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya ya Kiva por la oportunidad de acceder al préstamo ya que le ayudara que vaya progresando día a día.
texts.en:
Alfredo G. is 26 years old, single, and he owns a barbershop.  He cuts hair for men, women, and children, and offers general hair removal, along with manicures and peticures.

Alfredo aproached the Foundation for a loan to purchase a motorcycle.  This will help him get to and from work, as well as allow him to offer haircuts in his customers homes.

Alfredo is greatful to both the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the loan which will help him improve things one day at a time.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Ileana

texts.es:
Ileana S.  V. es una futura Microempresaria de la comunidad de Canalete de en Alajuela. 
Ella va ser parte de una sociedad de mujeres  que van a conformar la  micro empresa “Creaciones de ensueño” la cual consiste en la confección de ropa de cama, como edredones, sabanas, cobijas, almohadas y cortinas para cuartos. 
Para empezar cada una de ellas debe de aportar su cuota, es por eso que Doña Ileana  necesita un préstamo de  ₡350 000 (trescientos cincuenta mil) para la compra de materiales, telas y maquinas de coser principalmente.
Ella    es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Ileana S.  V. is a future small businesswoman in the Canalete community of Alajuela.

She is going to be part of a group of women who make up the micro business “Creaciones de ensueño” (Creations of dreams) which consists of making bed linens including comforters, sheets, blankets, pillos and curtains for bedrooms.

To begin each day one of the group needs to take her part, and so Ileana needs a loan of ₡350 000 to buy material, fabric, and sewing machines.

She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Buy fabric and sewing machines

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is thirty-six years old.  She is married and shares her home with her husband and their four children.  The family owns their home, which is located in the village of Pueblo Libre in the district of Tambogrande.  It is a semi-tropical zone which is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers.

Doris raises animals in corrals behind her home.  She raises goats, chickens, ducks and turkeys.  She feeds them on local plants and manufactured feed from local mills.  Her husband works as a field laborer on a large local farm.  He has permanent and consistent work.  Between these two income sources that family is able to manage a small level of savings and, with the animals, maintain a relatively stable income stream.

This will be Doris’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the funds to purchase additional feed for her animals.  She hopes to be able to get a bulk discount and be able to obtain better feed so that her animals grow more rapidly and healthier.  Doris is very hard-working and well respected in the community.  Edpyme Alternativa is proud to be able to provide her with access to credit and assist her in her business propositions.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed for her animals

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama B., who completed senior high school education, is married to a mason and has has one child. For four years now, Ama has been selling rice (in smaller plastic bags), and other food items at Ankaful near Abura. She is responsible for assisting her husband with the day to day running of the home.

Her loan will be used to buy more rice for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits arising from the loan back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice for sale.

loans.name: Daniel Alexis

texts.es:
