Daniel Alexis V. V. tiene 39 años, es casado, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Tiene 2 hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Daniel Alexis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que sus hijas estudien.

Le gusta estar con su familia
texts.en:
Daniel Alexis V. V., aged 39, is married and lives with his wife in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. He has two children.

The members of the rural communal bank Tierra Nuestra ("Our Land") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 14 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Daniel Alexis is a farmer. He grows corn and rice. He buys his agricultural supplies at the market Ecua-Agro and sells his products at the same place.

He applies for a loan to finance his sowing of corn and rice. He needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help him to pay for the required supplies. He faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. His dream is that his daughters may study. He likes spending his free time with his family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel A. is a pig grower from the community of Trinidad, Bohol.  She started her business in 1998.  Her love for her husband motivated her to start this business.  It is her great joy that she has been able to help meet all of her family's needs.

She would like to apply a loan of 6,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc.  The loan will help her buy piglets and feed.  Aside from that, she also plans to try other business opportunities that will help her augment her income.

Maricel is 28 years old.  She wanted to save money because soon, when she has a baby, she will be confident that she can support all her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49-years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  buying & selling dried fish and operating a tricycle transport business.  She lives in Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her buying & selling of dried fish and tricycle transport businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Nida is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell.  

 This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nida aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Danaya. Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38  ans et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
FANTA T. fait le commerce de pomme de terre à travers le groupe DANAYA.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 400kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Sikasso. Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso ville au niveau du rond point central et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The group DANAYA has four members who are married women. They all have around 38 year-old and about 4 children. Most of them live within polygamous families in Ouayerma I; one of the popular district of the city of Sikasso. Sikasso is the third administrative region of Mali. The women are applying to their first loan with the microfinance instiution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their clients. In this group of women, Madam Fanta T. sells potatoes. She is planning of buying 400Kg of potatoes with the loan. She gets her supplies in the villages near by Sikasso and sells the potatoes with her family at the main market of Sikasso near the main roundabout. Her clients are men and women who pay cash. She plans of making a monthly profit of 32.500CFA. A part will be use to pay off her loan and pay the interests, the other part will be saved. She wants to increase sales to better satisfy her clients.

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman who lives in Madredijos, Bantayan Cebu. She has a stall in the market where she cooks and sells barbecued food: chicken, port, etc. She also buys and sells dried squid to augment her income. Her husband Jerson, who is 36 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have six children who are between 3 and 13 years old. 

Emma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to purchase ingredients for her food business as well as buy more stocks of dried squid to resell. Emma is working hard so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Emma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production business and buy more dried squid

loans.name: Fidélité Plus Group

texts.en:
Fidélité Plus is a 14-member loan group that is lead by a man named Jean. The members of this loan group are jointly liable for loans issued to them by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Jean is married, 48 years old and operates a general store in eastern Kinshasa. He started his business in 2001 by selling palm oil and has used five loans from Hope (a Democratic Republic of Congo microfinance program) to buy more items to sell to his customers. Because demand for his products is high, he will use his portion of this group loan to buy more items to sell to his customers and continue expanding his business. He earns about $240 a week and devotes most of his income to meet the needs of his eight children, who range in age from 9 and 24 years old. All of them are currently enrolled in school.

loans.use: to expand 14 small businesses

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 51 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a food stall in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase grocery items to sell in her stall.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the food stall for 30 years and also earns an income from a bakeshop.

Lolita aspires to do some home improvements.


*This picture was taken during market day.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Pin

texts.en: Pin K., aged 32, is a married woman who lives in Kopong Tom province. She is a domestic rice seller in Tang Krosang market. She also buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost to mill, and she sells her finished rice to people to earn extra income. Her husband is a fisherman as well as a construction worker. Usually Pin K. generates around $2.5 USD of profit per day to meet the needs of her family. She needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: to stock up on rice when the price is low for future resale.

loans.name: Tim

texts.en: Tim S., 30, sells ice in the busy market of Siem Reap province. She sells both for retail and bulk to her customers at a reasonable price, which attracts many clients. Tim S.’s husband assists her in the ice-selling business as well. They have four kids who study in a public school. Tim Salathe wants to buy a used motorbike for picking up her ice to sell anywhere in and around her community instead of selling from a fixed place. She would like to apply for a loan to buy a second motorcycle. This loan will help improve her business and widen her earning potential.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle for picking up her ice to sell.

loans.name: Lorilane

texts.en:
Lorilane is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 36 years old and married. Lorilane has three school-aged children.

Lorilane has been in the business of selling cosmetics for six years. Each month, Lorilane earns PHP 5,000. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She plans to use this loan to buy lipstick and make-up to sell.

In the future, Lorilane would like to improve her business to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy lipstick and make-up to sell

loans.name: Nina

texts.fr:
Cliente de agee de 35 ans, mariee avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 3 et 8 ans. A la fin des ses etudes en classe de troisieme elle se lance dans le commerce.
En 1997 elle loue une table dans le marche et dans le commerce des produits divers, comme la vente de filets d'oignons, de l'ail des cartons de tomates,dacs d'haricots , sachets de sel fin et le gros sel et des cubes.

Avec le pret qu'il va recevoir elle compte acheter des 2 cartons de tomates,3 filets d'oignons rouges , 2 filets d'oignons blancs, un sac d'haricots jaune de 50kg, 1 sacs d'haricots blancs de 50 kg, des differents qualites de cubes.
Commercante tres entreprenante , elle sait attirer les clients par son accueil et les prix qu'elle propose.
A l'avenir elle tient a devenir une grossiste et avoir une grande boutique pour vendre la marchandise en gros.
texts.en:
This client, aged 35, is married and raising three children who are between three and eight years old. At the end of middle school, she got into sales. 

In 1997 she rented a table in the market and began selling various products such as nets of onions, garlic, tins of tomato paste, sacks of dried beans, bags of ground salt and rock salt, and Maggi cubes. 

With the loan that she is going to receive, she intends to buy two cartons of tomato paste, three nets of red onions, a 50 kg sack of dried yellow beans, one 50 kg sack of white beans and various sorts of flavoring cubes. 

A very enterprising saleswoman, she knows how to attract customers with her welcome and the prices she sets on her goods. In future, she intends to become a wholesaler and have a big shop where she can sell merchandise wholesale.

loans.use: to buy cartons of tomato paste, nets of onions, sacks of dried beans, bags of salt and Maggi cubes.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Maria Auxiliadora II se formo con la union de varias vecinas de la comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní.
El comite denominado María Auxiliadora II es muy conocido en el barrio por ser un grupo muy organizado, donde todas las miembros trabajan muy activamente, de forma responsable y muy sacrificada. ven el trabajo la forma de salir adelante y conseguir mas ingresos para su familia.
La Sra. Mirian, posee una modesta despensa con la cual puede sustentar a sus familiares y a ella misma. Sabe que una ayuda para poder aumentar la variedad de productos le vendria muy bien.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderias, con las cuales podra aumentar su stock de mercaderias con lo cual podra atraer a mas clientes.
texts.en:
The committee Maria Auxiliadora II was formed when various residents of the city of Santaní joined together. The committee known as Maria Auxiliadora II is well-known in the neighborhood for being a very organized group in which all the members work actively, responsibly and with many sacrifices. They see work as a means of getting ahead and obtaining more income for their families. 

Mrs. Mirian owns a small store with which she can support her family members and herself. She knows that getting help in order to increase her variety of products would be a very good thing for her. She is seeking the loan to purchase merchandise with which to be able to increase her stock so she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as groceries, drinks and other products for stocking her store.

loans.name: Ouleye

texts.fr:
Madame Oulèye agée de 44 ans ,loge dans un petit village situé à 90 km de Dakar.Elle a 8 enfants dont la moyenne d’âge est 10 ans.Elle vit avec son mari avec qui elle partage son activité.
Ils font du maraîchage ; activité qu’ils ont hérité de leurs ancêtres.Elle aimerais acquérir d’autres techniques maraîchères  pour pouvoir  maximiser  la rentabilité de son activité
Comme c’est la période des pluies Oulèye veut utiliser le crédit pour acheter des semences et des engrais pour bien préparer  l’hivernage.
Les bénéfices contribueront à faire fasse aux charges alimentaires de la maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oulèye, 44 years old, lives in a small village about 90 km from Dakar.  She has eight children with a median age of 10, and lives with her husband.  Together they are farmers, a trade inherited from their ancestors.  She would like to acquire more farming techniques to increase her business profitability.

Because it is the rainy season Oulèye wants to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to prepare well for the season.  The profits will help pay the family’s food expenses.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and fertilizer before the rainy season

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.es: Alfonsa es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca, tiene 46 años y esta casada y vive con dos de sus cuatro hijos de 17 y 16 años. Sus dos hijas mayores ya se graduaron de la universidad y una recibió título de profesora y la otra de administración de empresa. La de 17 años acaba de ingresar a la Universidad y esta estudiando Economía. Alfonsa utilizará su préstamo para comprar los materiales para las bolsas artesanales que hace y manda para Cusco. Aparte de eso Alfonsa tambien es dueña de un bar y trabaja en eso con su esposo. Ella dice que su esposo le enseñó todo lo que sabe hacer con artesanía. Hace dos años que ella trabaja con FINCA Perú, y lo que mas le gustan son las capacitaciones. Dice que ella aprendió mucho sobre el abuso en las relaciones románticas y la importancia de valorarse como persona y mujer. La meta de Alfonsa es ponerle un techo a el segundo piso de su casa y poder darle mas a sus hijos, específicamente todo lo que necesitan para que sean profesionales.
texts.en: Alfonsa is 46, married and lives with two of her 4 children, who are 16 and 17 years old. Her two oldest daughters are university graduates and live independently, working respectively as a teacher and administrator.  Alfonsa plans to use her credit to buy materials for weaving decorative bags which are sold in Cusco. Alfonsa also manages a small bar with her husband, who she says taught her to produce handcrafts. She has worked with FINCA Perú for the past two years, and has enjoyed participating in their training sessions. She has also learned much about personal values and patterns of relationship abuse. Alfonsa plans to finish the roof on the 2nd floor of her house and to raise her two children to encourage their professional success.

loans.use: to buy materials to support her business selling handcrafts

loans.name: Twunguruzanye Group

texts.fr:
Gérard est un commerçant âgé de 37ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de haricots depuis 6ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’école primaire. 
Le crédit Kiva  de qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de haricots à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TWUNGURUZANYE»
texts.en:
Gérard is a 37 years old merchant who lives in the central area of the country, in the city of Gitega. He has been in the beans retail business for six years. He also is a grower. He went to school up to the primary level. He is married and a father of four children, two of whom are attending primary school.
The 90,000 Burundian francs loan from Kiva he is being granted allows him to increase his capital to purchase large quantities of beans to retail in order to make substantial profits.
He is a member of community group "Twunguruzanye."

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy large quantities of beans to retail in order to make substantial profits

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 32 years old, and her husband Thea is 31 years old. They live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers from the city. They have two children; one is in school and the other one is still young.

Vanna sells roasted beef and roasted chicken wings. Her husband is assisting her in the business. Vanna is asking for a loan of $1,000 to dig a well for her family's use, and to connect her house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: To dig a well for family use, and to connect her house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is an aggressive and active 47-year-old business man. He is married and is blessed with 3 children who are going to school. For the last one year, he has been rearing dairy animals and poultry so as to make a living. He wants in the next 5 years to be supplying milk wholesale.   He is requesting for a loan of 20000 Kenyan shillings to buy poultry and animal feed. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now able to save on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to buy poultry and animal feed

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 24 years old and single. He has been employed as a driver for two years. With the income he gets, he is able to provide for his needs. He joined Faulu Kenya after he was introduced by a friend. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained on business management and he has been able to manage his finances by saving.
Geoffrey is now inspired to start a taxi business. Hence he has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings.

loans.use: To start a taxi business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a more advanced sewing machine

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en:
Khetam is a 44-year-old married woman from A. Russeifeh, Jordan. She is the mother of six children.
Khetam makes accessories from different kind of beads, a business which she operates from her own home. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase more quantities of beads in order to expand her business.
Khetam did not want her picture on the internet for culturA. reasons, so her daughter appears in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase quantities of new beads.

loans.name: Marcos Herminia

texts.es:
Marcos es una mujer muy trabajadora de 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres.

Desde un año ella se dedica a vender panes con pollo y gaseosas, entre otras más, pero esta es la preferida por ella. Este es un negocio que lo aprendió de su mamá, ya que ella se dedicaba a esto y tenia muchos clientes que es algo que le ha favorecido a Marcos.

Ella es la que cuida a sus padres y de las ganancias que obtiene les da lo necesario. Los materiales que utiliza los compra, en unas tiendas situadas a pocas cuadras de su casa, por lo que no tiene que pagar autobús, esas compras las realiza al crédito y paga cuando termina la venta de sus productos. Por lo que Marcos solicita un préstamo para comprar los materiales que necesita de una sola vez y al contado, para comprarlos a mejor precio, de esta forma podrá ayudar más a sus padres. Además desea comprar unas mesas y sillas para que los clientes puedan consumir ahí lo que ella vende.

Ella desea tener un chalet situado en el parque de su comunidad e ir ahorrando de las ganancias, por que la venta la situada a fuera de su casa y cuando llueve no puede salir con su venta, por que se moja, solo coloca una manta granda como techo, pero no es suficiente siempre se moja.
texts.en:
Marcos is a very hard-working woman of 46.  She is single and lives with her parents.

For one year, Marcos has been selling 'panes con pollo' (cooked chicken sandwiches) and soda.  She also sells other products but this is her favorite.  This is a business that she learned from her mom as she used to work in this business and had many customers.  This has been very useful to Marcos.

Marcos looks after her parents and uses the profits she makes to provide them with what they need.  She buys the supplies that she uses in some shops which are located a few blocks from her home so that she doesn't have to pay bus fare.  She makes her purchases on credit and pays when she finishes selling her products.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the supplies that she needs in one go and pay cash for them.  This will enable her to buy them at a better price and so will be able to help her parents more.  In addition, she would also like to buy some tables and chairs so that her customers can eat what she sells on site.

Marcos would like to have a hut in the park in her community and would also like to save her profits.  She currently makes her sales outside her house and when it rains she can't go out and sell her products because they get wet.  She hangs a large blanket up as a roof but it isn't enough and things always get wet.

loans.use: to buy materials for making 'panes con pollo' (paying cash), and to buy some tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Trese Belen Group

texts.es:
El comité Trese Belen es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 16 mujeres que trabajan incansablemente por el bienestar de sus familias e hijos. Son todas señora muy trabajadoras nunca tuvieron problema en el pago de sus responsabilidades.  Ellas desean poder seguir dentro del programa, pues ven en el mismo mucho futuro, ya que les ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Jenifer. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas de toda clase, como ser camisas, pantalones, remeras, bermudas y otros. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, innovadora y muy luchadora. Comenta que todo su esfuerzo es por su familia, ya que quiere darles todo lo mejor y evitar que pasen por privaciones.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y kiva para la compra de prendas de temporada de verano, como ser camisillas, bermudas, remeras y demás, lo cual está teniendo buen arrastre.
texts.en:
The 14 women who form the Trese Belen Committee are from the town of San Lorenzo. They work very hard for the wellbeing of their families and children. All are industrious women who have never had a problem making their repayments. They are keen to continue with the program as they see it as the way of the future. It has already been a great help to them.

One of the members is Sra. Jenifer who earns her living by selling all types of clothing such as shirts, pants, t-shirts, shorts etc. She is known as a hardworking woman, innovative and enterprising. She comments that all her efforts are because of her family as she wishes to give them nothing but the best so that they lack for nothing.

Jenifer is seeking assistance from the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to buy summer clothing such as sleeveless shirts, shorts, t-shirts etc. which are very popular items.

loans.use: to buy sleeveless shirts, shorts, t-shirts etc.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is 30 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is single and has one child. For the past three years, Tadeo has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Tadeo has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phone accessories for resale, and will help Tadeo generate greater profits to pay medical expenses, buy land, and build a house. Tadeo hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business further. 

Tadeo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Tadeo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou a plus 42 ans et vit avec son époux et ses 7 enfants , à Wayerma I, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Madame Oumou s’est initiée à cette activité de restauration depuis plus de quinze ans. Son activité est menée toutes les nuits devant le domicile conjugal à Wayerma I Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après 8 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son huitième prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce présent prêt: 35 poulets, 3 sacs de pomme de terre, 30 paquets de spaghettis, 45kg de poissons frais, 50kg de haricot, 40 sachets d’Attièkè, 35kg de haricot vert et un stock de banane (Aloko). Elle achète ses marchandises sur place.
Les marchandises sont vendues au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes, de jeunes (célibataires) surtout de noctambules. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumou is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and their seven children in Wayerma I, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After attempting many activities without success, Mrs. Oumou started working in the restaurant business over fifteen years ago. She works every night in front of the family residence, and she is in high demand due to the quality of her products.

In order to satisfy a growing customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After eight group loans as a member of a local women’s association, she is now seeking an eighth individual loan. All previous loans were correctly repaid. 

She will use this new credit to buy 35 chickens, 3 bags of potatoes, 30 packages of spaghetti, 45 kg of fresh fish, 50 kg of beans, 40 packets of Attieke, 35 kg of green beans and a supply of bananas (Aloko). She buys her stock locally.

She sells for cash and credit to a clientele composed of women, young unmarried people, and especially night owls. She plans to earn a monthly profit of 175,000 FCFA that she will use primarily to contribute to family expenses and pay the interest on the loan. Any remainder will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy food supplies for her restaurant business

loans.name: Fadhili

texts.en:
Fadhili is a married man with nine school going children. He owns a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

Fadhili has operated a retail shop for the past year. In addition he owns a rental house. His potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. He dreams of owning another rental house.

With the Kshs 100,000 he wants to purchase more stocks of rice, sugar and maize flour for his shop and also renovate his rental house. He decided to join Yehu to get capital to improve his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of rice, sugar and maize flour for his shop and also to renovate his rental house.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
SOUTOURA est un regroupement constitué essentiellement de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygamiques à SANOUBOUGOU I  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
ROKIA, assise en première position à partir de la gauche fait le commerce de savon.
Elle compte acheter, des bidons d’huile et de la soude caustique qu’elle transformera en savon et les revend en détail et en gros au grand marché de Sikasso à une place fixe et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
SOUTOURA is a group made up of married women who are, on average, 35 years old and have four children.  They live mostly in polygamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the main districts in the city of Sikasso.
They are on their fourth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of meeting the demand of their customers.  
Rokia, seated at the far left, is in the business of buying and selling soap. 
She plans to buy cans of oil and caustic soda that she will make into soap and sell at retail and wholesale in the main market in Sikasso, in a fixed location as well as within the family, to a clientele of men and women, on credit. 
She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to pay the loan with interest.  The rest will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making soap.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 55 years old and married to Rael. The couple has five children. For the past 20 years, James has been a farmer and he earns a monthly income of 2,000 KES. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan.

James is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy more farm equipment and machinery.

loans.use: to buy farm machinery and equipment

loans.name: Mouroukpé Elise

texts.fr:
Mouroukpé est une femme âgé(e) 26 ans. Elle est mariée à un  mécanicien avec 03 enfants en charge.
Mouroukpé travaille comme revendeuse de pagnes, des bijoux,(boucles d'oreilles,chaines) et de sacs depuis 2003. Elle achète à Cotonou et au Grand marché de Lomé et vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place.
Mouroukpé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et bijoux pour répondre à la demande de la population en cette période de fête de fin d’année.
Dans les prochaines années, Mouroukpé voudrait agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Mouroukpé is a 26-year-old woman. She is married to a mechanic and financially supports three children.  Mouroukpé has been working as a reseller of "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics), jewelery and bags since 2003. She sells to customers in a local neighborhood after buying her merchandise in Cotonou and at the Grand Market in Lomé. Mouroukpé has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy some "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) and jewelry, to meet the demand of the local population during the Holiday Season. In the coming years, Mouroukpé would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics), jewelery and bags.

loans.name: Beatriz Maria

texts.es: Beatriz de 34 años, habitante de la zona Urbana de Nueva Guinea,labora como docente de primaria en la comarca en Torno,  solicita su 3er crédito para Invertirlo en gastos de titulacion y de esta manera obtener su titulo de licenciada en ciencias de la educacion, su esposo trabaja en la pequeña finca que ellos poseen se dedica a la siembra de raices y tuberculos y la agricultura de granos basicos ambos se ayudan con los gastos,  en su comunidad es una persona con buenas referencias, al igual que en su trabajo.   Su sueño ser una licenciada con mucha experiencia y impartir clases de secundaria y ayudar a su familia ya que son personas bien humildes y de escasos economicos.
texts.en: Beatriz, 34 years old, lives in the urban area of Nueva Guinea. She works as a primary school teacher in the surrounding rural area. She is asking for her third loan for degree expenses so she can obtain her college degree in education science. Her husband works on the small farm they own; he grows roots and tubers and basic grains. Both of them help with expenses. She has good references in her community and in her work. Her dream is to be a graduate with a lot of experience and teach secondary school classes and help her family, since they are pretty humble people with scarce economic resources.

loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es:
El señor José, es una persona  muy  trabajadora dedicada  100% a su negocio,  vive con sus 2 hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca,  en  el  sur de  Honduras.  Y tiene  más  de 8 años de tener el negocio de venta de medicamentos.
Don José el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de medicinas como vitaminas, negrobion, sinovita, ibuprofeno, manteca de cacao, cofal y articol. De  esta manera  incrementar más  sus ventas. Con el préstamo  espera  incrementar  sus  ventas  y  a si  satisfacer y mejorar las  necesidades de sus clientes. El Espera  tener  mejores  ingresos  para  tener  mejor  forma  de  vida.
Los Sueños de Don José son tener  su propio  local y  de esta manera vender  más  Y poder  dejarles  a sus  hijos   el  negocio como patrimonio.
Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de vitaminas, negrobion, sinovita, ibuprofeno, manteca de cacao, cofal y articol para su negocio

loans.name: Missessin Group

texts.fr: MISSESSIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans. Véronique est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Véronique n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Véronique vend des légumes et des condiments de façon ambulante. Véronique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et de renforcer son activité, Véronique sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSESSIN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments et des légumes.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe was a mother and father of a kid of 6 years old, who in a moment was take care from his grandmother, time later his grandmother sickened and Maria had the necessity to change of job, looking for another kind of job she needed the way to obtain an income and support her family. This necessity made her to take the decision of start her own business and she decided in a general store business. Actually Maria has 40 years old and her son is 21 years and he is studding right now; the Maria’s business allows her to pay the son\'s studies and covers all the family expenses.

Maria has an established business, she try to has low cost and the beast service in her business to increment her sales and incomes, for this reason she is requesting for a loan of USD $ 1,825 to purchase and electric equipment (as a light generation with gas or diesel) to her business and from that way she will has a low light cost that is very high in Monterrey. Maria offers to repay this loan in a period of 6 to 12 months and thanks for your help and support.

** \\\"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\\\"

María Guadalupe era madre y padre al mismo tiempo de un niño de 6 años, el cual por algún tiempo fue cuidado por su abuela materna, al enfermar esta, María tuvo que dejar su trabajo y buscar otra forma de obtener el sustento para su familia y la necesidad la llevo a pensar en la apertura de un negocio, el cual decidió hacerlo en venta de abarrotes. Actualmente María tiene 40 años y su hijo tiene 21 años de edad y se encuentra estudiando; el negocio de Mary le ha permitido pagar los estudios de su hijo y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Actualmente María ya tiene su negocio establecido y ve la forma de ahorrar costos y hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su hijo necesita continuar estudiando y tiene que cubrir los gastos de su familia. Por lo que esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de USD $ 1,825 para poder adquirir una sub-estación eléctrica que funciona como un generador de luz para su tienda lo que le abarata el costo de la luz que ella consume y es un costo muy caro en la ciudad de Monterrey. Ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un periodo de 6-12 meses y agradece su cooperación y ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase and electric equipment

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married and has one child. He has been in the ice cream business for the three years, mainly serving school children. He is educated to level 8, but was unable to afford school fees for further education.

He will use his loan to buy a fridge which will enable him to serve more schools in Kisumu.

He will use his profits to open a business for his wife, educate the children, and furnish his house. He also will help his aging parents.

loans.use: purchase of equipment

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widow. She is 43 years old. She runs a fruit and vegetable stall near her residence. She has been in this business for six years now. Since her husband passed away, it has been very difficult for her to raise the family. The business she runs generates the family's income. Her sister helps her to operate the business.

Asha plans to buy a cart, which will make it easier for her to carry fruits and vegetables from the market to her business premises. She also wants to buy display cages to display the products attractively and purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables. To implement this plan, she needs a loan of USD 550.

loans.use: To purchase a cart, display cages, and a stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en: Nataliya owns a profitable women’s clothing sales business at the busy Rushski Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having successfully run her business for the past ten years. Nataliya would like to expand her business and appreciates the financial assistance she has received from Nadiya Ukraine so far. One of her other business goals is to be able to generate sufficient income so that she can help her 23-year-old daughter pay her college tuition. Nataliya has therefore requested a loan of 5,000 Ukrainian Hrivna or US$1,000 to use as working capital to purchase additional clothing inventory.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Mrs. Catherine K. is a married  woman of  four children. She produces  and sells the local childrens' and students'   favourite, a porridge called "AKASSA".  She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients and materials  to  enable her to make more  AKASSA. She is requesting  300 dollars. With that amount, she will be able to increase  her business, make a profit and be able to reimburse that amount within  12 months
She is  a member  of  a HELP Africa Women group called Patience. 

  .

loans.use: To process cereals such as millet or maize and make local poridge called  AKASSA

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Description of Business

Doña Modesta earns a living by making uniforms for businesses and P.E. uniforms for schools. Modesta has 25 years of experience in this business. With a little bit of capital she established her own little workshop in her own house. Modesta attends her clients as early as 8am until as late as 8pm. Modesta serves clients that live both inside and outside of her neighborhood.

Use of the Loan

Modesta is requesting this loan so that she will be able to buy materials for business. She would like to buy materials for Christmas, since there is a great demand for items made of this material during the Christmas season. Also, because of the economic level of clients she has begun to attract, she needs to increase the variety of merchandise that she has to offer. She wants all of her clients to receive the best products and service possible.

Personal Information

Modesta is 43 years old and she lives with her three children. She is able to pay for all three of them to be in school. This is thanks to the money that she has earned by working hard. Her home is humble yet warm and charming. Modesta’s dream is to continue to be successful in her business and to make it grow as much as possible so that she can increase her income for the wellbeing of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela and Kendra of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Descripción del Negocio

Dona Modesta se dedica a la confección de uniformes para empresas y también uniformes para educación física a Escuelas y Colegios. Modesta tiene experiencia en este negocio 25 años. Con pequeño capital inicio su taller el mismo que lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio. Modesta atiende a sus clientes desde 8am, hasta las 20pm. Modesta presta su servicio dentro y fuera del sector donde vive.

Uso del Préstamo

Modesta solicita el crédito para comprar más materiales como telas navideñas, ya que por vísperas de navidad necesita incrementar este tipo de material. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, Modesta se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su mercadería, para de esa manera tener a sus clientes muy bien atendidos.

Información Personal

Modesta tiene 43 años de edad, en donde solo vive con sus 3 hijos, que actualmente los tienen estudiando, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza en su actividad a podido darles esa oportunidad de estudio, además su domicilio es de estructura mixta pero acogedora. Los anhelos de Modesta es salir con su negocio adelante y extenderlo mucho más y así incrementar su capital, por el bienestar de sus hijos y del negocio.

loans.use: Buy more materials in preparation for Christmas

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. Blessing U. is 26 years old and married with a child. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a hairdresser by profession; she fixes hair, braids hair, sells weavon, hair cream, etc. to people living in her community. She learned this business in a year and opened hers in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $875 to enable her to buy weavon, relaxer and hair cream to sell.

loans.use: Blessing would like to buy more weavon, hair cream and a refrigerator for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Carmen Eddy

texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old and has five children. The youngest one is still in school, while the others already have their own families. For the last four years Carmen has been part of the Communal Bank “Bienestar II”, or “Well Being II” thanks to an invitation from her friend who had already been working with her bank for five years. Carmen has been selling groceries for the last seven years. With a loan of 3000 soles, she hopes to expand her business by adding more products like sugar, rice, soap, milk, shampoo, and other things. She will use her savings to buy a car to transport her merchandise from where she buys it to where her grocery store is located, thus saving time and money on transport. Her dream is to further develop her business and to open a second store in the jungle.
Carmen is very happy being a member of her Communal Bank. She has learned to be responsible, to be a friend to the other women in her group, and to feel like part of a sisterhood. The Communal Bank has also taught her how to take care of her children. Carmen is thankful to Morenita who was the one who taught her the value of not waiting for her husband to do something for the family, but to work herself.

loans.use: Expansion of a business through purchase of more products like sugar, rice, soap, milk, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Florence N.. She is currently in the business of running a saloon and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her business. Florence is 23 years old and single. Each week, Florence makes approximately UGX 30,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy another dryer.

Florence is joined in her small group by Gorrettie N., Catherine N., Jane N., and Sharifa N.. Gorrettie N. is currently in the business of running a saloon and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to expand the business.

Catherine N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to expand the business.

Jane N. is currently in the business of running a market stall and is requesting a loan of UGX 200,000 to expand the business.

Sharifa N. is currently in the business of running a market stall and is requesting a loan of UGX 200,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Victory Nabingo B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase chicken feed. Jane is 42 years old and is single. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more chicks.

Jane is joined in her small group by Cathy B., Betty M., Gladys N., and Proscovia N.. Cathy B. has a business running a bar and wants to add more furniture. Betty M. is currently operating a market stall business and wants a loan to increase stock. Gladys N. operates a market stall business and wants to cement the stall shade. Proscovia N. is currently in the business of operating a market stall and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add capital to poultry business

loans.name: Deyci

texts.es:
Mrs. Deyci Jaico P. is 24 years old and is studying the specialty of dental prostheses in an institute. She has two dependent children. She lives in the sector El Milagro in the district and province of Trujillo, Department of La Libertad, Peru.

Deyci has set up a bakery in her home, and has made room to put in a store where she will take the opportunity to sell the bread that she makes.

She is part of the Interim Group “Amor y Paz” (Love and Peace) where she obtained her first loan of 300.00 PEN (about $120.00 ), money to buy the ingredients to make all types of breads.

With this loan of $200.00 (500.00 PEN) which will be paid in four months she will buy two sacks of flour, one sack of sugar, and the rest of the money she will invest in buying groceries to stock her store.

Her biggest dream is to implement and modernize her bakery in order to offer better quality bread for her community.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Deyci Jaico P. tiene 24 años de edad, actualmente se encuentra estudiando en un instituto la especialidad de prótesis dental. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el sector El Milagro en el distrito de Trujillo provincia de la misma en el departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Deyci ha instalado una panadería en su domicilio, como así también ha ambientado un lugar para poner una tienda en la que aprovecha en vender el pan que elabora.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto ”Amor y Paz” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 dinero con el cual comprara los ingredientes para la elaboración del pan de todo tipo.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en cuatro meses comprará dos sacos de harina, 1 saco de azúcar y el resto de dinero lo invertirá para comprar abarrotes para surtir su tienda.

Su mayor sueño es implementar y modernizar su panadería, de esa manera ofrecer un pan de mejor calidad para su comunidad.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy flour, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Claret Antonia

texts.es:
Claret O. is currently facing the need to reconstruct her home in the Villanueva municipality in Chinandega. She would like to do this to improve the living conditions of her three children, who need her support to progress.

After starting the reconstruction of her home, the project was put on hold due to financial reasons. Today, however, she very wisely wishes to proceed with this project being that the winter season is quickly approaching, and to avoid health problems and colds for her children, she has decided to apply for a loan from Ceprodel to purchase construction materials such as zinc sheets and bricks. Through this form of support, she will benefit as well as her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Claret O. es una dama que actualmente atraviesa la necesidad de reconstruir su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de Chinandega. Esto con el hecho de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus tres hijos que necesitan de su apoyo para salir adelante.

Al haber iniciado la reconstrucción de la vivienda esta obra se vio paralizada por el motivo del factor económico. Sin embargo, hoy en día muy sabiamente desea iniciar nuevamente con el proceso de reconstrucción debido a que pronto inicia el invierno y para evitar problemas de enfermedad y resfríos en sus hijos decide hacer un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de los materiales como laminas de zinc y ladrillos. Por medio de este apoyo se beneficia tanto ella como su familia.

loans.use: Purchase materials such as metal sheets and bricks for the reconstruction of her home.

loans.name: Sokha Lay Group

texts.en: Five people in Sala Lek Pram village form one group, whose group leader is Mrs. Sokha L.. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to the villagers. In order to make her business more successful, Mrs. Sokha L. wants to expand her business; thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more rice and fish to prepare her delicious rice soup to sell for an income. Mrs. Sokha L. is 51 and the mother of three children, all of whom are employed in garment factories. Her husband, Mr. Eang Chea Kean, is a chief soldier.

loans.use: Buy more rice and fish to prepare her delicious rice soup to sell for an income.

loans.name: Siradio

texts.fr:
Siradio K. is a young and very ambitious baker. He wants to build up his inventory of flour and increase his production. With his business, he founded a food shelter and participates in the fight against malnutrition in southern Senegal.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Siradio K. est un jeune boulanger trés ambitieux, il veut renforcer son stock de farine et augmenter sa production. Avec son activité, il a fondé un foyer et contibue à la lutte contre la malnutrition au sud Sénégal

loans.use: bakery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of underwear for her small business.

loans.name: Almas

texts.en: Almas (his son is pictured) was born in 1961. He lives in Khachmaz town. Almas has been in this business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the pesticides and fertilizer necessary for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Inn

texts.en: Mrs. Inn K. lives in Takol Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chou Morn, are farmers who get a small rice revenue from the small piece of land that they own. In order to expand their revenue, Mrs. Inn K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to buy a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Mrs. Inn K. is 58 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom owns a small beauty salon, while the remaining three attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a 0.5 hectare field to cultivate rice

loans.name: Mrs. Um Or's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank located in Bompong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province consists of nine people and they plan to use the loan which they hope to obtain fO. different purposes.

Mrs. Um O. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Sin C., is an animal catcher who goes hunting in the forest. They have five children, one of whom is a fisherman while the other two assist their father in the business. The remaining two are attending the local school. Their first child's business now faces a small problem because his boat motO. needs to be repaired so that child cannot catch fish to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Um O. decided to ask fO. a loan to buy a new boat motO. fO. her child to restart his fishing business.

Mrs. Kom N. and Mrs. Yav K. did not come to the meeting but their husbands were there, so they are present in the picture instead of their wives. Mrs. Men Yoem is a group guarantee and she is also shown in the picture in the village bank loan.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the other has a monthly payment loan. These members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poO.. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new boat motor for her first child to restart his fishing business

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia D. sells charcoal which is a source of fuel for those who cannot afford to buy gas and she also sells soft drinks at a place called Air Force near Shama. Felicia has received primary education and she is married with one child. Her husband is a military officer. Felicia has been selling charcoal since 2001. She is responsible for paying utility bills and the financial expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more charcoal for sale since demand for it is very high. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Felicia would like to buy more charcoal to sell since demand for it is very high.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is a trader at Abrobemu near Elmina. She is single and has five dependents. She sells fabric and kitchen utensils, which she has been doing since 2002. She has received education through senior high school.

Mary will use the extra money from this loan to buy more materials and kitchen utensils to sell at the market. She plans to use the money gained from her expanded business to cater for her family and also save towards a house she wants to build for her children.

loans.use: To buy more materials and kitchen utensils to sell at the market.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Bình  năm nay 45  tuổi, chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và ba con tại huyện Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An. Chị Bình tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2005. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là sản xuất bún và chăn nuôi. Hàng ngày chồng và các con chị  sản xuất bún tại nhà  còn chị đem sản phẩm đi bán cho các hàng ăn và bán lẻ tại chợ cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc sản xuất của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi B., aged 45, is living in Nghi Loc town, Nghe An Province with her husband and her three children. She has been a member of TYM Fund since 2005. The family’s source of income is from selling vermicelli and raising poultry. Her husband and her children make vermicelli at home, and then Mrs. B. sells it in the market and some restaurants. Their monthly income is 3000000 VND. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 10000000 VND ($575) to purchase ingredients for making vermicelli.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa.
Blanca es casada, tiene 61 años, cuatro hijos mayores que están casados.  
Blanca es del departamento D.  Lambayeque, Motupe, solo estudió hasta segundo D. primaria por que su papá no quiso estudie, desD. niña se puso a trabajar con su mama vendiendo comida, con el tiempo se caso, se vino a vivir a  Lima,  trabajando en casas por ocho años. Su esposo tiene una carpintería, ella decidió trabajar con su esposo en su carpintería aprendió a Lijar, laquear barnizar. 
DesD. que esta en Finca tiene capital para poder comprar material y atender pedidos, le gusta las reuniones del Bancomunal por que ha hecho buenas amigas.   
Blanca necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles, para la compra D. madera, laca, clavos, para la carpintería.
El sueño D. Blanca es que su negocio crezca, tener más ahorros para viajar a ver a sus hijos que están en otro país.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the Bancomunal Medalla Milagrosa. Blanca is married and is 61-years old. She has four children who are also married. Blanca is from the Lambayeque township in Motupe. She has only a second graD. education as her father did not want her to study. As a child she worked with her mother selling meals. Over some time she eventually lived in Lima working in houses for 8-years.

Her husband is a carpenter and Blanca decided to join her husband’s business of carpentry to learn how to sand, lacquer and coat. With this loan, she will be able to purchase materials and fill orders. She likes meeting with other members of Bancomunal as she has maD. great friendships. Blanca requests 1000 soles, to buy wood and nails for carpentry. Her dream is to have her own business that will allow her to travel more to see her children in other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for carpentry.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: Giovanna tiene 39 años, es casada  y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Es una mujer muy activa, pues va cambiando de productos de venta, según la temporada que hay en el trascurso del año, dedicándose ahora a la venta de dulces y bebidas heladas en las calles de su localidad, pues encontró un espacio donde todos los días instala su puesto, sale a partir de la 8 de la mañana a ofrecer las diversas bebidas y dulces para las personas que transitan por ahí, tornándose un actividad muy cansada, ya que todo el día atiende a sus clientes que acuden a comprar sus antojitos al puesto de Giovanna. Sin embargo, ser ambulante no le ayuda a mejorar su negocio, es por ello que desea instalar una tienda en su casa y dejar de salir todas las mañanas a exponerse al sol. Giovanna esta trabajando con MFP hace más de 10 años, este en su quinceavo préstamo, el que permanezca durante tanto tiempo en la institución es producto de una buena organización y consolidación de su grupo. Ella requiere 1500 soles para la compra de mercadería y surtir su pequeño puesto de venta con variados productos.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 39 years old, married and lives in a house she owns with her husband and two children. She is a very energetic woman who changes the goods she sells depending on the season. For now, she is selling candies and cold drinks in the streets of her neighbourhood. She has found a spot where she sets up her stall every day, leaving at 8:00 in the morning to offer her various refreshments and candies to passers-by. This is a very tiring activity as all day she attends to her clients who come to buy her snacks. Nevertheless, been a street vendor does not help her improve her business and because of this she wants to open a store in her home so that she no longer has to leave home every morning to spend the day exposed to the sun. Giovanna has been working with MFP for more than 10 years; this is her 15th loan. Anyone who remains for such a long time with the institution [MFP] has shown they are a good organizer and work well with their group. She needs 1,500 soles to buy merchandise and stock her little stall with a variety of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Happyness

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Happiness B. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, aged two and four. Happiness has been running a café called Café/Mama Lishe since 2007. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), and plantain (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of sauces. She works at the business for twelve hours a day, six days a week and is assisted by two employees. Happiness currently earns about $120 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase rice, wheat flour, eggs and cooking oil. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Happiness thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use their business equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, which enables them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To  purchase rice, wheat flour, eggs and cooking oil

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice J. sells cooking oil, tomatoes and oranges and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Joice is 42 years old and is married to a business man. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Open up a shop.

loans.name: Tui

texts.en: Tui I., 30, is married with 3 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 380 Tala.  SPBD loans are Tui’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase knives, spade, knapsack sprayer, axe, chemicals etc.

loans.name: Asror

texts.ru:
Асрор  Исроилов  таксист, но это не основной источник дохода в его семье, кроме этого он занимается сельским хозяйством, и животноводством. Дома у Асрора 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, откормом и перепродажей которых он занимается. Это и есть основной и главный источник его дохода. Асрор женат, у него 3 детей, которых надо содержать. Жена Асрора домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Благодаря своему трудолюбию Асрору удается успевать работать и на поле (выращивать сельхозкультуры), и дома (откармливать скот), и подрабатывать таксистом (развозить пассажиров по месту требования).
Он запрашивает займ в размере 500 сомони и хочет потратить его на закуп корма для своего скота.
texts.en:
Asror I. is a taxi driver, but that is not the main source of his family's income. In addition, he farms and raises livestock. At home, Asror has seven head of large-horned cattle, which he fattens and resells, and that is his main source of income. Asror is married, and has three children whom he needs to support. His spouse is a housewife and cares for the children. Thanks to his diligence, Asror has succeeded in working in the fields growing crops, at home raising cattle, and earning additional income as a taxi driver transporting passengers locally. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 somoni to spend on the purchase of cattle feed.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle feed

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: Mrs. Merlita B., 44 years old, is married and is a resident of Sta. Cruz, Ozamiz City. She is married to a Barangay Councilor and they are blessed with two children. Their main source of income comes from their business named Eddie’s Barbecue located at Port Road Ozamiz City with main products of chicken and pork barbecue. They also offer other foods for breakfast, lunch and dinner in their eatery. They were able to send their children to college with the help of this business. As an active regular member of PAGLAUM MPC, she was able to avail multiple loans already. Now she is applying for an amount of P25,000.00 to add to her capital for purchasing raw chicken, pork and even fish and other ingredients to be used in their business. Her plan for business is to have a big restaurant someday. For her family, her plan is to give a better education to her children for their good future.

loans.use: Additional capital for barbecue business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda F. is 59 years old, separated from her spouse and has four adult children. She is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City. To make a living, Erlinda owns a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. Erlinda has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement the income of her family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a store

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en:
Bernice A. is a young entrepreneur who did not receive any formal education. Bernice sells kenkey and fried fish at the old taxi rank in Kpando, which she has done since 2000. Kenkey is a Ghanaian dish which is prepared from fermented corn dough that is cooked and wrapped in the corn husk and eaten with hot pepper.

Bernice uses her income to pay for her water and electricity utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase maize and fresh fish to fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Bernice plans to invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase maize and fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Faraja borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 35-year-old woman, married, and mother of 2 children. Her children are ages 16 and 3.

Patricia started her own business selling chickens 6 years ago. She works 7 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 400,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Patricia’s second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 450,000 Tsh in order to buy more chickens. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Patricia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chickens

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
M. was born in 1975; she is a married woman and blessed with a son and a daughter. Both of them are pupils in the local public school. Her husband Vanak, 39, works driving a motorbike taxi. M. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living.

Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for M. and her family, M. has requested a loan of US$ 200 in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork commands the highest price. She proposes to begin selling a few grocery items as well, using the remainder of her loan.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en: Hagar is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one son and one daughter who are both still in school. Hagar works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells beverages by the roadside in her community. Hagar procures her raw materials from nearby towns at moderate prices. She has been in business for more than 10 years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Nadya Group

texts.en: Nadya is the group leader of Nadya group. There are four members in this group. They requested a group loan of 56,000 Afghani. Nadya wants to take a loan for their tailoring business. And Rahema wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of running a general store. Also Sajeda wants to take a loan for her brother’s video shop. Bahdar K. wants to take a loan for his business. They want to expand and promote their business.

loans.use: Expand and promote their business

loans.name: Sengemaa

texts.en: Sengemaa is 45 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Two of her children are studying at university while her youngest child is in secondary school. Sengema owns a successful local dairy trading business in her town .  Because her husband is handicapped, this business is the sole income for the family. She started her business in 2006 with working capital of 60,000 tugrug (~42 USD). Since then, her business has improved and now her working capital exceeds 500,000 tugrug (~350 USD). Her dream is to buy a bigger ger so that her large family will be more comfortable. She is requesting a 550,000 tugrug (~380 USD) loan to purchase more dairy products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy products

loans.name: Aïssatou Ibrahima

texts.fr: Aïssatou Ibrahima D. est une femme de 64 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TENGHORY DIAMALAYE depuis 7 ans. Elle a eu à y bénéficier de 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de pâte d'arachide et d'oignon. Elle contribue à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Aïssatou Ibrahima D. is 64 years old, married and the mother of 10 children. She has been a member for seven years of the Banc Villageois (or "Village Bank") of TENGHORY DIAMALAYE. She has been the beneficiary of 14 loans that she has always repayed without any diffculty. She is currently developing a small business selling dough made from peanut and onion. She helps contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small business

loans.name: Agil

texts.en:
Agil was born in 1988. He lives in Fuzuli region. 4 years ago he started taxi business. He is single.
Now this young man seeks a loan of 1500 AZN to buy the spare parts to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Heraclides

texts.es:
Heraclides tiene 52 años, está separado de la madre de sus 5 hijos, pero ellos viven con él en su casa. 

Aunque el amor no le ha sonreído para toda la vida cuenta con la gratitud y el cariño de sus hijos, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo, pues por ello trabaja con mucha responsabilidad en cada una de las contratas de macheteo o  limpieza de chacras que realiza. Así, se ha ganado la confianza de la gente de su pueblo, pues siempre le dan trabajo y con estas ganancias logra alimentar y educar a sus hijos.
Pero Heraclides también tiene sus propios cultivos de café y plátanos, a las que se dedica cuando no trabaja como operario. Él se siente muy feliz de labrar la tierra, gracias a esta habilidad ha podido dinamizar su economía, y ahora que han crecido sus hijos piensa  incrementar sus cultivos de café con la ayuda de ellos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y vienen ratificando su compromiso de seguir trabajando como hasta ahora, responsablemente, con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, pues quiere seguir contando con préstamos posteriores. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de platitas de café y fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Heraclides is 52 years-old and is separated from the mother of his 5 children, though they live with him in his house. Though love has not smiled on Heraclides for his whole life, he always has the gratitude and affection of his children, who are the reason for his efforts. For them Heraclides works very responsibly on every machete-clearing contract and field cleaning job he gets. By doing so, he has earned the trust of the townspeople, and now they always give him work. With these earnings he succeeds in providing food and education for his children. Heraclides also has his own coffee and plantain crops, which he works on when he has no other work. He likes working the land a lot, and thanks to his skill he has been able to increase his earnings. Now that his children are grown up, he plans to expand his crops of coffee with their help. This is Heraclides' second loan with MFP, and he promises to continue responsibly working as he has in the past, by making the payments on time, especially since he would like to receive more loans in the future. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase small coffee plants and chemical fertilizers for the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and coffee plants

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose is 37 years old and married with 2 children. Her husband is an engineer. She sells electrical materials at the front of her house in Ibadan, Oyo State. She is a friendly woman and she uses her friendliness to attract more customers to her stall. She is very happy because she does not have to pay stall rent. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Elisa es socia del Banco Comunal “Gran Poder” desde hace 5 años, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales de la región.
Elisa nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar papa, chuño, tunta, cebada, cañihua, quinua, etc.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia en Ilave y su propio capital par continuar trabajando.
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Elisa has been a member of the "Gran Poder" (Great Power) Village Bank for five years. She lives in the Llave District, El Collao Province in the Department of Puno. She's 30-years-old, married, and has one child. She is educated through secondary school and earns her living buying and selling cereals in her region. She tells us that she used her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 300 soles, to increase her capital. She's seeking a loan for 2,000 soles which she'll use to buy potatoes, chuño (dried potatoes), tunta (white chuño), barley, canihua (similar to quinoa), quinoa, etc. Elisa's dream for the future is to have her own house in Llave and her own capital to continue working. What she likes most about her village bank is how punctual the members are when attending meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, chuño (potato flour), chuño (white chuño), barley, canihua, and quinoa

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr: Oumou K. est âgée de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de COLOBANE FASS depuis le 16 mai 2007 et a eu une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour l'avoir contracté à 07 fois de suite. Elle vend dans son quartier des effets vestimentaires qu'elle achète au Mali (pays limitrophe). Elle participe à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Oumou K. is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Colobane Fass since May 16, 2007 and has had a good credit experience with seven consecutive loans.
