She sells in her neighborhood clothing items that she buys in Mali (a neighboring country). She helps take charge of family care.

Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her clothing retail business

loans.name: Kirima United Sande Scovia Group

texts.en: S. Scovia is a hard-working businesswoman of forty years, married with five children, all schooling. She has been operating a retail shop business for ten years. Due to having little capital she is using the loan to inject more capital into her business for improvement (sugar, soap, salt, flour, paraffin, bread, sodas, and so forth). She is a promising business lady whose future hope is to educate her children.

loans.use: To inject more capital into her business for improvement (sugar, soap, salt, flour, paraffin, bread, sodas, and so forth)

loans.name: Arlene's Group

texts.en:
Arlene H. is from the village of Little Tadian, Alfonsolista, Ifugao. She is 25 years old. Arlene is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Arlene is married and has one infant. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is a private entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She owns a women’s footwear sales business in one of the local marketplaces called “Yubileinyi”. Zhanna has her own loyal clientele. She has been in this trade for seven years. Presently, she has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. 

Zhanna is requesting a 6,000 Grivnya loan to increase her turnover capital and purchase additional merchandise. She is hoping to open new vending locations and expand her trade as a result. Zhanna has had a perfect credit history. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital and purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Wallece

texts.en:
Wallece is a 27-year-old married man. He has been selling shoes in Kawangware open-air market for four years. He is a very hardworking man who hopes to have a well-established business. Therefore, he has requested for a loan Kes 20,000 to add to his stock of shoes.

This is going to be Wallece’s first loan from Faulu Kenya. He really appreciates the organization for teaching him how to save his money. He dreams of growing his business into a wholesale business in the future.

loans.use: To add to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Jose Wilder

texts.es:
El señor Jose Wilder S. Rodríguez  tiene 44 años y está casado hace 22 años con la señora Senaida Gongora de S. y tienen tres hijos 2 mujeres y un hombre la mayor tiene 20 años la que le sigue 18 años y el menor tiene 15 años, viven en su casa propia que con esfuerzo han conseguido tras años de ahorrar.
 
El señor Jose Wilder se dedica al servicio de taxi trabajando de chofer desde hace 4 años la señora le ayuda a su esposo trabajando como bibliotecaria en un colegio ambos trabajan para construir su casa de material de construcción mejor que con el que cuentan actualmente ya que está construida de adobe y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Ellos requieren el dinero para terminar de construir su casa y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y poder darle una mejor casa donde vivir a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose Wilder S. Rodríguez, 44, has been married to Senaida Góngora de S. for 22 years. They have three children, two girls and a boy. The oldest is 20, the next is 18, and the youngest is 15. They live in their own house, which he got through great effort and years of saving. Jose Wilder has worked as a taxi driver for four years. His wife helps him by working as a librarian in a school. They both work to build their house from better construction material. It is currently built from adobe. This way they would be able to improve their quality of life. They need the money to finish building their house and improve their quality of life. They will then be able to give their children a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material for his house

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 40-year-old mother of two. She runs a salon and a cosmetic shop to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and has two employees. Her business is located in Zimmerman in the outskirts of Nairobi city.  She had previously taken out a loan of KES 50,000 from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business and she successfully repaid. She hopes to grow her business and offer better education to her children in the future. She has requested for a loan of KES 50,000 to add stock of hair chemicals, nail polish and beauty products.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals, nail polish and beauty products

loans.name: Osvaldo Elias

texts.pt:
Osvaldo Elias M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 22 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 5 e 1 anos de idade, ainda não vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou porque não conseguiu ingressar a Universidade. Vive na casa dos pais com a sua família e sustenta seus pais que vivem com ele.
Nunca saiu de Boane, cresceu e estudou sempre neste Distrito. Trabalha na empresa de construção de estradas e pontes, ECMEP ha mais de 4 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.300.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 5º empréstimo no valor de 21.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, ferro, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.200.00mt, 3.200.00mt, 13.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt para a Habitação e bens de consumo.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua residência e iniciar uma actividade comercial para aumentar a renda.
texts.en:
Osvaldo Elias M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is 22, married, and father to two children aged 5 and 1, who do not yet go to school. Osvaldo finished twefth grade but did not continue because he was not accepted to University. He lives in his parents' house with his family and also supports his parents, who live with him. He never left Boane; he grew up and studied always in this District. For more than four years he has worked for ECMEP, a road and bridge construction company. He has no employees and has a monthly salary of 4,300 meticais. He uses the money for household expenses and still manages to save some in his bank account. Osvaldo has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers at this institution. This loan for 21,000 meticais is his fifth. He plans to buy construction material (sand, cement, iron, beams and other items) to continue construction on his house. The earlier loans were for 7,200 meticais, 3,200 meticais, 13,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais. They were used for the house and consumer goods. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can maintain his credit. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to finish his house and begin a commercial activity to increase his income.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (sand, cement, iron, beams and other products)

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is 43-years-old, married, and has four sons. She lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for the last 20 years. She is a very shy lady. She loves to take care of her family. She is known for the best hospitality among her neighbors. Her husband is a shop keeper. He has been running a grocery shop in the main market for the last 10 years. He has a good reputation among his customer. As his shop is located in the main market, he has to face the competition with other shopkeepers. 

Asia has successfully repaid her first loan to Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva) and now she is applying for the second loan. She will use the funds to purchase groceries (lentils, cooking oil, spices and rice) in bulk. Her husband keeps these items in his grocery shop and retains his customers by completing their requirements on time.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk for the grocery shop.

loans.name: Maria Montiel

texts.es:
Maria Montiel C. es una señora de 51 años de edad la cual vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una comunidad llamada Hernández localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa con grandes paisajes, presenta una gran humedad y además se encuentra sobre la carretera muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, tubérculos y  naranja.

Doña María inicio su negocio hace poco más de dos años. Ella tiene una panadería, dice que sus productos son muy aceptados en su comunidad ya que son muy buenos y de gran calidad, además comenta que está muy feliz de poder tener un negocio propio en su casa así puede estar al cuidado de sus hijos y no dejar de lado las tareas del hogar y  que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.
En estos momentos doña María del Carmen desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢654,000 (seiscientos cincuenta y cuatro  mil colones), para comprar otro  horno industrial, una batidora industrial y diferentes materiales necesarios para elaboración de sus productos. Con esta inversión  espera incrementar la producción para atraer más clientes, ofrecer un mejor servicio y así hacer que su negocio crezca más y lograr ser una microempresaria exitosa. 

Doña Maria es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Unidos por un Desarrollo, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Maria Montiel C. is a 51 year old woman who lives with her husband and two children in the community of Hernández, located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. This community is in a mountainous area known for its great landscapes, high humidity, and its location along the highway near the northern border of the country. The main business activities of the region are livestock breeding and agriculture, specifically the cultivation of basic grains, tubers, and oranges.

Doña María started her business a little more than two years ago. She has a bakery and says that her products are well-received in her community because they are very good and of high quality. Maria also claims that she is very happy to have her own business in her home because she is able to look after her children and not have to set aside her household chores. Thanks to her business, her living conditions and that of her family have improved considerably. In addition, Maria indicates that she has grown as a person and has gained much knowledge.

At the moment, Doña María wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 654,000 CRC (six hundred fifty-four thousand Costa Rican colones) in order to buy another industrial oven, an industrial mixer, and different ingredients for making her products. With this investment, she hopes to increase her production so that she can attract more customers, offer better service, grow her business, and become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Doña María is a member of the United for Development Community Credit Enterprise, one of the 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes to grow personally and financially. She also wishes to express her thanks for these types of organizations and credit facilitators that dedicate most of their time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven, an industrial mixer, and different ingredients for producing baked goods

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina L. is from the town of Baclayon. She is 50 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Saturnina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Saturnina has been engaged in her business for more than a few years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP per month from these activities.
Saturnina joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Saturnina is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her 21st from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
âgée de 36 ans,A. akossiwa est mariée avec un enfant. Elle est revendeuse de céréales.
Elle achète du maïs et divers céréales à l’intérieur du pays et revend au marché d’Adidogomé dans le rayon des revendeuses de maïs.
Le présent crédit sera destiné à l’achat de nouveaux stocks de maïs pour assurer la saison prochaine.
Elle espère grâce à ce nouveau crédit accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
36 year old Akossiwa A. is married with one child. She sells cereals. She buys maize and other cereals in the interior of the country and resells them in the Adidogome market in the area for resellers of maize. This loan will be used to buy new stocks of maize to assure supply for the coming season. She hopes that thanks to this loan she will improve her profit margin.

Translated from French by Mark Latour, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Valientes (Brave Women). She makes her home in a simple structure with her longterm partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge was to have her own roof (house).

Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza, seven months after she started her business with her extra income. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, flour and other foods. Her business is a colmado (convenience store), a place where you can find all the ingredients you may need for your daily food. Normally these colmados are in the same neighborhood, a short walking distances from any home.

Maria will use the profits to buy a computer and, in the future, build her house with a concrete block structure and arrange for water service. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her two favorite things: God and her family.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, etc.

loans.name: Rita Marie

texts.en:
Rita Marie H. is from the village of Paz Village, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Rita Marie is single and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Rita Marie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rita Marie has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rita Marie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rita Marie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rita Marie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Paz Village, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Francis Kirmusoi

texts.en:
Francis Kirmusoi N. is 28 years old. He is a farmer and supports three people in his family. His spouse is Narikuolari N. and they have two children. Narikuolari is a housewife and she helps Francis in his farming activity.

Francis does wheat farming which he has been doing for the last eight years. This will be his second loan and he is planning spend it on preparing his five acre farm for wheat planting.

He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by hiring a bigger piece of land to increase his wheat production.

His hopes and dreams are that he will become a large-scale farmer owning a bigger piece of land and be financially able to support his family.

loans.use: preparing five acre wheat farm

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is the resident of a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan called Kasur. Kasur is known for its leather industry. 
She is a 46-year-old housewife who is married to M. A. and has given birth to four sons and two daughters. 

For the last 15 years, Zarina’s husband has been involved in the business of making shoes. He operates his business from his home. He collects orders from different shoe stores and provides them finished goods to earn an income for his family. 

Zarina’s three elder sons help their father in his business. They started to support their father after they completed their 10th standard grade in school. Zarina also helps her husband in his business in her spare time. 

Due to an increase in manpower, Zarina’s husband now can produce larger quantities of shoes and offer his services to more clients. But in order to produce shoes in larger quantities, he needs more raw materials, such as nails, shoe polish and leather.  

Therefore, Zarina has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. The loan amount will help him to buy raw materials used in manufacturing shoes in larger quantities, which will help him fulfill larger orders on time. 

Zarina is hopeful that her family business will grow as a result of investing money into it.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for shoe-making business

loans.name: Maja

texts.en:
Maja J. is from the town of Banga. She is 60 years old and married. She has five children and the youngest is age 20. To make a living, Maja raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Maja started farming 35 years ago.

Maja joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maja has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Maja is requesting a new loan of 8000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more crates of Liquor

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria reside en vivienda alquilada en la zona de Las Lomas, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y  tiene una hija en 6 años; ella es empelada de limpieza en una vivienda particular así como tambien se dedica a la recolección de material para reciclaje, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia; el crédito que saco anteriormente fue para el capital que le permitiera trabajar con reciclados, es cliente de Impro con 5 créditos. La señora se encuentra satisfecha con los créditos que le otorgamos.

El crédito que ahora solicita es para un contrato de anticrético de dos habitaciones para tener mayor comodidad y ahorrar un poco de dinero para en el futuro tener un anticrético de tres o más habitaciones o un dinero guardado para emergencias.

Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito se considera buen cliente.
texts.en:
María lives in a rented house in the Las Lomas sector in the west side of La Paz.  She is single and has a 6 year old daughter.  She is employed as a cleaning lady in a private home but she also collects recyclables.  Income from these activities is used to support her family.

The loan she got previously was for capital to make it possible for her to work with recyclable items.  She has had 5 Impro loans and she is very satisfied with the loans we provide.

The loan she’s asking for now is for a two-bedroom anticrético contract in order to live more comfortably and save some money in order to have a three or more bedroom anticrético in the future as well as savings for emergencies. (Anticrético is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you)

Her credit history qualifies her for a new loan because she’s considered to be a good client.

loans.use: For cost of a two-bedroom “anticrético” contract. (Anticrético is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to you)

loans.name: Silvano Aquiles

texts.es: El Sr. Silvano Aquiles A. G. es trabajador Activo para el Hotel Barceló Monte limar desempeñándose como operario  tiene trece  años de trabajar para esta institución, es acompañado actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada  uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para  ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, de cuales  los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Silvano is a worker at the Hotel Barceló Monte. He works as an operator. He has been working here for the past thirteen years. He is training people now. He has had four loans with CEPRODEL. Each loan he has used to buy construction materials to be used to enlarge and improve his house. He has benefited greatly from the loans from CEPRODEL. They have improved the quality of life for him and his family

loans.use: He will buy construction materials such as sand, cement, quarry stone, pebbles, etc.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in Khanewal which is a small city in Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a 2 room brick house in the area named Jameeabad. She moved here 11 years ago. She is a housewife and spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household chores. On a part-time basis she also sews clothes for her neighborhood clients. She is a mother of 4 sons and 2 daughters. Three of her children are getting their education while her eldest son drives a rickshaw. 

Nasreen is married to H. N. who runs a cosmetics shop in the market. He sells different makeup products to his customers. Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing nusiness. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because she has decided to continue her business full-time now. Her old machine isn't suitable for full-time basis. She is hopeful that, with the new machine, she will be able to earn more income and contribute financially to her family in a better way. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: María Octavila

texts.es:
María Octavila tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su familia en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, una zona bastante comercial ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con aves D. corral y animales menores en su domicilio, los engorda y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al publico en general en el mercado D. su localidad. El negocio es una importante fuente D. ingresos para la economía D. su familia por lo que siempre trata D. mantenerlo D. la mejor manera posible.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. alimento para lograr que sus animales se desarrollen D. mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a mejor precio, sobretodo en estas fechas en las cuales la demanda aumenta debido a la proximidad D. las festividades naviD.ñas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Octavila is 58 years old, married, and lives with her family in Pacasmayo district, a rather large commercial zone located in La Libertad region, more than two hours from Chiclayo city, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises domestic birds and small animals in her home. She feeds them and then when they have grown enough she sells them to the public in her local market. The business is an important source of income for her family so she always tries to maintain it the best way possible.

María wishes to expand her business by buying feed so that her animals grow in the best way they can and can be sold at the best price; above all in these days the demand is increasing because of the upcoming Christmas holidays. Therefore she has asked Edpyme Alternative for a 1000 nuevos soles loan.

loans.use: Buy food to improve her business raising and selling animals.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es: Serapio, de 53 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y siente que tiene que poner todo de su parte para poder sobresalir en la vida, ya que lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Cuando era niño, los padres de Serapio le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, el se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha cacao, café y hojas de coca, para luego venderlos en la cuidad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea alquilar tierras de sus vecinos, para incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Serapio is 53 years old. He is a very kind and hard working person. He lives in his own home and he puts everything that's in him to be able to make it in life.  His greatest wish is to have a peaceful old age. When he was a boy Serapio's parents taught him everything that he needed to know about agriculture and with the passage of time he took on more responsibilities in managing his parents' fields. He now has extensive land to cultivate, where he sows cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves that he later harvests and sells in the city of San Francisco. What he most enjoys is cultivating the land because it is this way that he is able to feed his family. He has 25 years in the business and he considers the most difficult part of the work has to ward off insect plagues. In time he hopes to rent land from his neighbors in order to increase production. This is the fifth loan he accesses through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He has always been on time with his payments and he hopes to continue. He is a very strong team member in his community bank. With the requested fifteen hundred nuevos soles he will purchase more fertilizer for his plantations.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca Nelly, es costurera de ropa de vestir, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, tiene 47 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos Gerson de 25 años, Sara de 23 años y su nieta de 3 años de edad, Blanca se dedica a la confección de trajes y uniformes escolares, este oficio lo desempeña desde hace mucho tiempo, y ha sido la principal fuente de ingreso para mantener a sus hijos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tela, ya que por el momento se le han agotado y son su materia prima más necesaria para hacer trajes que le solicitan los clientes, este préstamo le ayudara a contar con un buen inventario en telas y tener a disposición de los clientes diferentes colores, tipos de tejido y clases de telas para distintos gustos.
Ella quiere ayudar a sus hijos y a su nieta con lo necesario para que puedan superarse y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: Blanca Nelly is a seamstress, lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazan, she's 47 years old, lives with two of her children, Gerson, 25; Sara, 23 and her three year old granddaughter. Blanca makes suits and school uniforms, she has done this for a long time and has been the main source of income to support her children.  She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, because for now she has ran out of it and it's the main raw material for the suits that her clients request, this loan will help her have a good fabric inventory and have available different colors, textures and types of fabric for her clients.  She wants to help her children and granddaughter with the necessary to get a head and improve their life conditions.

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, de 29 años, es una mujer muy carismática y hacendosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Edwin, de 27 años y su querida hija Ariana, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Desde muy joven a Jessica le nació el gusto por las prendas de vestir, es por eso que decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa. Actualmente realiza una ardua labor semanal, pues lleva las prendas hasta el domicilio de sus clientes, ya que, según manifiesta, así obtiene mayores ganancias. Jessica misma se encarga de comprar y transportar la ropa desde la ciudad de Lima (aproximadamente a 20 horas por tierra), por otro lado también vende cosméticos por catálogo y tiene un pequeño bar. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las prendas que están de moda en la capital, ya que así siente que se gana la confianza de sus compradores. Lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar los pesados fardos de ropa, pero aun así no se da por vencida, ya que sabe que de esta actividad depende el bienestar de su familia. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda en la ciudad de San Francisco, en la cual pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Jessica con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante.
Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más ropa de la ciudad de Lima y algunas bebidas para su bar.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old.  She is a very charismatic and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 27 year-old Edwin, and her beloved daughter Ariana who is the motivation behind all her hard work.  

Jessica became interested in clothes when she was very young.  For this reason, she decided to sell clothes for a living.  She currently works a hard work week, delivering her clothes to her customers' homes since she tells us that in this way she makes more profits.  Jessica herself buys and transports the clothes from the city of Lima (approximately 20 hours away by land).  She also sells cosmetics through a catalog and runs a small bar.

What Jessica most likes about her work is advising her customers about the clothes that are in fashion in the capital since she feels that this helps her gain the trust of her buyers.  She has been in this business for 3 years and she considers that the most difficult part of her work is transporting the heavy bundles of clothes.  However, even so, she does not give up since she knows that her family's well-being depends on her business.  Over time, she would like to be able to set up a store in the city of San Francisco in which she could provide a better service to her customers.

This is Jessica's third loan with MFP and she is ready to make her loan repayments on time since she would like to access new loans in the future.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles she has requested to buy more clothes in the city of Lima and also some drinks for her bar.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Kibaroudouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kibaroudouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Marka-coungo, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et d’amitiés. Elles font le commerce des habits, du bois de chauffe, de poissons, du tiéké et du haricot.                                                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Kibaroudouman sont à leur deuxième              prêt solidaire, le premier ayant été correctement remboursé.                                                                          BATOMA D. compte acheter,  100 kg de tiéké, 30 kg de poisson frais. Elle effectue quotidiennement ses ventes au marché et à domicile, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de restauratrices.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Kibaroudouman group are all married and are 36 years old on average with 2 children. They all live in traditional extended households in the town of Marka-coungo, in the Fana sub-prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the second administrative region in the Republic of Mali).
They know each other through neighbourhood, familial, and social relations. They sell clothing, firewood, fish, tiéké (a cassava-based food), and beans.
The women of the Kibaroudouman group are on their second solidarity (group) loan, with their first one having been repaid properly.
Batoma D., one of the group members, intends to buy 100 kg of tiéké and 30 kg of fresh fish. She makes her sales every day at the market and at home, in cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of consumers and caterers.
She envisages realizing an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay the loan costs and to take care of the family expenses, with the remainder being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy fish and tiéké (a cassava-based food)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 36-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: buying and selling of livestock and vegetable vending business. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her livestock and vegetable vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000. 

Rosa is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she  could fund her business operations. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosa aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF: 
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for her business operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a furniture making business. Her husband Rene, who is 59 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 18 and 25 years old. Josefina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josefina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy wood, plywood nails, etc. so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Josefina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase wood, plywood nails, etc. for making furniture

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a young woman from Ramallah. Her family owns a number of storerooms that they rent out as space for others to store their goods. Najah and her brothers started a tailoring project using an old machine they had in their house.

Najah took out a loan from FATEN to buy a new machine that is faster so as to increase production, and she also wants to rent a small store so she can move the tailoring activity from the room in their house where they work now to the store she will rent.

Najah's brother appears in the picture here as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to rent a space to start a tailoring workshop

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 43 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Fely has a Ready-To-Wear (clothing) business in the Philippines. Fely requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy RTW (clothing) to sell.

Fely has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Fely would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felicisima is 45 years old and two of her children are in school.

Felicisima has a ready to wear clothing (RTW) business in the Philippines. Felicisima requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy RTW products to sell.

Felicisima has been in this business for two years. In the future, Felicisima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 34 years old; he lives with his wife and his 19-year-old son.  To earn a living, he runs a retail shop.  He has been in the business for four years.  

He has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he was able to build rental houses with his previous loans.  He hopes to have a wholesale business in the future.  He has requested 80,000 Kes to buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun is a 30-year-old farmer in the rural area of Prey Chor district. She plants an annual rice crop with the help of her husband. Mrs. Chhun is looking for a $1200 loan to buy a plot of  land in order to enlarge her rice-crop planting. She has four children, two attend school and the other two are at home.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Cristo Me Ama 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group, Cristo Me Ama 1, 2, 3 (Christ love me). As a single mother, she makes her home in a simple structure with her 3 children. To earn a living, she operates a clothing sales business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, t-shirts, blouses, etc. She says that her most difficult challenge is saving enough money to get her own house. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy attending the church.

Maria is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for 2 and a half years, and it was started with a loan she took. She has been saving her profits because, through this business, she wants to make her dreams come true- to have her own house and to help her children.

Maria's group is located in the rural area surrounding L. Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy tomatoes, apples and bananas for resale

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es: Jhon tiene 20 años, vive en el caserío de Cayan. Ahí vive en compañía de su papá y sus 2 hermanos menores, que a pesar de ser la nueva esposa de su padre. Los quiero mucho. Desde muy niño aprendió a luchar por si solo, ya que su mamá murió cuando el tenía 12 años de edad. Desde entonces ayudó a su padre incondicionalmente en los gastos económicos de su casa; él le enseñó todo lo necesario para poder emprender su camino en la agricultura. Hace 3 años que comenzó a sembrar por si mismo; en su terreno agrícola esparce las semillas de papa de todas las variedades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder cuidar sus cultivos de las constantes plagas que azotan el lugar. En todo este tiempo logró comprar con el dinero ahorrado, 4 vacas y 3 toros. Estos últimos le sirven para poder dedicarse al arado de la tierra, donde hace el servicio a terceras personas ganando un promedio de S/. 65 soles al día. El trabajo constante es su lema, por eso en sus tiempos libres también trabaja en construcción, realizando casas. Ahora las aspiraciones de este joven hombre son mayores; ya que desea ahorrar lo necesario para la creación de una tienda comercial en la ciudad de Tarma. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está contento de tener el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Además se siente contenta de pertenecer a un grupo de personas responsables y solidarias. Jhon de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
Jhon is 20 years old.  He lives in the small village of Cayan together with his dad and his two younger siblings who, although they are the children of his father's new wife, he loves very much.

Jhon learned to fend for himself at a very young age as his mom died when he was 12 years old.  Since then he has helped his father unconditionally in covering their household expenses.  His father taught him all he needed to know to start working in farming.  He started sowing his own crops three years ago.  On his farmland he sows different varieties of potato seeds.  What he most enjoys about his work is being able to care for his crops against the constant pests that attack the place.  Over the years, he has managed to save up and buy four cows and three bulls.  He uses the bulls to plow land; he offers his services to third parties and earns, on average, 65 Peruvian soles a day.

"Constant work" is Jhon's motto.  In his spare time, he also works in construction, building houses.  This young man has high aspirations.  He would like to save up enough money to set up a store in the city of Tarma.  He belongs to the "Corazón de Jesús" community bank and this is his first loan from MFP.  He is happy to have the financial support that he so needs.  He also feels happy to belong to a group of responsible and supportive people.  With your support, Jhon will invest the money he has requested in buying several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over his potato crops.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Déthié

texts.fr: L’emprunteur est un jeune marié il y’a seulement  six mois. Il tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques au bord de la route nationale qui traverse sa localité. Avec les bénéfices tirés de son commerce, il a ouvert un magasin de vente de produits alimentaires et a réalisé un verger dans lequel il fait du maraichage, de l’embouche bovine et y a planté des arbres fruitiers.Cette diversification de ses revenus est du au fait que malgré sa jeunesse, il supporte seul toutes les charges d’entretien de la famille qui est assez large. Sa générosité fait qu’il est très sollicité dans sa ville ou le chômage et le sous emploi sont très important. Il n’a jamais pris de prêt à l’IMCEC. Il demande aujourd’hui prêt de 400 000F pour compléter ses fonds et acheter un véhicule qui facilitera beaucoup ses activités.Son ambition est de se transformer en grossiste pour approvisionner les détaillants de sa localité.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young man who was married only six months ago. He has a shop selling cosmetics along the national road, which crosses his town. With the profits derived from his business, he opened a store selling grocery items. And he has a established an orchard where he cultivates a market garden, fattens cattle, and plants fruit trees. This diversification of his revenues is because, despite his young age, he is responsible for covering by himself all the expenses of his family, which is fairly large. 

His generosity means that much is asked of him in his city, where unemployment and under-employment are very high. 

He has never taken out a loan with IMCEC. Today, he is asking for a loan of 400,000 to round out his funds and to buy a vehicle for facilitating a lot of his work. His ambition is to become a wholesaler to supply the retailers in his town.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle

loans.name: The

texts.en:
The, 37, is married and earns a living to support his family by sewing and selling clothes. His wife also is involved in this business. He lives with two sons and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. 

The and his wife started the business five years ago. The would now like to take out a loan to expand the business. With the loan, he intends to buy more sewing machines, fabric and good materials that will enable him to make better quality clothes for customers. He hopes that this will generate more income and that he can save money for his children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines, fabric and materials.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco de 31 años de edad, reside en casa propia junto a su querida familia la cual está integrada por su esposa de 28 años de edad y sus dos hijos. Francisco se dedica al comercio y a la agricultura. Es un hombre emprendedor que no descansa para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Su principal fuente de ingresos es el comercio que realiza a través de la compra y venta de cereales (maíz, arroz, frijoles, etc.) en las principales comunidades cercanas a su comunidad. Él posee un pick up con el cual realiza esta actividad. Gracias a su dedicación y pasión por el trabajo ha logrado establecer buena clientela, muchas personas lo buscan con frecuencia ya que el siempre está dispuesto a realizar su trabajo y además ofrece precios accesibles.  Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito para comprar cereales tales como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, etc. para tener suficiente oferta y siempre poder dejar satisfechos a los clientes. Además de esta manera espera lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is 31 years old and he lives in his own house together with his beloved family, composed of his 28-year old wife and their two children. Francisco is a merchant and an agriculturist. He is an enterprising man who is tireless in providing for his family. His primary source of income is commerce, consisting of the buying and selling of cereal grains (corn, rice, beans, etc.) in the major and nearby communities. He has a pick-up truck with which he carries out his business. It is thanks to his dedication and his passion that he is been able to achieve a stable clientele. Many people look for him frequently because he is always ready to work and also because he offer accessible prices. He has made the decision of requesting a loan to purchase cereal grains such as: corn, rice, beans, etc., in order to have enough inventory and to be able to always keep his clients satisfied. This is how he hopes to improve the quality of his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cereal grains such as corn, rice, and beans.

loans.name: Manuel Abel

texts.es:
Manuel de 26 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la agricultura, ganadería y turismo (cuenta con sitios arqueológicos).

Manuel cuenta con su propia moto carguera, en la que se dedica al transporte de sacos de menestras, las mismas que lleva al mercado para comercializar desde hace unos 3 años, al observar que su negocio está creciendo a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de más menestra para seguir comercializando y brindar mantenimiento a su moto carguera para seguir brindando un buen servicio de transporte y con los ingresos que obtenga podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.


Manuel es una persona con muchas ambiciones en la vida, con el único objetivo de sacar adelante a su familia y darles otras oportunidades de estudios a sus hijos, para que puedan lograr sus metas en un futuro.
texts.en:
Manuel is 26 years old, lives with his family in his own house, with no running water or electricity, located in a rural zone of the district of Túcume which belongs to the department of Lambayeque. This zone is known for agricultural and farming activities, and tourism. (There are archaeological sites.) 

Manuel has his own motorcycle cargo carrier, and works transporting sacks of beans, and for 3 years he has carried his beans to market to sell. Since his business is growing he decided that this is a good time to ask for a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy more beans to sell and to maintain his motorcycle cargo carrier in order to have a good transport service and with the money he borrows he can provide a better quality of life for his family. 

Manuel is a person with many ambitions in life, with the only objective being to obtain a better future for his family and give his children opportunities to study so that they can achieve their goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beans to sell and to provide maintenance to his motorcycle cargo carrier

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester, a 42-year-old farmer, is married to Daniel, a 51-year-old man. They have two children, namely: Pace, 20, and Danes, 18. Ester is living with her husband and her son in a modest house. In order to help her husband cover their daily needs, Ester uses a plot of land to cultivate spinach, kangkung (water spinach) and onions. Ester enjoys her days as a farmer – watering, fertilizing and spraying pesticides as well. Ester is thinking of trying another business raising pigs. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Indonesian rupiah from TLM. She wants to spend the loan on two piglets and fodder. She is really hoping that TLM is willing to assist her in implementing this plan.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and fodder

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is divorced and has 3 children. She has received a senior-high level of education. She sells slippers, creams and dresses at Abura, which she has done for 15 years.

She wishes to increase her income and so a loan will help her obtain more slippers and creams to resell. The new profit she hopes to get will be reinvested for further growth.

loans.use: to obtain more slippers and creams to resell

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
El Sr Justino tiene 32 años es Mecanico de motos, hace mas de 7 años. Tiene su taller a media cuadra de su casa, está acompañado con la Sra Maria hace más de 9 años, tienen 3 hijos, el mayor tiene 13 años se llama Julio y ya le está ayudando a su papa en el taller.
Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela porque ya que su trabajo hace con garantía y también porque ya se le conoce en la ciudad, su sueño es comprar un terreno y montar su propio taller ya que donde esta es alquilado.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para las motos, lo cual le ayudará mucho en su negocio. Afirma que esta muy agradecido con la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Justino is 32 years old and he has been a motorcycle mechanic for 7 years. He has a shop half a block away from his house. He has been together with Maria for more than 9 years and they have 3 children. The eldest is 13 and his name is Julio. He helps his father in the shop.

He comments that he has a very good clientele because he offers a guarantee on his work and also because he is known in the city. His dream is to purchase a plot of land and to set up his own shop, especially because he rents where he is now.

He requests a loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles. This will greatly help him in his business. He affirms that he is very thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the opportunity that has been given to him.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba, D. 40 años es una mujer seria y con aspiraciones. Vive en compañía D. Joel, su esposo desD. hace 13 años. Ambos tienen una hija Melina, a L. que cuidan en su casa propia; ubicada en el caserío D. Usibamba. Sus actividades son diversas. En las mañanas desD. muy temprano abre las puertas D. su casa, donD. hace algún tiempo abrió una tienda D. comestibles, donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad y como mujer del campo. ElL. también se dedica a L. ganadería, con las 4 vacas que posee; venD. L. leche que produce, a un buen precio, pues son muy nutritivas D. buena textura. Asimismo, siembra en sus terrenos agrícolas; avena, habas, arveja y papa. Cuenta que desD. los 15 años comenzó a trabajar D. manera independiente, pues tenía que ayudar a su familia, con el tiempo consolidó una propia. Por ello no descansa, al contrario desea aumentar sus ganancias, con L. compra D. cerdos, con los que también obtendrá ganancias. Ya que piensa ensebarlos y venderlos a los carniceros D. L. zona. ElL. pertenece al grupo solidario “Usibamba” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera D. su apoyo para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago D. sus cuotas como en anteriores préstamos que tuvo. Elba, D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en L. compra D. una vaca para aumentar su ganado, además D. dos sacos D. semilL. D. arveja para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elba is 40 years old.  She is a serious woman with aspirations who lives together with Joel, her husband of 13 years.  The couple have a daughter, Melina, who they care for in their own home which is located in the small village of Usibamba.  She is engaged in a number of activities.  Very early in the mornings, she opens the doors of her home where she set up a grocery store some time ago.  She sells basic household products and, as a country woman, she also raises livestock.  She has four cows and she sells the milk that they produce for a good price as it is very nutritious and has good texture.  She also grows crops on her farmland: oats, beans, peas and potatoes.  She tells us that she started working independently 15 years ago as she had to help her family.  She does not rest.  She would like to increase her profits by purchasing pigs which would also make her money.  She plans to fatten them and sell them to local butcher's.

Elba is a member of the 'Usibamba' community bank and this is her second loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your support so that she can continue achieving her goals.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments as she was with her previous loan.  With your support, Elba will invest the money she has requested in buying a cow to increase the size of her herd.  She will also buy two bags of pea seeds for her next sowing season.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 43-year-old businessman who runs a butchery.  He has been in the business for eight years. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, his business has really improved because of his previous loans.

Francis hopes to become the major supplier of meat in his local area. He needs 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy meat and to renovate his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy meat and to renovate his butcher shop

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
En un barrio humilde denominado Constitución de la ciudad de Caaguazú, se formo un grupo con 16 señoras trabajadoras, con deseo de superación para ellas y sus familias. Ellas saben lo que significa el trabajo diario, para sustentar a la familia y Gracias al apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya pueden seguir luchando para dar a sus familias un sustento digno.
La señora Maria, se dedica a la venta de verduras. Dice que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana que es cuando va a buscar productos frescos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Ella comenta que tiene muchas ventas, pues ya tiene una clientela fiel que siempre acuden a ella para surtirse. Por medio de su esfuerzo ha logrado ayudar a su familia y así salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, papas y demás tipos de verduras con lo cual podrá abastecerse y ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación por esta oportunidad que les da.
texts.en:
In a humble neighbourhood called Constitución, in the city of Caaguazú, there is a group of 16 hard-working woman who have a desire to get themselves and their families ahead. They know what it means to work hard every day in order to support their families. Thanks to the support of the Fundacion Paraguaya, they are able to keep fighting to give their families the best.
Mrs. Maria sells vegetables. She says that she starts working very early in the morning, going to look for fresh produce to sell. She tells us that she has good sales, since she has a loyal customer base who always turn to her for their needs. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to help her family and get ahead.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of tomatoes, green peppers, onions, potatoes, and other kinds of vegetables. This will allow her to stock up and offer her customers greater variety. She thanks the Fundacion for the opportunity that they are offering her group.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, green peppers, onions, potatoes, and other vegetables.

loans.name: Mankaa

texts.en:
Pictured is a young single mother of two children under 15 years old. They live in a two-room house at Mile-Two Nkwen Bamenda in the North West region of Cameroon. She is saddened whenever she thinks about being a school drop-out, the death of her father, the death of her group member, and about poverty.

This dynamic lady joined GHAPE in 2003 and has successfully taken and repaid empowerment credit five times. She struggles to educate her two children so that they can have the knowledge she never had. Given a loan, she will invest in her snack bar and restaurant business. The loan will be used to buy crates, drinks, and kitchen utensils. 

She plans to plough back part of the profit into her business, buy a piece of land, and build a house. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates and an ample investment period, as well as training received from GHAPE in business management and marketing.

loans.use: to buy crates, drinks, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Baatartungalag

texts.en:
Enkhtsetseg, 24, sells shoes in the market in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia.  She has been in business for less than a year and already has permanent customers. 

She lives with her husband and two children in a rental house, since they are married.  

Her business earnings do not meet the family's financial needs.  Therefore she decided to expand her sales volume to increase her earnings.

The loan she is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing a large numbers of shoes from her supplier.

loans.use: to purchase a large numbers of shoes from her supplier.

loans.name: Tamemsu Group

texts.en:
Here are the members of the group, “Tamemsu."  They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each, in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isatu is the leader of this group.  Isatu is thirty-six-year-old and married with three children.  One is in primary school and two study in a secondary school.  Isatu sells both dried and raw fish.  She has been a businesswoman for six years.  With the help of this loan, she will invest in her business by buying dried and raw fish in large quantities. 

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very please to present this loan to you

loans.use: to buying dried and raw fish in large quantities.

loans.name: Xiomara Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo.

Ella vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y ha realizar actividades agrícolas junto con su papá. Xiomara siempre ha ayudado a sus padres, y ella quiere iniciar con el negocio de crianza de cerdos para venderlos, puesto que en la zona donde vive llegan personas a buscar los cerdos de todo tamaño para comprarlos y destazarlos.

Xiomara solicita el préstamo para comprar 6 cerdos para empezar con el negocio y los comprara en una granja de la zona donde vive. Así ella iniciara su negocio y ganara dinero para continuar apoyando a sus padres y además será una mujer independiente que desarrollara sus habilidades y cuando forme una familia ya tendrá como llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Ella desea continuar trabajando muy fuerte, ser feliz junto a sus seres queridos y construir una casa propia y que su negocio vaya creciendo, para ganarse el pan de cada día.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 29 years old and she is a single mother with one son.

She lives with her parents and siblings. She makes a living doing the domestic chores in the house and carrying out agricultural activities together with her father. Xiomara has always helped her parents, and she wants to set herself up in the business of raising pigs for resale, as in the area where she lives people come looking for pigs of all sizes to buy and butcher.

Xiomara is requesting this loan in order to buy 6 pigs to start her business and she will buy them in a local farm. In this way she will set up her business and will earn money to continue supporting her parents. She will also become an independent woman who will develop skills and when she forms a family she will have a way of providing for them. She wishes to continue working hard, to be happy together with her loved ones, to build her own house and that her business grows in order to earn her daily bread.

loans.use: to buy 6 pigs and fatten them up for resale.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is married and has 5 children. For two years, she has operated a "cold store"; that is, she sells frozen meat, chicken, and fish in Mbeam near Abura. Her husband is a farmer. Afua uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees. Afua will use the loan to purchase more frozen meat, chicken, and fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Afua plans to operate a larger cold store.

loans.use: purchase more frozen meat, chicken, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 25-year-old man from Kakamega, west Kenya. He is married to Ann and they have an eight-month-old baby.

Fredrick has operated a motorcycle and bicycle repair business for the last two years. He makes a monthly income of KES 9,700. 

He is taking a first loan from KADET Ltd., which he will use to buy spare parts for his business. 

He will use the anticipated profits to boost his business and expand his capital base.

His dream is to give his child the best education and also become a leading spare parts dealer in Kakamega.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle and bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lilian wants to buy four steers

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raque M. is 48 years old and from the city of Maputo. She is married and has two children. Her parents did not have the financial means to provide for her studies beyond the 6th grade. In 1986 she took over the family business located in the neighborhood of Xipamanine in Maputo. For family reasons, she had to move to the rural district of Boane where she established a small shop in the local market. In 2006 friends, neighbors and other store owners introduced her to Hluvuku-Adsema where she got her first loan to grow her business. The amount was very small but it gave her a chance to learn how to manage credit. Now her business is going well and provides employment to three workers (two women and a man). With the profits from her business she has created a Xitique (a local form of savings account). Daily she supports the school fees of three children. With the loan of 10,000,000MT she intends to increase her stock of products. Her business has a large impact on the community. In addition to providing a service she also guarantees the employment of three other people, brings products closer to the customer, and provides refreshments to all the merchants and drivers at the market. She hopes to grow her business to best meet the needs of the market and to also increase the size of her home which is no longer big enough for her current circumstances.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Raquel M. de 48 anos de idade, natural da cidade do Maputo, casada, mãe de 2 filhos. Cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais que tiveram poucas possibilidades financeiras para proporcionar lhe estudos para alem de sexta classe. Desde 1986 no bairro de Xipamanine na cidade do Maputo vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da família. Por motivos famílias teve de mudar de residência para o distrito rural de Boane, onde adquiriu um pequeno estabelecimento comercial no mercado local. A partir de 2006 por indicação de amigas e vizinhas, também comerciantes, teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo aproximado e solicitado o primeiro empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio, embora o valor foi tão insignificante deu para aprender a lidar com crédito. Actualmente, o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo razoável e providencia emprego para três trabalhadores (duas senhoras e um homem), com os rendimentos do negocio tem feito Xitique (prática local de poupanças), diariamente, suporta as despesas escolares de 3 filhos. Com empréstimo de 10.000.00 MT, pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque alem de providenciar serviços, também garante postos de trabalho para ela própria mais outras 3 pessoas, coloca o produto mais perto do cliente, com particular destaque para todos vendedores do mercado e motoristas de chapas que lhes providencia refeições. Tem como perspectivas, fazer crescer o negócio e fazer de forma mais convencional possível para satisfazer as necessidades do mercado e ampliar a sua habitação que está já não se adequa a realidade actual.

loans.use: To increase the stock of products in her shop

loans.name: Claudia Briselda

texts.en:
I have had a tortilla business for four years. My best clients are the people of my own community. I now need to buy corn, so I can start selling and offering a better service to my clients. With the income from my business, I buy school supplies and medicines for my children.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Yo tengo un negocio de tortillas hace 4 años. mis mejores clientes son mis vecinos de mi comunidad, ahora necesito comprar el maiz para empesar a vender y dar un mejor servico. Los ingresos que me genera compro los utiles escolares y medicinas de mis hijos.

loans.use: Purchasing corn and other products

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en: Zarrina is 24 years old. After graduating from school she started sewing and selling national Tajik robes. Her mother helped her in this business. Two and a half years ago she came to Microinvest and received her first loan, which allowed her to develop the business. Gradually, she moved to another type of business, and began selling men's clothes. She rented a small store for this purpose. Now her mother regularly sells in her place (in the photo). Zarrina brings the goods and then goes to work in a sewing shop, where she still sews men's robes and national Tajik dresses. She wants to get a loan for the development of her business.

loans.use: To develop her business

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Mrs. Chim C. L. is a 27-year-old mother of two little children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To cover he family’s expenses, she and her husband work making mortars and pestles and they then sell them to a retailer shop, from which they generate on average $4 each day.  Mrs. Chim C. is humbly requesting for a loan to purchase raw materials (rock) to keep running their business.

loans.use: To purchase raw material to produce mortars and pestles

loans.name: Sanggam

texts.id:
Every day Sanggam and wife buy to be recycled goods. The have a push cart to place the to be recycled items bought. Every day they need a capital as high as Rp500,000.00 (about US$55) to buy those items. That capital could give them profit up to Rp350,000.00 (about US$38.50). They profit from each item about Rp2,000-Rp4,000 (about 22-44 cents)/kg. Sanggam lives with wife and 2 children. His first child is first grader, and cost Rp20,000 (US$2.20)/day and education expenses of Rp75,000 (about US$8.25)/month. Business and living quarters are rented. Expected loan would be used to buy more to be recycled goods. This business is the only source of income for Sanggam and family.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap hari Sanggam bersama dengan isterinya membeli barang-barang rongsokan. Mereka menggunakan gerobak – yang mereka dorong - untuk tempat barang-barang rongsokan yang mereka beli. Setiap tiga hari mereka memerlukan modal sampai sebesar Rp 500.000,00 untuk membeli barang-barang tersebut. Modal sejumlah itu dapat memberikan keuntungan bagi mereka sebesar Rp 350.000,00. Mereka mengambil keuntungan untuk setiap barang antara Rp 2.000,00 - Rp 4.000,00/kg-nya. Sanggam tinggal bersama isteri dan dua orang anaknya. Anaknya yang pertama kelas 1 SD dengan biaya hidup per hari Rp 20.000,00 dan biaya pendidikan anak Rp 75.000,00/bulan. Tempat usaha menyewa. Tempat tinggal juga menyewa. Pinjaman yang diperoleh akan digunakan untuk membeli barang – barang rongsokan yang lebih banyak. Usaha ini merupakan satu-satunya sumber penghasilan bagi Sanggam sekeluarga

loans.use:
To buy to be recycled goods

Membeli barang – barang rongsokan

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sorn got married in 1972 and has two children: a son and a daughter. She runs a business weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her sister in 1961 and began her silk production in the same year. She has never attended school while her husband, who is a rice farmer, has not completed primary school. Her daughter lives with her and helps her with weaving silk at home. Her son is married and lives away from the family.

Mrs Sorn is a regular MAXIMA client and has been granted loans from MAXIMA six times previously. She is now requesting a $250 loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary is a 40-year-old widow with seven children. Her business is selling charcoal. She intends to use the profits from the loan to construct a storehouse where she can keep her charcoal.

loans.use: Build a storehouse for her charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fix up his store

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
I am Zahida P. N., a widow of an age of 50 years. I was born in a small city, Okara, but moved to a mid-sized city, Multan, Pakistan, with my family. I have three kids: two boys and one girl.

I make various items out of fresh flowers, such as bouquets and necklaces. I am borrowing so that I can improve my business. I have spent all my life in poverty but do not want the same fate to befall my kids, therefore I work very hard in my business.

There are four other women in my loan group. Bushra B. is borrowing for her fruit business. Iqbal B. will invest her share of the loan in her family’s garment business. Rubina B. is borrowing for her brother, who is a salesman and supplies various grocery items.

loans.use: Improve current flower business

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario has had a small store just outside her house for 3 years. She has 4 children who help her with the store. Her husband works as a welder, but he works on contract, so he also helps at the store on free days. Among other things, she sells hamburgers that she makes nights on her stove at home, but she'd like to increase her hamburger sales and she wants to buy a grill so that she can make more.

She is asking for a US$475 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy a grill for her business. With your contribution, Rosario can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Rosario tiene una pequeña tienda en las afueras de su domicilio desde hace 3 años, tiene 4 hijos quien la ayudan en el local, su esposo se desempeña como soldador pero esto lo hace por contratos por esto en sus días de descanso también ayuda, en el negocio actualmente empezó a vender hamburguesas en su casa esto lo hace por las noches, las hace en la estufa de su casa, pero su intención es formalizar mas el puesto de hamburguesas por lo que euiqer comprar un aplancha para poder producir mas.

Ella esta solicitando un crédito por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una plancha para su negocio. Con tu contribución Rosario podrá progresar.

loans.use: Buy a hamburger grill.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla V. has been running her business selling clothing and footwear for three years in the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. Since she started her business, she has faced multiple financial hardships being that she is a single mother with three children to support.

The hardship she is facing today is the urgent need to acquire clothing and footwear so that she may sell in her business. For this reason, she turns to Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow her to purchase these items. Through this purchase, it will be possible to sell the items through her business and obtain financial resources to continue with the maintenance of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Leyla V. es una dama que se dedica desde hace tres años al negocio de la venta de ropa y calzado en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega. Desde sus inicios en el negocio ella ha atravesado múltiples adversidades económicas ya que es madre soltera y con tres hijos que mantener.

La necesidad que ella atraviesa hoy en día es la pronta adquisición de la ropa y el calzado para comercializarlo, es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir estos productos.
