Por medio de esta compra a los proveedores, se da lugar a que pueda comercializar sus productos en su negocio lo que permite que se obtengan recursos económicos para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase clothing and footwear to sell in her business.

loans.name: Manija

texts.en:
M. Manija is a 21 year old lady. She is a widow and the loving mother of her child. Manija is living with her parents. Manija’s child is small now, but already today she is working hard in order to ensure the best future for him. Her business is the main source of income of her family.

Manija has been running her own small business for three years already. She has a place in the local market for selling stationery and different kinds of detergents like soap, washing powder, shampoo, toothpaste and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Manija’s grandmother is pictured in the photo as Manija left that day by herself to purchase new goods.

Now she requests a loan of $450 US. Manija is planning to use the loan to purchase more goods for selling, thus increasing the range of goods and earning more income so that she can provide everything her darling child will soon need. Manija promises to repay her loan within 4 months and thanks everybody who decided to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for selling in order to increase the stock

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 39 years old, and the mother of seven children. Rebecca is very industrious and works extremely hard to finance her children’s education and provide them with a better life. One of her children has already completed their senior year at high school. Rebecca works as a food vendor and sells rice porridge mixed with wheat, milk, and sugar. Rebecca would utilize a loan to purchase more rice and supplies to further increase her stock and expand her customer base.

Rebecca belongs to a community group called the King Jesus Trust Group. In this group, members support each other in handling and repaying loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, wheat, sugar and cartons of milk.

loans.name: Josephine's Maelewano Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 and single. She provides for two other people, 55 and 62 years of age. She has owned a small beauty salon since 2004. Every day, she works from 8 am to 7.30 pm and earns about $550 monthly.

Josephine is asking for a loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon. She will share this loan with Merry T., who is a food vendor.

loans.use: To buy more salon items to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Tabia

texts.en:
Tabia, 36 and married with two children aged 16 and 8, has been a chicken, eggs and food seller since 2003. Working daily from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her business, she can earn a monthly profit of about $90.

Tabia now hopes for a loan to buy more chicken and food items to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and food items to expand her business.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace O., a 60-year-old widow with six children, all grown up and married, has seven of her grandchildren living with her. Peace makes the traditional Bini beads and rents out video CD's from her store, located at the front of her house. Her grandchildren assist her in renting out the CD's when they have completed school for the day.  Peace now hopes for the loan amount of $450 to buy more bead materials and video CD's for her business. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more materials for bead-making and video CD's for her business

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz Baji is the wife of N. A. and lives in an historical place named Yadgar in Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last 15 years. She completed her education to the 8th standard. She is the mother of four sons. Her first two sons make paint brushes and sell them in the paint shops. The next works in a factory. Her younger son is in 4th standard. Kaniz Baji’s husband has a livestock business. He buys buffalos and sells them to the market and earns a profit. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. Kaniz Baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo to resell.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy candies at wholesale and sell in different shops. Iram Baji wants a loan to buy paint brushes to resell. Naseem Baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to resell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba Y., a single parent with five dependents and responsibility for paying her children's school fees, utility bills and other expenses, received schooling through junior high. Since 1995, Aba has processed and preserved fish purchased from local fishermen and then sends them to the Elmina market for sale.

She is now requesting a loan to increase her capital to buy more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save towards getting a piece of land to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her capital to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 42 years old and she is a widow with 3 children. She travels to Onitsha to purchase sarongs and clothes to sell. She started this business after the death of her husband. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more clothes and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Osioda - 1 Group

texts.en:
Immaculate O. (center) is 34 years old. For 15 years she has been in the business of selling wheat in Kumi. Her customers are mainly local brewers who use the wheat to make ajong (a local brew). The proceeds from this loan will enable Immaculate to purchase more sacks of wheat to meet increased demand from her customers.

Immaculate dreams of opening a shop outlet in town because at the moment, she transacts her business at her residence. She hopes to see her three children go through all levels of education.

The other members of her group will use the loan to expand their businesses selling fish, mulokoni (a local delicacy), groundnuts, and poultry.

loans.use: Purchase more sacks of wheat

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a thirty-eight-year-old father of two children who are currently in school. He operates a grocery store in his neighborhood. He started his operation eight years ago. He sells products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oils, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. With the loan, he wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase his stock of goods. With increased stock of greater variety, he hopes to increase his income to provide for the educational needs of his children. He wants to support his children to the university level.  He would appreciate the assistance very much. He is a member of the community group called To God Be the Glory Trust Group. In this group members assist and support one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To increase the stock of goods in his grocery store.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Z. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de elotes preparados por las calles, esté es el ingreso de su familia. 
Entre él y su esposa la señora Leonor Pérez  son los que atiende el negocio. Desea comprar otro carrito y así tener otro ingreso y darle trabajo a otra persona que lo necesita. Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para poder comprar un carrito nuevo para la venta de los elotes y así podrá crecer su negocio y ayudar a otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Z. has been selling grilled corn on the street for five years. This serves as his family's income. Juan and his wife, Mrs. Leonor Pérez, manage the business together. Juan would like to purchase another cart in order to have another source of income, and to give work to someone else who may need it. In order to do this, he is asking for a loan to buy the new cart for selling corn, in order to build his business and help others.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a new cart to sell grilled corn

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 57 year old woman who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Fatima has owned a grocery store for ten years. She requested a loan of 3000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her third loan cycle and she has always paid on time.

Her previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Fatima is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients can be anybody. When she first started, she didn't face any problems. However, after the 2006 war, her store was destroyed. In the future, Fatima plans to improve her store.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Greetings from Angelique N. in Kigali, Rwanda!  Six months ago, Angelique opened a pub in her neighborhood in the capital city of Kigali to supplement her husband's monthly earnings.  She is now seeking her first microfinance loan so that she can increase the number of beverages available to her customers.  She is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwandan Francs to be paid back on a monthly basis over an 8 month period.  

Angelique is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She also cares for two dependents.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her pub

loans.name: Nuuuta

texts.en: Nuuuta F., 27, is married with one child.  She has one year of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the school and villagers, five days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 tala (~$60 US).  SPBD loans are Nuuuta’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase bags of flour and sugar, baking soda, vegetable oil and cooking gas

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
Мусоева Фотима, мать 5 детей, замужем.Дома она занимается животноводством, и стаж ее работы в этой сфере привышает 10 лет. Кроме этого, она вышивает тюбитейки . Это национальные головные уборы,  национальные платки. В этой нелегкой ручной работе ей помогает дочь, которую она обучила. Но это еще не все, Фотима выращивает дома несколько деревьев грецкого ореха, собирает грецкий орех,перерабатывает его и продает на рынке.
  Муж Фотимы занимается купле продажей стройматериалов на рынке, что приносит дополнительный доход в их семью.
 Фотима хочет получить займ 1600 сомони и использовать его для откорма своего скота.
texts.en:
Fotima M. is married and the mother of five children. She raises livestock at home and has more than ten years of work experience in that endeavor. In addition, she embroiders traditional Tajik scarves and headwear, tubeteika. She taught her daughter, who assists her with this difficult handwork. In addition, Fotima also has several walnut trees. She gathers the nuts, processes them, and sells them at the market. Fotima's husband buys and sells building materials in the market to bring in extra income for the family. Fotima would like to take out a loan in the amount of 1600 somoni to use for cattle feed.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle feed

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne S. is from the village of Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married and has one infant child. Jeanne owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, primarily selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. Jeanne has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jeanne joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jeanne is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari" store. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and to support her family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi is 45 years old, married and has five children. She sells provisions and has been in business for over ten years. Olabisi needs a loan of N70,000 to increase her inventory in order to meet customers' demands. She says thank you and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah E. sells firewood and provisions at Elmina. She has received a junior high school education. She is married and has two dependents. Her husband is a trader.

Hannah has been selling firewood and provisions like milk, sugar, Milo (a milk beverage) and so on since 1999. She is responsible for paying utility bills and also supports her husband in educating their children. Her loan will be used to buy more firewood and the groceries she trades in, to sell at the market. She hopes to use the profits she gains from her business to reinvest into her trade and then to save the rest.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and provisions to sell at the market

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia B. is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Alicia is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a food market business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alicia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 44 years old and married, and she has two school-aged children. To make a living, Judith plants and harvests a variety of vegetables and fruits for sale. Judith has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Judith is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa G. est une femme âgée de 57 ans mariée avec 3 enfants. Elle habite et travaille à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle aperçoit qu’elle fera plus de bénéfices si elle augmentait l’achat en gros des assiettes plastiques pour la revente. Ces bénéfices l’aideront à financer la scolarité de ses enfants et à répondre à leurs besoins de santé. Elle pense louer une boutique pour pouvoir étaler ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Kossiwa G. is a 57 year old woman who is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers (approximately 93 miles) from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She realizes that she will make larger profits if she increases her bulk purchases of plastic plates for resale. These profits will help her to finance her children's schooling and to respond to their health needs. She plans to rent a store to be able to display her merchandise.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bulk purchase of plastic plates

loans.name: Jose Dagoberto

texts.es: Jose Dagoberto C. R., reside en Soyapango  municipio de San Salvador. Jose tiene 51 años de edad, vive con su extensa familia conformada por su esposa doña Ana, sus tres hijos, un pequeño nieto de 3 años de edad y su suegro. Jose se dedica a la profesión que aprendió hace varios y con la cual ha logrado sostener su familia; posee su propio negocio, un taller de carpintería, el cual se ha ido expandiendo por la experiencia y calidad de los muebles que fabrica Jose; el destino del crédito que solita Jose es para comprar suficiente madera que le permita elaborar una nueva producción de muebles, que están siendo exigidos por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose Dagoberto C. R. lives in the municipality of Soyapango in San Salvador. Jose is 51 years old and lives with his large family, including his wife Mrs. Ana, their three children, a small grandson of who is 3 years old and his father-in-law. Jose pursues the profession that he learned several years ago and with which he has succeeded in sustaining his family. He owns his own business, a carpentry workshop, which he has been expanding through his experience and the quality of the furniture that he makes. This loan that Jose is requesting is to buy enough wood so that he can make a more furniture, which his clients demand.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make furniture

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Mrs. Choeun S. lives in Ta Norn village in Takeo province. She owns a business who is a weaver at home. She is also a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. She is 32 years old single and she lives with her mother and two brothers. One of her brother is employed in a copy shop and the other is attending the local school. Now Mrs. Choeun S. is requesting for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.use: Is requesting for a loan to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.name: Lidia Sumelda

texts.en: Lidia Sumelda S. Guiterrez has four grown children who all are married and gainfully employed. Her husband is a contractor for a local refinery. It is at this refinery that Lidia maintains her business. She began by selling only refreshments. Then, she expanded her services to include lunch items and fresh produce. She dreams of having a more established presence with fixtures to best display and protect her products. This loan will get her a little closer to this dream with the purchase of more produce and a few tables and chairs to make her customers more comfortable.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bessy

texts.en:
Bessy Ngala is 27 years old and not yet married. She lives in Shanzu, Mombasa and runs a beauty salon. Her business has been in operation for 2 years and is doing quite well.

Bessy was introduced to KADET by an existing client and is now accessing her first loan. She plans to increase beauty products stock in her salon with the money. Her clients are mostly the residents of Shanzu.

She hopes to grow her business so that it becomes a chain of beauty salons in the coastal city to maximize her income. 

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming-dominated community in the western region of Ghana. Most of the dwellers practice farming alongside other trading activities. Doris is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She sells at the market square in her community. Doris also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community and treks as well. She buys the goods from nearby towns. Doris has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Kemi

texts.en: Kemi sells women's and children's shoes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a shoe factory in the future. She is a friendly and hardworking woman that is determined to lift her family above poverty. She is 40 years old and married with four children. Her husband is an electrician and he also supports the home. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Joycelen

texts.en:
Joycelen F. is from the village of Rosevelt, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Joycelen is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Joycelen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Joycelen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joycelen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joycelen is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Joycelen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus tres hijos y una sobrina en el sector Pilar Nores, distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicado a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de quince años tiene instalada en su vivienda un pequeña bodega donde ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas. Ella nos comenta que su negocio fue uno de los primeros en la zona y que actualmente goza de buena acogida entre sus clientes ya que sus clientes siempre confían en la calidad de sus productos y servicios. Este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos económico son la que sustenta a su familia.

Ella se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para ampliar su negocio con la compra de productos de primera necesidad que le permitan obtener más ganancias y así invertir en la educación de una hija que estudia enfermería en un instituto de la zona.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a su hija convertida en una enfermera de éxito. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una clienta puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
50-year old María Elena is a single mother and lives with her three children and niece in the Pilar Nores neighbourhood of Paiján District in the province of Ascope, La Libertad region, which is located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. More than fifteen years ago María Elena opened a small store in her home where she sells basic supplies, groceries, and drinks to her customers. She notes that her business was one of the first in the area and she enjoys a warm welcome there because her customers can always trust the quality of her products and service. The business is María Elena’s sole source of income and provides for her family’s needs. She is asking for a loan of S/.1000 from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to buy basic necessities and thus expand her business. This will allow her to earn more money so she pay for the education of her daughter who is studying to be a nurse in a local institution. Her greatest wish is to see her daughter become a successful nurse. She has worked with our organisation in the past and has proven to be punctual and responsible with her loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for her corner store

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia operates a spare parts business located off of a busy road in Kakamega, Kenya. She's been in the business for five years.

Rosalia is married and has one daughter - she hopes to improve her standard of living through working with SMEP to expand her business. In five years, she wants to be a wholesaler as well as a retail supplier of spare-parts. Rosalia describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To increase her stock of spare automobile parts

loans.name: Irma Concepción

texts.es: Irma Concepción F. S. de 39 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a sus padres, su hermana, abuela y un sobrino. Irma es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada, quien posee una venta de ropa para niños y niñas, así mismo comercializa cosméticos y artículos para regalo para toda ocasión. Desde hace más de cinco años que Irma se dedica a este trabajo el cual le ha permitido obtener muy buenas ganancias. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado de Cojutepeque, en el sector de cosméticos, lugar muy estratégico ya que ella posee uno de los puestos más surtidos y que cuenta con mayores ganancias. Irma solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar su inventario, sobre todo de productos para regalos, esto debido a que en este mes sus ventas aumentas por el día del amor y la amistad, Irma desea poder aprovechar esta fecha del año y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan poder aportar a su hogar y así mismo solventar sus gastos personales.
texts.en:
Irma Concepción F. S. is 39 years old and lives in Cojutepeque, located in the district of Cuscatlán. Irma lives with her parents, sister, grandmother and nephew. Irma is very hard-working and committed and owns a stall where she sells children’s clothes, cosmetics and gifts for all occasions. Irma has been involved in this business for the past five years, allowing her to make good profits. Her business is located in Cojutepeque market, in the cosmetics’ section, a very strategic location since her stall is one of the most widely stocked and successful. Irma requests a loan to increase her stock, particularly of gifts, due to a potential increase in sales from Valentine’s Day. Irma wishes to take advantage of this day of the year to make maximum profits, which will allow her to help support her family and settle some personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her gift supplies for her business.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Chrispinus

texts.en:
Chrispinus is 44 years old and married with 13 children, ranging in age from 9 months to 25 years old. Nine of his children are currently attending school. He has run a mixed farm in the western region of Kenya, just outside the town of Kitale, for the past 10 years. His primary source of income comes from milk production, which he sells to the local retailers.

He says that there are a number of everday challenges to face with farming in this region, with the main issue being that the milk market can at times become quite saturated. Unpredictable weather patterns can often be difficult, as well as problems with spreading disease among livestock. Even when faced with these problems, Chrispinus has successfully completed a previous loan with Juhudi Kilimo and has maintained profitable business operations.

Chrispinus requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 25,000 to expand his stock of poultry in an effort to further diversify his farm production. He says that the extra income from this project will go towards providing for his family's well being. Looking forward, he hopes to build up his credit over time in order to take out a larger loan in the future to start a new, bigger project.

loans.use: To expand his stock of poultry in an effort to further diversify his farm production

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a hardworking man and he lives in Oyo state, Nigeria. He is married with two children. His eldest child is 14 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. He is 43 years old. He sells for long hours to support his wife. He sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to his customers. He hopes to own a super market and expand his business in the future. He has been in this business for a long time and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain customers. He hopes for a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. He says "thanks" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Juan Ricardo

texts.es:
Juan M. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es divorciado pero tiene 2  hijos que viven con el de 17 y 14 años.
 
Juan inicio con la panadería hace mucho tiempo con la ayuda de una amiga que le presto un horno  y le enseño con paciencia hacer pan y dulces. Después de tener ingresos se compro una vitrina y con la ayuda de su ex cuñado compraron un horno industrial.  

Ahora el trabaja desde las 04:30 am hasta las 22:00 pm, haciendo panes enrollados, dulces, alfajores, roscas de harina, etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar harina, mantequilla, una panificadora para su negocio.

En el futuro el quiere tener una panadería-tienda y poder construir en su casa una loza.
texts.en:
Juan M. is 38 years old, and lives in a semi-urban area in the perimeter of Guayaquil. His house is made of cement and has all the basic services. He is divorced but has 2 children who live with him, they are 17 and 14 years old. Juan started at the bakery a long time ago with the help of a friend who loaned him an oven and taught him with patience how to make bread and sweets. After earning some income he bought himself a showcase and with the help of his ex brother-in-law, they bought an industrial oven. Now he works from 4:30 am until 10:00 pm, making rolled bread, sweets, cookie sandwiches, rolls, etc. With this loan he wants to buy flour, butter, and a bread machine for his business. In the future he wants to have a bakery shop and be able to build crockery in his house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy flour and a bread machine

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina R. P., oriunda de San Vicente de Chucurí, municipio del departamento de Santander, vive en el barrio Ciudadela Metropolitana del municipio Soledad, parte del área metropolitana de Barranquilla. Es madre cabeza de familia y vive con su hijo de 20 años que la ayuda en su negocio de preparación y venta de comidas rápidas. Martina aprendió cómo elaborar empanadas y papas rellenas de su cuñada y ahora vende papas rellenas, empanadas santandereanas con carne, huevo y arroz, añadiéndoles perros calientes los fines de semana. También prepara chicha de arroz y avena, bebidas que las produce “a lo santandereana” echándoles vainilla y canela, los sabores de su tierra. Tiene un carrito de comidas rápidas a cada uno de sus dos vendedores que ubican en la terminal de transportes para servir a su clientela mayormente compuesta de pasajeros de bus intermunicipales.
Con este su quinto crédito de $ 1.500.000, Martina planea comprar materias primas como arroz, azúcar, papas y aceite en mayor volumen y hacer algunos pagos a proveedores para ganar descuento a largo plazo. Llegó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 3 años por medio de su nuera que vino a capacitarse. Manifiesta que a partir de esa fecha los créditos le sirvieron para ampliar el negocio porque pasó de vender empanadas y frituras en un canasto a tener dos carritos para transportarlas; y de tener una pequeña nevera de icopor donde envasaba la chicha y avena a tener unos termos más higiénicos. El mayor desafío del trabajo es que es muy agotador: se levanta a las 3:20 cada mañana y a las 9:00 de la noche todavía no ha terminado. Sueña con tener su propia vivienda y su propio local para no salir a recorrer las calles. Es más, quiere que su hijo termine de estudiar: ha entrado en varios colegios pero ha tenido que retirarse por razones del cansancio que le produce su trabajo.
texts.en:
Martina R. P., a native of San Vicente de Chucurí, a municipality in the Santander department, lives in the suburb of Ciudadela Metropolitana in the Soledad municipality, part of the metropolitan area of Barranquilla. She is a mother and head of the family, and lives with her 20 year old son who helps her in her business preparing and selling fast food. Martina learned to make empanadas and stuffed potatoes from her sister-in-law and now she sells stuffed potatoes, Santander empanadas with meat, eggs and rice, and also makes hot dogs on the weekends. She also prepares chicha from rice and oats, drinks which she produced in Santandean style, adding vanilla and cinnamon, the flavours of her region. She has a fast food cart that each of her 2 sales people use, located in the transport terminal to serve customers who are passengers of the municipal buses. This is her fifth loan of $1,500. Martina plans to purchase large volumes of ingredients such as rice, sugar, potatoes and oil and to make some payments to provedors to obtain a discount in the long term. She arrived at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo 3 years ago through her daughter-in-law. She expresses that from this date on the loans have served her to expand the business because she has gone from selling empanadas and fried food from a basket to having 2 food carts to transport the food; and she has a small fridge where she bottles the chicha and oats to make the containers more hygienic. The biggest challenge of her job is that it is very exhausting: she gets up at 3.20 each morning and at 9pm each night she still hasn't finished. Martina dreams of having her own home and own place of business so that she doesn't have to go out in the streets. She also wants her son to finish studying: he has entered in various colleges but has had to quit due to exhaustion-related reasons due to the work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bulk volumes of ingredients such as rice, sugar, potatoes and oil

loans.name: Dilini

texts.en:
Dilini is a  24-year-old married woman living with her husband and daughter in the town of Kekanadura in southern Sri Lanka. Her husband is a businessman, and Dilini manages a food production business, making food and selling it to local shops.  She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help expand her business. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to help expand the food production business

loans.name: Anwar Sultana's Group

texts.en:
Anwar Sultana is a wife of M. S. and lives in Vehari (a mid-sized city), in Pakistan. She is a
50-year-old mother of three daughters and a son. Her husband is a tailor, by profession. He occupies a room of his house and uses it as a tailoring shop. She helps her husband by sewing clothes at home, but she also prepares the embroidered dresses by receiving the orders from her neighbors. They both earn a good income from their businesses and manage the financial expenses of their home. 

Their son drives an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Their eldest daughter completed her education up to 10th standard and now works in a local school as a teacher, on a monthly wage. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education. 

Anwar has successfully repaid her two loans to Asasah (micro-finance institute of Pakistan and a partner of Kiva). With the loan profits, she purchased a color television and an air cooler. Now she is applying for a loan, for the third time, to repair her sons’ rickshaw so he can better continue his work. She hopes to get a good profit from this loan too and has a plan to marry off her eldest daughter.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.name: Janneth Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Janneth T. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de la Bahía, vive en la ciudad de Azogues esta localidad  se caracteriza por ser la capital de la provincia del Cañar, su clima es frió y  su gente se dedica a varias actividades como es la agricultura, albañilería, artesanías etc., y muchos de ellos han migrado a las ciudades principales del país o al exterior en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades

Nuestra socia tiene 42 años de edad, se encuentra casada y tiene cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 20, 13, 12, y 6 años,  su primer hijo se encuentra cursando los estudios superiores, los otros dos hijos se encuentran en el colegio y su último hijo estudia en la escuela de la localidad, su esposo trabaja como empleado público y gracias al  trabajo mututo cuenta con su casa propia.

Janneth se dedica al comercio vende ropa para toda la familia,  actividad que realiza durante varios años de lunes a sábado, se encuentra en su segundo crédito siendo estos invertidos en  la ampliación de su negocio y fue incentivada a formar parte de éste hermoso grupo de mujeres trabajadoras  por sus amigas comerciantes. Con el dinero que reciba comprará pantalones, camisas, blusas, sacos, vestidos, ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños

Su meta es llegar a tener un puesto propio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Janneth T. is a member of the community bank Mujeres de la Bahia. She lies in the city of Azogues, the capital of the Canar province. Its climate is cold and its people work in various sectors such as agriculture, bricklaying and crafts. Many of them have migrated to larger cities or to other countries to look for better opportunities. Janneth is 42, married and has four children ages 20, 13, 12 and 6. Her eldest child is in college, the middle children are in high school and the youngest attends the local primary school. Her husband is a public employee, and thanks to his income, they have their own home. Janneth sells clothing for all ages, an activity she has done for many years, from Monday to Saturday. This is her second loan, and she has been investing in expanding her business. She was motivated by her friends to join this beautiful group of hard-working women. With this loan, she will buy pants, shirts, blouses, jackets, dresses, and underwear for men, women and children. Her goal is to have her own stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing

loans.name: Onn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Onn N. is a villager who lives in Kampong Samnanh village in Kandal province.  She is as the leader of a group loan having been selected by its four members. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different businesses. Mrs. Onn N. herself is a fish seller and her husband, Mr. Poanh Soun, is an electrician. They are able to earn a small income to support their family. Since fish selling is going well, Mrs. Onn N. wants to expand it, thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fish for selling. Mrs. Onn N. is 48 years old and is the mother of five children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory while the other three are students and also support their mother with the business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for selling.

loans.name: Sope Khadim Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE KHADIM est composé de neuf (9) femmes toutes issues du même village et se sont constituées et organisées par affinité. Il est créé le 14 décembre 2008, date d'ouverture du Banc Villageois. Elles sont d'âges très variés, entre  29 et 53 ans. Elles sont toutes mariées mères d'au moins deux(2)  enfants. Elles mènent toutes des activités génératrices de revenues et l'activité dominante est le petit commerce de légumes. En plus des remboursements réguliers qu'elles font cycliquement elles ont une bonne capacité de mobilisation d'épargne soit un cumul épargne de 544 500 FCFA.

Seynabou D. en premier rang à gauche sur la photo, assise et emmitouflée d'une écharpe noire est la responsable du Groupe de Solidarité. Elle est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes au marché central de Louga, elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d'une dizaine d'année. Elle a adhéré au Banc Villageois en même temps que ses autres camarades, le 14 décembre 2008. Elle a reçu un prêt de 100 000 FCFA lui permettant de renforcer sa capacité d'investissement afin d'augmenter son approvisionnement en légumes. Elle a comme objectif de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et accroître ses revenus financiers afin de mieux participer à la prise en charge de sa famille par rapport à la santé et la nourriture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE KHADIM is composed of nine women who are all from the same village. The group was formed and organized by affinity. It was created on December 14, 2008, the date the Banc Villageois opened. Their ages vary between 29 and 53 years. They are all married and mother of at least two children. They all have income-generating businesses, with the sale of vegetables being predominant. In addition to making regular loan payments, they good at saving, with a cumulative savings of 544 500 CFA francs. Seynabou D., in the first row on the left on the photo, seated and wrapped a black scarf, is the leader of the Solidarity group. She is a 53 year-old, married woman who is responsible for five children. She has had a small business selling vegetables in the central market of Louga for more than ten years. She joined the Banc Villageois on December 14, 2008, at the same time as her other friends. She received a loan of 100 000 CFA francs to help her improve her investment ability and increase her supply of vegetables. Her goal is to meet the needs of her customers and increase her revenues to better take care of the health and nourishment of her family.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen the economic initiative of the solidarity group by investing in small businesses

loans.name: Ciudad Real Group

texts.es:
El señor Rufino socio emprendedor y entusiasta, tiene 45 años D. edad, separado con  1 hijo D. 18 años D. edad, (vive con su mama), su domicilio está ubicado en la zona D. Huáscar - distrito D. Santa Anita, departamento D.  Lima, trabajaba como chofer D. combi desD. hace 14 años, se inicio en esta labor porque tuvo la oportunidad D. comprarse un carro con los ahorros que pudo lograr reunir, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta D. carne en el mercado. 
Viene trabajando con Edaprospo - Prosperidad desD. hace 3 años, asume el cargo D. presidente D. la alcancía comunal “Ciudad Real” la cual está  conformada por 8 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: reciclaje, venta D. ropa, venta D. comida, bodega y otros. El gran sueño D. Rufino es tener un puesto propio en el mercado ya que el trabajo que actualmente desempeña no le rinD. para cubrir sus gastos y que su hijo estudie en la universidad.
Con su reciente préstamo  planifica comprar repuestos para su carro. Hasta el momento ha logrado levantar las paredes D.  su vivienda  con material noble (ladrillos) pero su anhelo es  terminar D. construirla (techar, ponerle piso, etc.).
texts.en:
Rufino, an entrepreneurial and enthusiastic member, is 45. He is separated and has 1 son who is 18 (and lives with his mother). Rufino's home is located in the Huáscar zone, Santa Anita district, Lima department. He has worked as a chauffeur with a combi van for 14 years, beginning this business because he had the opportunity to buy a car with the savings that he was able to collect. Before this Rufino used to sell meat in the market. He has worked with Edaprospo - Prosperidad for 3 years, assuming the role of president in the communal bank 'Ciudad Real', a group which is maD. up of 8 members who do different activities such as recycling, clothing sales, food sales, a grocery store and others. Rufino's big dream is have his own stall in the market as the work that he carries out doesn't yield enough to cover his costs, and his son also studies at university. With this loan he plans to buy spare parts for his car. He has been able to build the walls for his house with honest material (bricks) but his dream is finish building his house (roof, flooring etc).

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for a car

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mrs. Kang S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops on her own land, from which she earns a living. Her husband assists her with the farm work. Kang S. has been married for years and has eight children. Six of her children are married and employed, and the other two are single and attend school. Kang S. lacks farm supplies to use on her field during the coming season. To help meet her goals, Kang S. has applied for a loan in order to buy fertilizers and crop seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and crop seeds to grow.

loans.name: Gladys Ene Nkalayiai

texts.en:
Gladys Ene Nkalayiai Punywa is 25 years old and she supports three members of her family.

She has been farming wheat for the last three years successfully, due to good climatic conditions and a ready market for the product in her area.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members of Kadet in her area of residence. This is her first loan, and she is planning to spend the twenty thousand to buy fertilizer and chemicals for the growing wheat.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to  expand her wheat farming to large scale farming by hiring a bigger piece of land for wheat farming.

Her hopes and dreams are that she will become a large scale farmer, be able to educate her children, and attain financial independence.

She is a hardworking woman and determined to achieve her target.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for her growing wheat

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 45-year-old married man living in Nabatieh with his wife and four children. He has sold chickens since 2005,  and his clients all approve of his good-quality products. Mahmoud owns the only chicken store in his region so his clients are happy not to have to go to the nearby village to buy chicken. Mahmoud is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to develop his business by buying more chickens, eggs, and necessary business supplies. He hopes to own a farm of his own some day where he can raise his own chickens.

loans.use: To develop his business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline R. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old. Evangeline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a pedicab transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to expand her business. This loan will be Evangeline's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices that cover the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template that allows its Field Partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sugar, oil, salt, tomatoes, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Jehova Jerex Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehova Jerex es un grupo conformado por Lorena del Carmen S. de 54 años desde hace 6 años realiza cobertores, bolsos y vende CD. Ella con el crédito comprara telas, hilos, cartón etc. para la realización de togas, uniformes etc. para las promociones.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Ivania Leticia M. quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita como enchiladas, tajadas con queso, carne asada, cerdo etc. desde hace 5 años y María Jesustina Torre tiene una comideria desde hace 20 años e invertirá el crédito en granos básicos, carne, verduras etc.
texts.en:
Lorena del Carmen S., 54, is a member of the Jehova Jerex group.  For the past six years she has made bedspreads and purses and also sells CDs.  She will use the loan to buy fabric, thread, cardboard, etc. to make gowns, uniforms, etc. for graduations.

The other group members are:  Ivania Leticia M., who has a popular fast food restaurant where she has sold a variety of fast food items for the last five years and María Jesustina Torre who has had an eatery for 20 years and will use the loan for basic grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: For fabric, threat, etc. to make graduation gowns and uniforms.

loans.name: Munhtur

texts.en:
Munhtur D., a 38-year-old widow, lives with her four children, who range in age from 10 and 19, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home, in Baganuur, a district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. Munhtur's husband passed away a year ago and she works hard to raise her children alone. Her oldest daughter attends university, while the other three children are students as well.

Munhtur sells adult and children's clothing in her community, a business she started recently after having operated a meat sales business in a rented stall for three years. Hoping to ensure the stable operation operation of her new business, she is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to import winter boots from Erlian, China's border city.

A modest and hardworking person, Munhtur says, " My only wish is to provide a good educational background for all my children. "

loans.use: To import winter boots

loans.name: Olga Lorena

texts.es: Olga Lorena tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar fundación. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza créditos. Ella tiene ciertos clientes muy bien establecidos ya que ha sido muy gratificante el obtener a nuevos clientes, siempre está realizando diferentes clases de platillos su experiencia la obtiene todos los días ya que obtiene cosas nuevas cada día. El motivo de su financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como granos básicos, verduras, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mantener a sus clientes y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
Olga Lorena is 49 years old and sells food. She has worked a long time with Fundación Leon 2000, so this is not the first time she has received a loan. Olga has some very well-established customers, but she is always grateful whenever she attracts new ones. She is always serving different types of dishes. Her experience is constantly on display since she is able to come up with new things each day.

The reason for this loan is to buy supplies such as basic grains, vegetables, juices, sodas, and other products. Her dream is to maintain her customer base and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, vegetables, juices, sodas, and other products

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Macuaco, una localidad rural de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en la zona donde reside. Allí el suele sembrar arroz dos veces por año y con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a la economía de su familia. El ya cuenta con más de diez años dedicándose a esta actividad y debido a ello conoce mucho del manejo de estos cultivos.

Emilio desea adquirir fertilizantes para poder asegurarse una buena producción de su cultivo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. Emilio es una persona bastante hogareña y estimada por las personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Emilio is 56 years old, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Macuaco, a rural village of modest and hardworking residents that is located in the Oyotún agricultural district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

Emilio owns agricultural land in the area where he lives. He usually plants rice two times a year there and with the income he receives from this, helps his family get ahead economically. He has been doing this work for ten years now and because of this, knows much about managing these crops. 

Emilio would like to acquire fertilizer in order to be assured of a good production of his crop. Therefore, he thought it would be a good idea to apply for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles through Edpyme Alternativa that will help him to achieve his goal. Emilio is very much a family man and is respected by the people in his community.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Mavila

texts.es:
Mavila tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito agrícola D. Mochumí, una zona D. bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a más D. media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace un año aproximadamente a vender productos D. belleza por catálogo, ella trabaja en base a pedidos y siempre se encuentra buscando la manera D. captar nuevos clientes, ya que la empresa que le provee D. productos le paga D. acuerdo a los pedidos que realiza: a más pedidos realizados, más ganancias obtiene. Los ingresos que obtiene D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos económicos D. su familia.

Mavila desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo productos por cuenta propia, D. esta manera ella contará con un stock propio que le permita satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes rápidamente, sin necesidad D. esperar a que llegue el fin D. mes para recibir su pedido, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Mavila is 47 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children in Mochumí, an agricultural district.  The area has plenty of commercial activity, and it is in the Lambayeque province.  It is over half of an hour to the city of Chiclayo.

For approximately one year she has been selling beauty products by catalog.  She works mostly by orders, and she is always looking for the way to gain more customers.  The company that provides the products pays her according to the orders that she takes.  The more orders she takes, the more income she gets.  She uses the income from this business activity to help her husband with the family expenses.

Mavila wishes to expand her business by acquiring products on her own account.  This way she will have her own stock, which will quickly satisfy her customers’ demand.  This way they will not have to wait for the end of the month to receive their order.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 soles.  The loan will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire products on her own account so that she will have her own stock, which will quickly satisfy her customers’ demand

loans.name: Melania Marlene

texts.es:
Melania Marlene O. M. tiene 42 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia los Ríos en la. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.
  
Melania Marlene se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la feria en Ventanas..

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es poder tener un terreno que sea propio.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Melania Marlene O. M. is 42 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and their children in the canton of Ventanas, which is in Ríos province.  She has three children.

The members of the "Nuevo Horizonte" ["New Horizon"] Communal Bank are based in the precinct of Cachel y Grande, in the canton of Ventanas.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Melania Marlene plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  She buys products at Agro Karlyta and sells what she produces at the market in Ventanas.

She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  The economic support provided by this loan will help her meet her needs.  She faces challenges like insect plagues, plant illnesses, and the changing climate.  Her dream is to own her own field.

She likes sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 51 años, es viuda y tiene una hija. Residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la selva tropical cusqueña, donde habitan una  casa alquilada.Marcelina recuerda que hace mucho tiempo no tenia nada, pero ella tenia conocimiento de las técnicas de  sembrío y cosecha del cacao, y así  incursionó en producir y comercializar estos productos, y  agradece a su familia por la ayuda que le brindaron en los momentos más difíciles. Hoy vende su producto a los grandes mayoristas a un precio competitivo, con la finalidad de poder diversificar su mercado, siempre se encuentra muy atenta ante cualquier aparición de plagas que puedan afectar sus plantaciones de cacao. Por lo general su producto los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad, y su rutina diaria es desde 6  de la mañana hasta las 5  de la tarde. Tiene planeado  obtener más tierras y seguir en el sembrío del cacao y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.Este es su dieciseisavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a la institución por la responsabilidad que  ejercen.Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en contratar jornaleros para hace trabajar su parcela, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 51 years old.  She is a widow and has one daughter with whom she lives, in a rental house, in the town of Quimbiri, in the tropical Cusco jungle.

Marcelina remembers that a long time ago she didn't have anything at all but she knew how to sow and harvest cacao and she thereby broke into the market producing and selling these products.  She is grateful to her family for the help they gave her in her most difficult moments.  Today, Marcelina sells her products to the big wholesalers at a competitive price, with the aim of being able to diversify her market.  She is always very attentive to any appearance of pests on her crops as they can ravage her cacao plantations.  In general, she sells her products in the warehouse centers in her own town and her daily routine runs from 6.00am to 5.00pm.  Marcelina plans to obtain more land and to continue sowing cacao and improving her family's quality of life.

This is Marcelina's 16th loan with MFP.  She pledges to continue making her repayments on time.  She is grateful to the institution for the responsibility that they exercise.  She will invest the money she is requesting in hiring laborers to work on her plot of land.  In this way, she hopes to get ahead in life.

loans.use: To pay laborers to help her with her crops

loans.name: Johan

texts.en:
Johan, 52 years old, is married to Amalia, 53 years old, and has been blessed with a child named Ronald, 18 years old. Johan and his family are living in Tanah Merah village. It is a coastal area and situated about 30 minutes drive from Kupang City. 

Johan is a fishmonger. He has been running this business for years to support his family.
 
Johan usually starts his activities at 5 a.m. He goes to sea for fishing until 8 a.m. Trawling is his only method of fishing, and the net is his only equipment, so he cannot go too far to get the fish. As a result, Johan cannot get many fish and can earn only a small income. Sometimes the fish are only sufficient as side dishes for his family. A challenge faced by Johan is when the monsoon comes. He cannot catch fish at all at that time. 

Johan wants to improve his business by purchasing a small boat to support him in fishing. For this reason, he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. He plans to buy a secondhand boat with the loan. He hopes that the loan will help him to improve his business and family life.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand boat

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 26-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a business venture; a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. 

Josephine is  borrowing PHP 11,000 as an additional working capital for her general store business. This will be her 4th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom.  Josephine aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es: Jenny Elizabeth se dedica a la repostería y el alquiler de sillas. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos y se siente satisfecha por esta ayuda. Tiene más de 14 años de obtener este medio de vida, ella es una persona trabajadora y la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan en gran cantidad la repostería sus vecinos, amigos y familiares disfrutan de ellos.   Se levanta temprano todos los días para abrir su local y ofrecer la variedad de productos que ofrece. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de una batidora industria y algunas sillas.
texts.en:
Jenny Elizabeth runs a bakery and rents out chairs. This is not the first time she has had a loan, and she is very pleased about receiving this help. She has earned a living this way for more than 14 years.

Jenny is a hardworking woman, and most of her customers buy large quantities of her baked goods. Her neighbors, friends and relatives all enjoy them. Jenny wakes up early each day to open her shop and offer the variety of products that she sells.

She is asking for the loan to buy an industrial mixer and some chairs.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a married woman who lives in Bogo, Cebu. She earns her living by buying and selling palm toddy (palm wine) and operating a general store. Her husband Francisco, who is 59 years old, works as a driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have one child who is 22 years old. Nenita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her first loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nenita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 4,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,800, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her second loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000  to buy more palm toddy to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future for the education of her only child. Nenita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase palm toddy to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to open a restaurant

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin tiene 35 años de edad. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad en el distrito de Reque en el norte de Perú. La zona donde vive es rural y no cuenta con servicios básicos (agua potable y energía eléctrica). El agua para su consumo viene de un pozo.  Su casa es hecha de material rustico (adobe y calamina). 

Martin se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 20 años. Todo sus cultivos los siembra en terrenos propios que están ubicados en un sector de su caserío. El riego para sus plantas viene del Rio Reque, donde bombea con una pequeña motobomba. El destino del credito es para sembrar un pequeño terreno de zanahoria. Desea comprar abonos y semilla y también pagar la mano de obra tanto para  la siembra y cosecha. Sus productos agricolas los vende en el Mercado de Moshoqueque, un mercado grande y con bastante movimiento. Martin ya ha manejado otros créditos de Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) y los cancelo todos de manera puntual. Su mayor anhelo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Martin, 35, lives in his own house with his wife and two minor children in Reque District in northern Peru.  The area where he lives is rural and does not have basic services (potable water and electric power).  Water for their consumption comes from a well.  His house is made of flimsy materials (adobe and plywood).

Martin has been a farmer for about 20 years.  His crops all grow on land of his own located in a sector of his hamlet.  Irrigation for the crops comes from the Roque River which he draws out with a small pump.  

The loan will be used to plant carrots on a small tract of land.  He wants to buy manure and seed as well as paying labor costs for the planting and harvesting.  He sells his farm products in Moshoqueque Market, a large market with lots of activity.

Martin has had previous Edpyme Alternativa loans which he paid back punctually.  His greatest wish is to continue investing in his business to increase income and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and seed for his carrot crops.

loans.name: Ephraim

texts.en: Ephraim is 36 years old. He has two children who are four and two years old. His wife sells different kinds of merchandise. Ephraim owns a little restaurant in which he sells African dishes and he has been in this business for three years. He is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of foodstuffs and some restaurant equipment. He planes to renovate his house with the additional profits he hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and some restaurant equipment.

loans.name: John Fonyam

texts.en:
John Fonyam D. is 72 years, a polygamist and father of 10, three of which are under 15. Many of the others are unemployed due to low levels of education. Due to ill health, poverty and the death of some of his close relatives within the past years, he decided to join GHAPE in the year 2008. 

With this loan, he plans to repair his pig sty, buy piglets, pig feed, and medication. Pig rearing is something he has been into for a long time now and he knows how to go about it. John Fonyam has also attended training sessions on pig farming provided by local and international NGOs.

The major problem facing pig farmers now is the African swine fever but with the proper hygiene and vaccine, this can be avoided. 
 
Of all locally reared animals, pigs are the most demanded and the most expensive, assuring him of a ready market at the end. 

The profit he gets from the loan will be used to educate his children and provide food for his family. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the long recovery period, which enables him to repay without stress.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and medication and to repair the pig sty.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, from the village of Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City, is 43 years old and single. To make a living, Sarah owns and operates a specialized retail store selling used clothing or ukay-ukay and shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sarah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase more inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her fourth loan for 14000 PHP to purchase additional stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay. Sarah plans to use the extra revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay

location.town: Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Gloria Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria Maria Isabel tiene 58 años, es madre soltera vive con dos hijos, vive en la Parroquia La Magdalena perteneciente al Canton Chimbo.

Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz en ciclo corto. Las comprar la realiza en la Ciudad de Guaranda y las vende en La Magdalena y en la feria de los Sabados en Chimbo.

El credito solicita para la compra de  fertilizantes e insumos para los cultivos, el credito le apoyado a incrementar la produccion y aumentado los ingresos economicos. Ha enfrentado desafios como plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos, Su sueño es comprar un terreno para tener ingresos para dar la educacion a los hijos y tener para la comidad diaria.


Le gusta enseñar a los hijos a trabajar en el campo.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria Isabel, 58, is a single mother with two children.  She lives in the parish of La Magdalena which belongs to the Chimbo Canton.

Her means of income is growing short-cycle crops such as corn.  She makes her purchases in Guaranda City and later sells her crops in La Magdalena and at the Saturday fair in Chimbo.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and supplies for the crops.  The loan will help her increase production and income.  She has been up against insect plagues and crop illness.  Her dream is to buy land to earn more money for her childrens' education and to cover daily household expenses.

She enjoys teaching her children to work in the fields.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies for her crops.

loans.name: 4 Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to maintain her business.

Lan is 45 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 7.1.4 Phú Sơn  solidarity group. Lan lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lan has been involved in this business for four years, but she hasn't enough capital at present.

In the future, Lan hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to extend her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food to resell.

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
“LAS HORMIGUITAS”  es un grupo nuevo que esta conformado  07 socias  todas viven en Ventanilla Callao  la Sra. Ofelia es la presidenta del grupo  y como tal espera desempeñar una buena labor, el negocio al cual ella se dedica es la venta D. ropa  como polos medias  y zapatillas, su trabajo lo maneja desD. su casa ofreciendo sus productos a sus vecinos, amigos ella trabaja a pedido y les ofrece facilidades D. pago a sus clientas con el producto D. su trabajo ha podido mejorar su casa la que quiere terminar muy pronto por que tiene en mente poner algunos cuartos  en alquiler  el  préstamo que EDAPROSPO le facilitara,  lo utilizara para comprar ropa D. invierno  que tiene mucha demanda en esta época D. invierno.

  * La Sra ofelia esta con polo naranja
texts.en:
"Las Hormiguitas", meaning "The Little Ants" is a new group and it is maD. up of 7 members, all of whom live in the city of Callao. Ofelia is the president of the group and as such she endeavors to do a good job. Her business is clothing sales, including polo shirts, tights, and ladies' shoes. She manages her business from her house, offering products to her neighbors and friends. She works by taking orders and she offers payment options to her clients. As a product of her work she has been able to improve her house. She wants to finish building it very soon because her plan is to rent out a few rooms. The loan from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her do that. She will use it to purchase winter clothing, especially because it is in high demand during this winter season.

** Ofelia is photographed wearing the orange shirt.

loans.use: to finish construction of rental rooms in her house.

loans.name: Dinora Cecilia

texts.es:
Dinora, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 18, 15 y 12 años de edad, ella junto a su esposo trabajan la agricultura, sembrando hortalizas desde hace 8 años, siembran pipián, ejotes, chiles y tomates.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos y pesticidas, esta inversión le ayudara para dar los cuidos necesarios con la intención de recibir una buena cosecha y abundante producción.
Su aspiración es cosechar buenos frutos y poder comercializar para tener buenos ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Dinora lives with her husband and their three children; ages 18, 15, and 12.  She and her husband are farmers, and they have been growing vegetables for eight years.  They grow squash, beans, chili peppers, and tomatoes.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and pesticides.  This investment will help her to provide the necessary care in order to have a good harvest and an abundant production.

Her aspiration is to have a good harvest in order to be able to sell and have good income for her family

loans.use: to buy chemical and natural fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable crops.
