loans.name: Bokk Jom Taiba Mbaye 1 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe set composé de 5 femmes vendeuses qui habitent dans un village.
elles  achétent en groupage de l'arachide pour en faire de la transformation en produits locaux (huile, aliments de bétails...).elles bénéficient d'une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans la transformation et dispose d'une bonne clientele. ce financement leur permettra d'augmenter leur fond de roulement, et d'entretenir et payer le scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is composed of five businesswomen who live in the same village. They buy peanuts as a group to make them into local products (oil, livestock fodder, etc.). They have more than five years of experience in this business and have attracted a good clientele. This loan will permit them to grow their working capital, care for their children and pay their children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Gaudiosa has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. 

Gaudiosa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gaudiosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina residente en la ciudad D. Cartagena con su esposo y tiene 6 hijos en las edades D. 19 a 37 años, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, sandalias típicas que trae desD. Sincelejo en el departamento D. Sucre. En su vivienda tiene una vitrina donD. los exhibe mercancías variadas y también venD. puerta a puerta D. contado y a crédito ajustando el plan D. pago a las especificaciones D. sus clientes. Inicialmente comenzó su vida como negociante con la venta D. chichas D. maíz, y D. arroz, y luego agregó almuerzos, hoy venD. cosméticos en la residencia donD. habita con su esposo y su hija. Su meta es convertir su negocio en una gran miscelánea donD. sus clientes encuentren todo lo que ellos necesitan. Esta es la razón por la cual ha planeado lograr inyecciones D. capital D. trabajo, producto D. créditos, como los que esta aplicando con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará D. contado y en mayor volumen, chancletas, ropa, accesorios para niñas, sandalias y cosméticos; todo esto aprovechando la fechas festivas por motivo del día del amor y D. la amistad, época en la cual repuntan sus ventas. En su negocio maneja una rotación D. cuentas por cobrar D. 30 días, adecuada para este tipo D. negocios, una rotación D. inventarios D. 52 días y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 24,02 %. Indicadores desD. los cuales planea su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Marina lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and six children, ages 19 to 37.  She sells cosmetics and typical sandals that she brings from Sincelejo in the department of Sucre.  In her house she has a display case to exhibit the variety of merchandise.  She also sells door-to-door either in cash or on a credit basis, adjusting the terms to each customer.  She began business selling corn and rice drinks and later added lunches.  But now she sells cosmetics out the home she resides in with her husband and daughter.  Her goal is to convert the business into a large bazaar where customers can find everything they need.

This is why she wants to obtain working capital in the form of loans such as this credikiva which is her first through the Mario Santo Doming Foundation.  She will use it to buy larger volumes of products, paying in cash, such as flip-flops, clothing, girls' accessories, sandals and cosmetics.  This is mainly for the upcoming love and friendship festivities which always increase sales.  She has an accounts-receivable turnover of 30 days and an inventory turnover of 52 days.  Her profit over sales is no less than 24.02%.  These indicators help her plan business growth.

loans.use: To buy in cash and larger quantities: flip-flops, , girls' accessories, sandals and .

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cow hides for resale, to be used for manufacturing various items

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah is a 34-year-old divorced woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for 16 years, having acquired capital from her previous employment as a housemaid. Her hardship is lack of enough capital to buy different forms of synthetic hair. Her vision is to open up another salon and to educate her children. Norah needs this loan to buy hair weaves for the salon.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves for the salon

loans.name: Les Amis Sincères Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "LES AMIS SINCÈRES" est composé de trois membres qui se connaissent depuis leur jeune âge et qui sont des amies. La représentante de ce groupe du nom de Félicité est celle qui à une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Félicité est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à Octave, un commerçant. Le couple n'a pas encore d'enfant. Félicité a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins, Félicité mène comme activité la vente de tissus dans sa boutique au Bénin. Félicité exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'années. Félicité s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Félicité et les autres membres du groupe "LES AMIS SINCÈRES" sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The "Les amis sincères" group is made up of 3 women who have been friends since they were young girls. The group is asking for a second loan from ALIDé so that they can raise their level of business activity and better satisfy their customers. The group´s representative, Félicité, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. She is 36 years old and married to Octave, a trader. The couple do not yet have children. Félicité left school before high school and has been earning a living selling fabrics in her shop, in Benin, for about 12 years. She gets her supplies locally.

Félicité and the other members of the "Les amis sincères" group will use the loan to strengthen their businesses and better satisfy customer demand. Their ultimate aim is to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Farkhanda's Group

texts.en:
Farkhanda is married and has 3 children. Her eldest son is working while other 2 are very young and are not yet of school-going age. 

Farkhanda is very supportive of her family.  She sells decoration pieces to different gift shops in the market. She is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.  Her husband is a teacher. He teaches in a school and also tutors different students in his area for a reasonable rate. 

Farkhanda has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her business. With the loan, she will buy decoration pieces like vases, artificial flowers & sceneries, etc. in larger quantities to sell to her customers to earn better profits.   She is confident that this investment will be productive one for her and she will be able to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy decoration pieces to sell

loans.name: Olga Oliva

texts.es:
Olga tiene 47 años, vive sola en Pimampiro que se encuentra a una hora de Ibarra en la Provincia de   Imbabura-Ecuador. Olga se describe como una persona responsable, trabajadora y emprendedora.

Olga trabaja sola en la profesión de corte y confección, ella elabora toda prenda de vestir para niños y adultos. Es su décimo crédito con Fodemi el mismo que va a ocupar invirtiendo en la compra de una máquina de cocer ya que la actual está en malas condiciones y no le deja cumplir bien su trabajo y es su única herramienta para generar producción; con esta inversión auemntaría su productividad optimizando su tiempo y así generará mayores ingresos económicos.

Su sueño es poder tener un local grande, con unas 10 máquinas y poder emplear a personal para que su negocio se convierta en una gran miroempresa de confeción de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Olga’s 47 years old and lives alone in Pimampiro which is located an hour away from Ibarra in Imbabura Province, Ecuador.  She describes herself as a responsible, hardworking and enterprising person.  Olga works by herself as a dressmaker.  She makes all kinds of articles of clothing for children and adults.  

This is her 10th loan with Fodemi that she’ll use to buy  a sewing machine because the one she has is in poor condition and does not let her do her work well and is her only work tool to generate production.  With this investment she’ll increase productivity organizing her time to generate increased income.  Her dream is to have a large locale with ten sewing machines and to be able to hire personnel so that her business will become a large clothes making micro business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nicaise

texts.fr:
Client de 47 ans, marie et père de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 27 ans  et a sa charge  5 autres nièces et neveux de sa défunte sœur.
N'ayant pas eu a poursuivre  des longues etudes, il apprend le métier de maçonnerie auprès de son oncle.
Client très exemplaire, il fait preuve des réguliers remboursements et a des épargnes considérables.Étant leader de son groupe, il a bien géré les membres durant les differents cycles, ces differents  crédits lui ont permis  d'atteindre une autonomie financière.
Ce nouveau prêt va lui permettre d'acheter de nouveau 2 tonnes de ciment,16m3 de sable, 12m3 de gravier, des moules, des carreaux et des colorants pour tuiles.
Sa stratégie est de fabriquer  des buses, des latrines turcs, des paves et tous ce dont qu'on utilisent pour la construction.Ces clients sont satisfait de son travail , très serviable il fait la fierté de sa famille .

Dans l'avenir il pense être un grand entrepreneur pour réaliser les grands marches de construction de l'état.
texts.en:
This customer is 47 years old, married and father to two children of eight and 27 years old respectively. He also has five nieces and nephews (his deceased sister's children) in his care. Since he did not pursue his education, he learnt the building trade from his uncle. He is an exemplary customer,  making regular repayments and having considerable savings. He is the leader of his group and has managed the group members well during their various loan cycles, and these loans have allowed him to gain financial autonomy. 

This new loan will enable him to buy two more tons of cement, 16 cubic meters of sand, 12 cubic meters of gravel, molds, tiles and stains for roof tiles. He plans eventually to make pipe culverts, Turkish-style toilets, pavestones and everything that is used for building. These customers are satisfied with his work, he is very helpful and his family is very proud of him. 

He is thinking of one day becoming a significant entrepreneur so that he can undertake large state construction projects.

loans.use: To buy 2 tons ton of cement, 16 cubic meters of sand, iron bars for cement (12) and white cement

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.ru: Барнохон трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем, мать четверых детей. Она на протяжении многих лет занимается бизнесом, вначале она продавала молочную продукцию и постепенно поменяла вид бизнеса на продажу сезонных товаров. В настоящее время она продает промышленные товары. Для расширения бизнеса она хочет получить займ в размере 6000 сомони чтобы пополнить свой оборот зимними товарами. Она надеется получить займ и получить больше дохода. Заранее благодарна всем за предоставленную помощь.
texts.en: Barnokhon is a hardworking woman. She is married and the mother of four children. She has been working for many years; at first she sold dairy products and gradually transitioned to selling seasonal goods. She currently sells industrial goods. To expand her business she is requesting a loan of 6000 somoni to add to her collection of winter clothes. She hopes to receive this loan and earn more income. She thanks you in advance for extending your help.

loans.use: purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.ru: Азамжон занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где сеет зерновые культуры. Ему 32 года. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Целью получения кредита является покупка семян пшеницы и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Azamjon is a farmer. He rents the land where he sows his crops. He is 32 years old. He is married. He has three children. His wife works on a small farm. He is taking out a loan to buy wheat seed and fuel for a tractor.

loans.use: to buy wheat seed and fuel for a tractor.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is a 40 year old a married woman who has six children. Three of the children are in school. She has a business of selling in a grocery store in bor south Sudan for one year.

Rebeca requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase bean, sorghum, sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans, sorghum and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is a 38-year-old married woman with six children, three of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food at a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years. 

Viviana is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase onions and tomatoes for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Yayaa

texts.en: Yayaa  sells maize and plantains at Mbem near Abura.   She is a single parent and has 4 children.  Yayaa has been selling sells maize and plantains for 3 years. She is responsible for the general upkeep of her children.    She will use her loan to purchase more maize and plantains to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy maize and plantains

loans.name: Kipngetich

texts.en:
Kipngetich, the 28-year-old father of a four-year-old, has been farming for seven years, selling his produce of milk and vegetables at the local market. Low market prices for his products are his main challenge. He gets additional income from his drawings.

Kipngetich has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow, the income from which will enable him to better maintain his family and gradually increase his number of dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sundus's Group

texts.en:
Sundus is a member of this group from Iraq. Sundus is 44 years old; married and has two children . She is working from home sewing cloths for women and children, using her sewing skills she generated additional income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.
She has two years of experience with her home based sewing business activity .she would like to buy new sewing machine and embroidery machine.
She is aiming to develop her business and increase her production and sell to retailers and continue assisting her husband with the additional income.
They preferred to hide their faces for cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Sundus's  group  3,000 loan helped a member  to buy new sewing machine and embroidery machine.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen lives in Escobedo Nuevo Leon Mexico. She began her business 6 years ago in her house\\\'s porches with the hamburger and burrito sales. Carmen is a very hard-working person and surrendered to her family. With a son who she wants to offer him a good education, she undertook her own business. Carmen is married with Adolfo who is working in industrial pieces sales; she knows that her husband\\\'s job has bad seasons, for that reason she looked another way to survive in those difficult seasons when her husband doesn\\\'t win enough money. She wants to give to her son a better standard of life, she thinks that the best inheritance for her small boy is a good education.

Carmen needs a loan of $550 USD to purchase construction material because she wants to put a roof to her house’s porch to improve the place where assists and gives service to her clients. Carmen hopes that with this remodeling her sales increase.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Carmen vive en Escobedo Nuevo León México. Inició su negocio hace 6 años en la cochera de su casa con la venta de hamburguesas y burritos de harina. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Con un hijo al cual desea brindarle una buena educación, ella emprendió su propio negocio. Carmen esta casada con Adolfo quien se dedica a la venta de piezas industriales; ella sabe que el trabajo de su esposo tiene malas temporadas, por lo que ella buscó la manera de sobrevivir en esas temporadas en las que su esposo no gana suficiente dinero, por esa razón emprendió su negocio. Ella desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y dice que la mejor herencia para su pequeño es una buena educación.

Carmen necesita de $550 USD para comprar material de construcción ya que desea poner un techo a su cochera para mejorar el lugar donde atiende y da servicio a sus clientes. Carmen desea que con esta remodelación sus ventas aumenten.

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angela is 28 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a hair salon which is well patronised. She intends to add 'con-roll' and other hair plaiting styles to her range of available services. She wants to use the KIVA loan to purchase inventory like hair mesh and an additional hair-dryer to meet customers' demands.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Luís Martín

texts.en:
Luís Martín is married and has two children. He is originally from Reynosa, in the Mexican state of Tamaulipas, which is where he still resides. He started as a carpenter when he was very young to help his parents cover household expenses. He did not have the opportunity to get an education, but he believes it is very important and wishes to see his children graduate. This is part of the reason he has worked so hard day in and day out at his shop that he started 29 years ago.

In order to offer a better service to his customers, Luís is requesting a loan of $375, which he will use to purchase a saw and other carpentry tools necessary to keep his business going. What he currently has is outdated and insufficient. With the new additions, he hopes to increase production and the quality of his products. You can help Luís, and he is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Luís Martín es casado y tiene dos hijos, él es originario de la ciudad de Reynosa, Tamaulipas, desde muy pequeño se dedica a la carpintería para ayudarle a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero cree que es una preparación muy necesaria y desea que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios, para lo que se esfuerza día a día en su taller que inició hace 29 años.

Para mejorar el servicio que ofrece, Luís necesita de un crédito por $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de una cortadora que requiere para continuar trabajando ya que la que tenia es muy antigua y ya no sirve, con esta adquisición espera incrementar su producción y la calidad de sus productos. Tú puedes ayudar a Luís, no lo dudes más, en tus manos esta en bienestar de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase a saw and other carpentry tools

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo is an artisan specializing in leather. He makes medium-quality soccer balls, the same that are marketed in the fairs in the city of El Alto. He has eight children, all of which are independent. He works to support himself and his wife. They live in the Villa Dolores zone of the city of El Alto.

He asks for a loan to perchase high-quality material (leather) to increase his revenue. This is his twelfth credit. His good payment history on his previous eleven loans permits him to access another loan without any objection.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Cirilo es artesano en cuero de res y elabora balones de fútbol de mediana calidad, mismos que son comercializados en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Tiene ocho hijos todos independientes. El trabaja para poder mantener a su esposa y a él mismo. Vive en la Zona de Villa Dolores de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra materia prima (cuero de res) para incrementar su ingresos. Es el crédito numero doce; su buen historial de pago de los once créditos previos le permite acceder a otro préstamo sin ninguna objeción.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality material

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long N. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Kampong Cham, province, Cambodia. She is a street-vendor who sells fermented fish. She earns about $2.50 a day. Her husband works as a policeman and earns about $2 each day.

Mrs. Long Neky is humbly requesting a loan for $400 to open a small grocery store that several of her children can operate. She hopes this new grocery store will enable her and her family to generate more income.

loans.use: Open a small grocery store to increase the family income

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther A., 58 years old, lives in Benin City. She is married and has nine children. Sells beef to people living in her community. She has been in this business since 1977 after one year of learning the business. She has been with LAPO for two years now and she is a faithful client. She seeks the sum of $400 to buy more beef to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more beef to sell

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: Ramatu M. is 37 years old, married and has 4 children, and she hails from Mebamu town in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells jewelry and clothes. She is in need of  $1200 to enable her buy more jewelry and clothes to sell. She has 10 years experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry and clothes to sell

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en: Joyce is 37 years old and divorced with four children of ages 2, 5, 7, and 10. Her current business is selling matooke in the market.. She intends to use the profits to buy a big vehicle(truck) for carrying the matooke to up countries and distant areas.

loans.use: To buy more matooke for sale

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan is a single man who lives in the Khachmaz region. He was born in 1985. Rovshan has worked one year in his auto repair business. Now he requests a loan of $775 to buy the necessary supplies to improve his business and increase the number of his clients.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for auto repairs

loans.name: Masanda A(Ii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Winnie Luyimbazzi. She is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to expand business. Winnie is 27 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 months to 7 years old and three of them go to school. Each week, Winnie makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a milk selling business.

Winnie is joined in her small group by Barbara N., Adrine A., Julian T., and Betty M.. Barbara N. has a business selling used clothes and wants to venture into new clothes. Adrine A. is currently operating a business selling clothes and wants a loan to increase stock. Julian T. operates a business of clothing sales and wants to boost business. Betty M. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To add capital to salon business

loans.name: Sitope

texts.en: Bar Mokpoko is a small restaurant run by Sitope A., the woman on the right in the photo.  The other woman is her mother, who helps her daughter run her business.  Sitope is the married mother of one baby, who comes with her to work each day (another reason why her mother is there to help out!)  Sitope benefits from the location of her shop, in the middle of the bustling central market of Adéta, attracting hungry customers as they do their weekly shopping.  Bar Mokpoko specializes in ‘Fufu Chevre,’ a traditional Togolese dish made from yam paste in a sauce made with goats’ meat (chevre.)  With this loan, Sitope would like to buy more yams and goats’ meat with which to make ‘Fufu,’ to increase her productivity in order to provide for her new family.

loans.use: To buy more yams and goats’ meat

loans.name: Bocc Dieuf Group

texts.fr:
The group Bocc Dieuf comprises women who work n the fabrication of textile goods and the trade of food products, activities which do not require exorbitant means for women who have become the heads of their households to pull themselves out of precarious living conditions. This loan will allow the group to increase its supplies obtained from the louma (the weekly local market), to diversify its wares in both quality and quantity, to raise capital geared towards increasing business profits, and to revitalize its productivity and diversify the range of products intended for sale in the loumas.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupement Bocc Dieuf est constitué de femmes qui s'activent dans la confection des articles textiles et dans le commerce de produits alimentaires, un travail ne nécessitant pas les voies royales pour sortir les femmes devenues chefs de ménage de la précarité. Ce prêt permettra d'élargir le systéme d'approvisionnement des louma et diversifier les offres en qualité et en quantité, renforcer le capital du groupemnt destiné aux activités de commerce pour augmenter les bénéfices, redynamiser la productitivté et diversifer des produits destinés à la vente dans les loumas. (Deux (2) membres ne sont pas sur la photo)

loans.use: To trade food products and to make textile goods

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is 53 years old and the mother of four children. She has rented a store and has been selling grocery products like pasta, cocoa products, tinned milk, tinned fish, soft drinks, sanitary towels, sugar, etc. for 14 years now. Millicent’s last child is currently in university and she pays fees from the proceeds of the business. She wants to use her loan to buy more products like sanitary towels, pampers, bathing and washing soaps, soft drinks, etc. to increase inventory and sales. Millicent is a member of the group called God is Good. Members agree in principle to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of grocery products

loans.name: Amani Hondogo Group

texts.en:
Suzo L. is married with 4 young boys. He is 46 and has been operating his business for 9 years. He works in agriculture, selling and raising cattle. He works from 5am to 6pm daily, earning a monthly profit of $150. Suzo has taken out 4 loans with Tujijenge previously. With this loan from Kiva, Suzo hopes to buy medicine for his cows and therefore increase the sales and profit of his business.

Suzo is the leader of his subgroup Amani Hondogo. In this group he will share the loan with four other entrepreneurs. They all operate in the food sector, selling eggs, vegetables and milk. Each member in the group is responsible for the other, and therefore they guarantee the full payback of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase medicine for his cows and to increase sales.

loans.name: Polycarp

texts.en: Polycarp A. is 40 years old and married and has 2 children.  Polycarp lives in Ekperi, Edo State, Nigeria.  He owns a piece of land where he plants groundnuts and corn.  He started farming in 1998.  He is in need of the loan amount of $850 to buy fertilizers and hire labourers to clear his farmland.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and hire labor for clearing my farm

loans.name: Muyasar

texts.ru:
Аминова Муяссар 1960 года рождения, она разведена и у нее один ребенок. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она  начала в 2001 году, с продажи женской одежды.  Она торгует на рынке «Пенчшер» города Душанбе. Так как она сама женщина и разбирается очень хорошо в тканях ей легко. У нее много клиентов, как обычные покупатели, так и швейные цеха. В его ассортименте имеются сейчас  такие ткани как  шифон, шелк, штапель  и т.д.
Свой товар Муяссар закупает в оптовых рынках. В момент свадебных сезонов ей необходимы дополнительные средства для увеличения ассортимента и количество продаваемого товара. Для этого она хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони и погасить его в течении года.
texts.en:
Muyasar A. was born in 1960, she is divorced and has one child. She became an entrepreneur in 2001, when she started selling women’s clothing. She works at the “Pandzhsher” market in Dushanbe. Since she is a woman and knows a lot about fabrics, the business is easy for her. She has many customers, both regular customers and sewing shops. Her product assortment includes fabrics such as chiffon, silk, etc.

Muyasar purchases her products at wholesale markets. During wedding season she needs additional resources in order to increase her product assortment and quantity of products. She would like to take out a 4100 somoni ($1200) loan and will pay it back over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is a woman full of strength. She is married with 7 children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She goes to the villages around Benin City to buy food items and palm oil. She then sells these items in one of Benin City's most popular markets. She started this business in 1994 and has been borrowing from LAPO for 5 years now to help grow her business.  

Dona is asking for a loan of $675 to enable her to buy more food items and palm oil to sell. She will be very grateful to Kiva lenders if they can assist her. She says that it will not only benefit her business by helping achieve her goal of expansion, but also her family, who she helps support with the profits.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married and has two children. Her family of four lives in Khoost, Western Ukraine. Olena has a small business selling household items. She’s been running this enterprise for 10 years. Olena has gained much experience working in this sphere of trade and has been able to increase her income up to $1,000. 

Olena is a typical entrepreneur who is passionate about her venture and communicates that excitement to potential customers. She is seeking a 6000 Grivna loan to increase her stock. We are confident that the modesty, diligence, and responsibility that have helped Olena develop her venture and gain a good reputation among other vendors will help her promptly repay this loan and allow her to succeed in her business endeavors.

Note: The photo shows Olena with one of her daughters.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Sofia Salvador

texts.pt:
Sofia salvador C. é natural de Boane um dos distrito da província de Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, tem 55 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 6 filhos com idades entre 30, 27, 24, 21, 18 e 14 anos respectivamente. Para alem dos filhos sustenta um neto que vive com ele na sua casa. Tem casa própria.

Sofia estudou até 4ªclasse e parou por falta de condições dado que perdeu muito cedo o seu pai. Sofia é trabalhadora numa associação chamada Gueguegue a 8 anos, desempenhando as funções de contabilista. Tem um salário mensal de 3500,00mt e também é comerciante com uma mesa movél.

Este é o 4º empréstimo na HLUVUKU-ADSEMA e primeiro no Kiva, onde os três primeiros todos aplicados na compra de material de construção foram de 8000,00mt; 10000,00mt e 15000,00mt respectivamente. Assim Sofia pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim de construir um estabelecimento comercial para inciar negocio de venda a retalho em instalaçoes melhoradas.
texts.en:
Sofia Salvador C. is a native of Boane, one of the districts of Maputo Province in the south of Mozambique. She is 55 years old, married, and mother of 6 children aged 30, 27, 24, 21, 18 and 14,. In addition to her children, she supports a grandchild who lives in her home. She has her own home.

Sofia studied through the 4th grade, and stopped due to losing her father very early and financial circumstances. Sofia has worked for an association called Gueguegue for 8 years, keeping its books. She has a monthly salary of 3500 meticais and is also a business woman with a street cart.

This is her 4th loan from Hluvuku-Adsema and the first on Kiva. Sofia's first three loans were all used for the purchase of construction material, and were in the amounts of 8000 meticais, 10,0000 meticais, and 15,000 meticais respectively. Sofia plans to repay before the loan is due in order to request another one. She would like to build a store to start a scrap sales business in a better facility.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Palmeras (“Palm Trees”) Village Bank. Teofila is 77 years old and married with six children. She has a stand in the F. Vivanco market, where she sells a variety of traditional and non-traditional clothing. She and her daughter also rent out different costumes. Teofila needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy hats and shirts for Carnaval. Teofila’s dreams are to improve her business and have more investment capital.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras.

Teofila es casada, tiene 77 años y 6 hijos, Teofila tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donD. venD. ropa típica y también variada, además junto a su hija se dedican al alquiler D. disfraces diversos.

Teofila necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. sombrero, blusas para carnavales.

Los sueños D. Teofila son mejorar su negocio y ampliar su capital.

loans.use: Buy Carnaval hats and shirts to sell

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 24-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa, Lebanon. Adel has been working as a plumber for 12 years. Adel requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua (Kiva's Field Partner) in order to do some maintenance work on his machines. This is the first time that Adel has requested a loan.

His clients are contractors with municipalities. Adel decided on doing this business because he knows his business and he also has a shop for sanitary items. In the future, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his plumbing equipment.

loans.name: Carina Aquilina

texts.es:
La señora Carina es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 28 años de edad, tiene 01 hijo y uno mas en espera, es conviviente y posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja hace 01 año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la compra, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, su primer préstamo fue de S/.500.00 nuevos soles que le sirvió para adquirir alimento balanceado para engordar sus vacunos. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 03 meses de manera puntual, el dinero le servirá para completar su capital y adquirir mas toros para engorde y venderlos en tres meses a un mejor precio en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo o Ilave. Las ganancias le servirán para poder ahorrar y comprarse una casa en Ilave para sus hijos. 
Ella se siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carina is a member of the “Miraflores” Community Bank in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 28 years old, has one child, and one child on the way. She is married and has completed secondary school. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for one year. Her business is to buy, fatten, and sell cattle. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used to acquire balanced food to fatten her cattle. With this loan of 500 soles, which she promises to repay punctually in 3 months, she will have more capital and will acquire more cattle to fatten and sell in three months at a better price in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo or Ilave. She will save her earnings so that she can buy a house in Ilave for her children. She is very thankful to Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more cattle to fatten and sell in three months at a better price in the livestock fairs in Pilcuyo or Ilave. She will save her earnings so that she can buy a house in Ilave for her children.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita O. grows rice for a living. She is 49 years old and has no children. She has always been a farmer.  Her parents grow rice too and the knowledge of farming was passed on to her and her siblings. Her husband is the one who manages their farm. Together, they grow rice to support their family's needs. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer. She is also interested in finding some other possible areas of income. In this way, she too could contribute to the family income.

CEVI provides their clients with credit assistance, training and insurance coverage. Because of these, CEVI believes that they have done important work in the society by improving people's lives.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kadiatou  Bouaré

texts.fr:
Madame K.  Bouaré   est âgée de 35 ans,  veuve et mère de  5  enfants, elle vit  dans une grande  famille avec  sa mère,  ses frères et sœurs au  quartier Sécoura de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Informaticienne et transitaire de formation, K. est également commerçante. Elle a appris le commerce auprès de sa mère qui  est très versée dans les activités économiques  à Ségou. K. mène plusieurs  activités qui vont de la gestion d’une entreprise, au commerce de céréales et d’habits. C’est dans le commerce d’habits teintés qu’elle mène depuis 8 ans et dans lequel elle jouit d’une grande clientèle et d’une grande notoriété, qu’elle excelle le plus. Elle reçoit des commandes de la  Coté d’ivoire et de la  France.
C’est dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en France qu’elle  fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. En  relation avec cette dernière depuis 56 mois, après 8 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien  remboursés, elle est son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter 2 pièces de bazins riches et 10 couleurs de teintures. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui lui servira à subvenir à ses propres besoins et contribuer aux charges de la grande famille.
Son ambition est d’ouvrir un magasin pour faire le commerce de céréales sinon du ciment ou du fer à béton.
texts.en:
Ms. K. Bouaré, age 35, is a widow and the mother of 5 children. She lives in a large family with her mother, brothers, and sisters in the Ségou district (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A data processor and shipping agent by training, she is also a merchant. She learned commerce from her mother, who is well-versed in business in Ségou. K. works in several sectors, from enterprise management to commerce in grain and in clothing. For eight years, she’s been in the business of dyed clothing, in which she excels the most and enjoys many customers and fine distinction. She receives orders from Cote d’Ivoire and from France.

Concerned with satisfying her customers in France, she turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, which she has had an association with for 56 months. After 8 solidarity loans and 2 individual loans, all correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy 2 bolts of rich damask fabric and 10 different colors of dyes. Supplies of essential goods are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali) and are sold to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will serve to provide for herself and her large family. Her ambition is to open a store to do commerce in grain, otherwise in cement or in iron rods.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bolts of damask fabric and dyes

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa A. is 50 years old. She is married and has six children: two of them are currently in school and the others are out of school and living independently. She lives with her husband and two children in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.

Adwoa is a baker. She bakes meat pies and sells them to retailers. She also distributes her products to snack-bar operators. Adwoa also bakes and fries other pastries. She procures the raw materials such as flour, margarine, sugar, cooking oil, and so forth, from wholesalers in the nearby towns. Adwoa has been in this business for 30 years now and has won a number of customers over the years. She wants a loan to procure the ingredients in bulk so can supply her products to more customers and make more profit. The increased profits will help her pay for her children’s school bills.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu, a cosmetics and clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar, belongs to Nia safi group loan (Group code 2020) and currently earns an average monthly profit of $50 working daily at her business. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cosmetics and khanga for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Tatu is 36 years old, married, and has four children: ages 20, 18, 15 and 12. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and khanga for her business.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick B. has been selling flour in Moree, near Cape Coast, since 2005. He also works as an artist and driver, while his wife is a seamstress. Patrick has received an education through to senior high school. He is responsible for paying the utility bills and feeding his family. Patrick will use his loan to buy an overlock machine and flour for resale. He hopes to use his new profits to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy an overlock machine and flour for resale

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en: Ronaldo D. is 24 years old and is married to Rodaly. They have a two-year-old daughter named Angel. They are residing at Barangay St. Tomas, “where you can find hard working people,” says Ronaldo. He is a simple farmer who is asking the assistance of lenders to finance his rice farming. He is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000. According to Ronaldo, he will utilize his requested loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and some other farm inputs he needs. He hopes with the help of this loan that his harvest will be strong and his business will grow over time.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Jennie Lynn

texts.en: Jennie is the proud owner of an automotive paint shop in her village for the past 14 years. She is married and has four children from pre-school age to high school age, and her greatest aspiration is to be able to afford to send all of her children to college. She started her business with capital from her husband who had saved money from his income in another paint shop for them to start their own. With her Kiva loan, Jennie will be buying paint and other supplies needed for the shop. She also has additional income from a plot of land she farms on and part of her loan will be used to buy fertilizer and to rent a tractor for the fields. She hopes that with this extra money, she will be able to attract more customers and be able to save money to put away to help with her children's education.

loans.use: Automotive paint shop, buying supplies and farm inputs

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy responsable con su trabajo, vive con el padre de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Anteriormente sólo se dedicaba a la siembra de papa y arveja, pero desde hace 2 años empezó también a sembrar flores (gladiolos), por ser muy rentables durante las festividades. Para ello, alquiló chacras donde siembra los meses de enero y julio, para cosechar en las fechas claves, llegando a vender cada paquete de 12 docenas en 70 u 80 soles, pasadas estas fechas baja el precio hasta 20 soles por paquete. Entonces en esas épocas se dedica a sus cultivos de papa y arveja hasta el mes de octubre, donde nuevamente suben los precios de las flores. Aunque a veces debido a la sequía demoran en reventar los capullos, trata de contrarrestar este problema regando por las noches para facilitar el florecimiento de sus chacras. Delfina se siente muy contenta en la siembra y venta de flores y para que las trasporte sin maltratarse hasta el mercado, las envuelve cuidadosamente con papeles y rafia que guarda para la ocasión. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP y en todos estos ciclos demostró puntualidad en cada uno de sus pagos. Asimismo viene cumpliendo con mucha responsabilidad su cargo de tesorera de su banco comunal, donde se ha ganado el aprecio y respeto de todos sus compañeros. El dinero que solicita lo piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus siembras de flores, para que coseche en el mes de octubre.
texts.en:
Delfina is 40 years old, a very responsable woman who lives with the father of her 2 children in her own house. Before she used to sew potato and pea, but 2 years ago she also started sewing flowers (gladiolus) which are very profitable during the holidays. Therefore she rented land where she sews in the months of January and July in order to harvest on the key dates, thus being able to sell each packet of 12 dozen for 70 or 80 soles. After these dates the price is 20 soles per packet. During the low seasons she sews potato and pea until the month of October where the price of the flowers raise again. Sometimes the draught delays the flowers but then she waters them at night to facilitate the flowering on her land. Delfina is very happy sewing and selling flowers and in order to transport them safely to the market she wraps them carefully with paper and raffia which she keeps for the occasion. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she has always made the repayments punctually. She also carries out her post as treasurer of her community bank with responsibility and has earned the esteem and respect of her partners. The money will be spent on buying chemical fertilizers for the flowres so she can harvest in the month of October.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Aishat

texts.en: Aishat sells drinks, detergent, provisions, and other items. She is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N50000 to purchase more drinks to sell. The demand for her product is high right now.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sherlit

texts.en:
Sherlit L. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 35 years old. Sherlit is married and has 3 small children. To make a living, Sherlit owns and operates a snack-vending business in the food sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Sherlit has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Sherlit joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Sherlit has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC, and she is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for house renovation. This loan will be her eleventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house renovation

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: Magatte N. est une dame de 48 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Elle vend des fruit de saison et cet activité lui permet de contribuer aux charges familiales de la famille.

loans.use: Vente de fruits de saison

loans.name: Michell

texts.en:
“Learn to sacrifice to make your dreams come true,” says Michell A. from the village of Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 25 years old and only finished her high school education. In spite of this, she remains optimistic and she works hard to be able to earn a living for her family.

Michell manages a village store as her source of living. For her business to grow, she would like to borrow 8,000 PHP from Kiva lenders that she will invest in her business. She is glad that she can earn a weekly income of 1,250 PHP. Though her income is too little, she is thankful for being able to maintain her business and being able to save funds for her education. She hopes that lenders will allow her to borrow money to help with her business.

loans.use: Additional business capital

location.town: Ineangan Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh E. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished products to buyers who come directly to her house. She always makes at least 100 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. In addition, this family cultivates a rice crop.

To help facilitate the hard labor of the farm work, Nhanh E. requests a loan on Kiva to be used to purchase a cow which she will use to plow her farmland.

The family has seven children, two of whom are garment workers in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Our client is Clemencia.  She is part of a comunal bank consisting of 11 neighbors who live in the San Sebastián district of Cusco.  The group is called Maria Auxiliadora, named after a virgin of Peru.  She is a native of Cusco.

She is 39 years old.  She lives together with her partner and has 2 children.  She is a conductor in one of the collective buses in Cusco. She will use this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

Clemencia appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Transportation business

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkan sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 43ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de DJININA, sous préfecture de FANA, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers tels le charbon de bois l’habillement etc. 
Ces femmes viennent d’intégrer  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, des sacs de charbon de bois et des habillements pour femmes et hommes de tous les âges. Les habillements sont achetés à Fana, le charbon de bois est acheté en détail dans les villages environnants et sont revendus sur place à DJININA  généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkan group are married women who are, on average, 43 years old with two children. With their husbands and children, they live in large traditional households and reside in the village of Djinina, Fana sub-prefecture, Koulikoro region, in the Republic of Mali. They know each other through neighbourhood and familial relations. They run businesses selling various items such as charcoal, clothing, etc. These women joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of making their lucrative businesses more durable. They are working on their first loan through the institution. With this loan, they intend to buy bags of charcoal and clothing for men and women of all ages. The clothing is bought in Fana, the charcoal is bought at retail in the neighbouring villages, and the goods are sold on-the-spot in Djinina, generally in cash to a clientele composed of men and women. They each hope to realize an average profit of 25,000 FCFA per month. A portion of the profits will be reinvested in their businesses, and the rest used to meet the daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and charcoal

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a 35-year-old married mother of two children who are both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming community in the Western Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband provide for their family. Paulina is a food vendor, running a chop bar in her community where she prepares and sells all kinds of local dishes. Paulina has hired extra hands that work for her. She buys food ingredients such as maize, cassava, plantain, and vegetables from nearby towns. She has been in business for fifteen years and requests a loan so she can buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy food items in bulk.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi M. lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. Thecho is among the under-developed villages of Nepal, and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural pursuits.

Mrs. M. lives with her husband and one son. Her son is in pre-primary school. Both Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Shyam M., are engaged in making brass religious statues. They makes statues according to the orders of their customers.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs 20,000 loan to buy raw materials for making brass religious statues.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.en:
Gaudencio S. is from the village of Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 61 years old. Gaudencio is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gaudencio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Gaudencio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gaudencio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gaudencio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gaudencio is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feeds. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gaudencio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for pigs

loans.name: Llegaremos A La Meta Group

texts.es:
Idalia M., Margarita O. y María Auxiliadora M. integran al grupo Llegaremos a la meta, cuyo nombre es cogiera  porque ese es su lema. Estas tres mujeres emprendedoras iniciaran este año con toda la fuerza posible.

La señora Idalia M. comenzó vendiendo cosméticos y actualmente comercializa ropa, Margarita O. vende ropa, zapatos y cosméticos y María Auxiliadora M. por la mañanas vende tortillas, en las noches fritanga y los fines de semana sopa.
texts.en:
Idalia Morán, Margarita O., and María Auxiliadora M. make up the “We Will Reach Our Goal” Group. The name is appropriate because it is their slogan. These 3 enterprising women will begin the new year with all possible effort.

Mrs. Idalia Morán began by selling cosmetics and, now, she sells clothing. Margarita O. sells clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. María Auxiliadora M. sells tortillas in the mornings, grilled food in the afternoons, and soup on weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHING TO SELL

loans.name: Jose Absalon

texts.es: Jose Absalon de 28 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niños: Jaquelin Daniela de 8 añitos y Jose Absalon de 7, ambos estudiando la primaria, su esposa Jaqueline se encarga del cuido de los niños y de la casa, ademas elabora manualidades como vestiditos tejidos, tapetes, pacheros y otras cositas, las cuales vende para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Jose Absalon trabaja como docente desde hace 2 años en la Universidad Nacional Agraria de Chontales impartiendo clases de matematicas los fines de semana. Los dias de semana atiende su pequeño negocio de venta y reparacion de celulares, para lo cual esta solicitando este financiamiento esperando ser beneficiado con kiva, pues desea comprar algunos repuestos y herramientas de trabajo (tenazas, desatornillador, otros) que le hacen falta para atender mejor a su clientela.
texts.en:
28-year old Jose Absalon is married and has two children: Jaquelin Daniela (8) and Jose Absalon (7). They both attend primary school. His wife Jaqueline takes care of the children and the house, and she also makes clothing, knitted items, table cloths etc. which she sells in order to help her husband with household expenses. Jose Absalon has worked as a teacher for two years at the National Agricultural University of Chontales. He teaches mathematics classes at weekends. During the week he runs a small business selling and repairing cell phones, and it is for this work that he is asking for a loan from Kiva. He wants to buy spare parts and tools (pliers, screwdriver, etc) which he currently lacks. Then he will be better able to serve his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: tools to repair cell phones

loans.name: God Wonderers Group

texts.en:
Marget D. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Wonderers. She is 58 years old and married, and has ten children ranging in age from 27 to 47 years old. She also has ten siblings as well as many grandchildren.

Marget owns a dry fish business in the Thinker Village market. She has had this business for over ten years. She attracts customers by selling quality goods in a friendly manner. 

Marget plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more dry fish and goods for her business. She hopes that one day she will be so successful that she’s able to have a bigger dry fish business. She wants to be able to take care of her grandchildren’s schooling and health.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marget is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 45 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Rafael (57), quine es transportista, y de sus 2 jóvenes hijos: Jacqueline (22) y Jhon (17).

Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado según la temporada, tanto para hombres como mujeres. El negocio le gusta mucho porque lo hace sola y en este tiempo ha logrado captar buena cantidad de clientes, entre amigos y conocidos que le compran constantemente al crédito. También lleva mercadería a una zona minera donde tiene bastante demanda, además sabe que tiene gran capacidad de persuasión que le permite convencer a sus compradores respecto a los que les queda bien o no. La rentabilidad de su negocio se da porque la ropa y zapatos que vende los adquiere en la ciudad a precio cómodo. Es por eso que Juana está muy satisfecha, ya que puede ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Su mayor deseo es continuar en este rubro y para más adelante instalar un negocio en algún puesto de un centro comercial.

Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda obtener el crédito para trabajar y progresar. Juana tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería, pues tiene muchos pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Juana, 45, lives in her own home accompanied by her husband Rafael, 57, who works in transportation, and their 2 children Jacqueline, 22, and Jhon, 17. For 3 years she has sold clothing and shoes according to the season, for men as well as women. She likes this business very much because she does it on her own. Over time she has managed to attract a large number of customers, including friends and acquaintances who are constantly buying from her on credit. In addition she takes her merchandise to a mining area where there is substantial demand. She knows that she has a great capacity for persuasion which allows her to convince her customers with respect to whether an item looks good on them or not. Her business is profitable because she acquires the clothing and shoes that she sells in a city at a low price. For this reason Juana is very satisfied, since she can help her husband with the household expenses. Her main wish is to continue in this line of work, and, in the future, to have a business set up in a stall in a commercial center. This is the first time that she has had a loan from MFP, and she is very grateful to all of the people who are making it possible for her to obtain the loan and to progress. Juana is planning to use the money to buy a large quantity of merchandise, since she has many orders to fulfill.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise (buy clothing)

loans.name: Lidie

texts.fr: Lidie D. est une femme de 31 ans, Elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DAROU-KHOUDOSS depuis le 11 juillet 2006, et a été 7 fois de suite bénéficiaire de crédit. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité, elle fait de l'embouche bovine et vend divers produits tels que des téléphones portables, des tissus et des effets cosmétiques. Les bénéfices générés par ses activités commerciales lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Lidie D. is a 31-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. She has been a member of the village bank of Darou-Khoudoss since July 11, 2006 and was granted 7 consecutive loans. She is very experienced in her business, which is rearing cattle. She also sells various products, such as cell phones, fabrics and cosmetics. The profit from these activities enables her to pay for her needs.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an ox and various products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Pisith

texts.en:
Mr. Pisith S., who was born in 1981, is a villager in Thmei village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land on which he grows rice, not for selling but to support his family. Aside from this he is a construction worker, too. His wife, Mrs. Rorm Net, owns a general store in local village.

This couple tries to work hard but they still earn a low income. Thus, they decided to start a new business but they did not have enough money. Accordingly, Mr. Pisith S. is applying for a loan to buy some piglets to raise and some pig feed.

Mr. Pisith S. is the father of four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local public school while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy some piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Souleye

texts.fr: Monsieur Souleye D. est un jeune commerçant qui exploite du sel dans la zone de Joal situé à 37 km de Mbour . le but du prêt est l'acquisition d'une charrette et d'un cheval pour ralier les villages environnants pour la revente du sel. Cette activité lui permet de vivre avec sa famille et de pouvoir bénéficier des revenus lui permettant de faire face aux exigences de la vie
texts.en:
Mr. Souleye D. is a young businessman who trades in salt in Joal, 37km from Mbour. He aims to use this loan to acquire a horse cart to sell salt in the surrounding villages. This business allows him to live with his family and to benefit from the profits, allowing him to meet life’s demands.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of solar lantern

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Un Pan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. KO. Un P. is the village bank president, selected by all sixteen members of the group loan in Prey Lvea Kaeut village in Takeo province. Each member of the bank loan will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. KO. Un P. sells vegetables and fruits at the local market to earn some money to support her family. She is a widow with two children who attend school in the local village. Although she works hard at her business, she earns little income. To improve her family's living conditions, she wants to start a new business but does not have enough money. Therefore, Mrs. KO. Un P. is asking for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Yung

texts.en:
Yung S., 41, is widowed and resides with her two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. S. is a housewife while her daughter is a vegetable seller, earning a gross income of about USD 24 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to commute to work.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike for the children to commute to work

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Bancomunal Manantial, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, el mayor de 34 años, el segundo de 30 años y las 2 ultimas de 17 y 14 años, la última sigue estudiando en la secundaria. 

Fautina se dedica a la venta de repuestos de carros como son: coronas, tren, tren fijos, deslizantes. Desde el 2002 vende en su propia casa, este negocio surgió como idea y necesidad de su esposo que es mecánico y le propuso abrir este negocio.

A Faustina le dificulta el tiempo, tiene mucha clientela y no le abastece el tiempo para poder atender en su negocio, debido a que todos los productos que tiene los manda a traer de diferentes tiendas de Lima.

A Faustina le gusta las capacitaciones que recibe en su bancomunal, por que de esa manera aprendió a tratar mejor a sus clientes y es una mejor persona gracias a las Charlas de orientación familiar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Faustina lo va ha invertir en la compra de repuestos especificamente trenes fijos. 

El sueño de Faustina es tener su tienda de variados repuestos con todo lo necesario, y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Faustina, 50, is a member of Manantial (The Spring) communal bank. She has four children. The oldest is 34, the second is 30, and the two youngest are 17 and 14. The youngest is still in secondary school. Since 2002, Faustina has sold vehicle replacement parts; she set up the business in her own home. Her husband is a mechanic and his need for parts led to his suggestion that she set up the business. It’s difficult for Faustina to have enough time to do all her work because she has many customers and she has to send for the needed parts to various stores throughout Lima. Faustina enjoys the training sessions she gets at her communal bank because she learned how to provide better customer service and she feels she’s a better person thanks to the family training sessions. Faustina will use the requested funds to buy replacement parts, specifically gear shafts. Faustina’s dream is to have her store stocked with everything necessary and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Rony Neftali

texts.es:
El Sr. Rony A., se dedica al comercio y su actividad principal es el destazo de Ganado, negocio que opera bajo el nombre de Carnicería “A.” que esta ubicado en la aldea de Santa Ana, Jamastran.
Don Rony, tiene un año de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio y es notable que durante este tiempo lo a sabido administrar, ya que nos comento que el empezó a destazar una vaca cada 15 días y actualmente esta destazando una vaca por semana y la demanda de carne va en aumento, él anteriormente destazaba y vendía la carne solo con los vecinos de la aldea de Santa Ana y El Coyolar;  ahora sale a vender a otras aldeas y comunidades donde ya tiene los clientes y lo esperan cada fin de semana con la carne.

Don Rony es compañero de hogar de la Señora Jessica Gonzáles la cual es ama de casa y se dedica al cuidado de sus 2 hijos y a los trabajos del hogar.
Rony con las ganancias generadas de su negocio ha logrado pagar los gastos escolares y crianza de sus hijos.  

El Sr. A. en la actualidad no cuenta con el capital necesario para trabajar mas libremente, ya que cuando sale a comprar las reses que necesita para el destazo, muchas veces le salen vendiendo mas de una vaca y el no pude comprárselas por falta de capital. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas vacas para destazo.
texts.en:
Rony A. is a butcher. He has a butcher shop called, Carnicería “A.” located in the village of Santa Ana, Jamastran. Rony has been in this line of work for a year and it is noteworthy that in this time he has known how to administer it well in that he commented to us that he started out butchering a cow every 15 days and now he’s butchering a cow a week and demand for meat is increasing. He used to butcher and sell meat only to his neighbors in the villages of Santa Ana and El Coyolar. Now, however, he goes out to other villages and communities where he already has customers that expect him to bring meat every weekend. Rony is housemate to Jessica Gonzáles who is a housewife; she cares for their two children and does the household chores. Rony will use profits from his business to raise his children and pay for their schooling. Currently, Mr. A. lacks enough capital to work more efficiently because when he goes out to buy cows to butcher often he is offered more than one to buy but he can’t afford to do so because of lack of capital. He will use the loan to buy more cows to butcher.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam Y. is a modest villager living in Kompong Tom Province. She is fifty-two years old and married with two children, one is married and the other is attending school. Sam Y. generates her daily income by selling snack cakes and other grocery items to neighbors and passers-by. She started her business years ago and makes a daily profit of around $3. Her husband has been operating a business of driving a horse-cart taxi. Since she sold nearly all her items, Sam Y. wants to restock by asking for a loan to purchase addition grocery inventory to continue selling.

loans.use: Grocery store inventory

loans.name: Hesbon

texts.en:
Hesbon has been practising mixed farming, for the past 6 years, in Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has employed one farmhand. His main products are milk and tea, which he sells locally. He is a happy farmer since he has been able to provide for his needs with the income from his farming activities.

Hesbon has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He, however, faces the challenge of poor markets for his products. He would like to have a pure breed of animals in the future.

Hesbon is 27 years old and single. He is grateful to Juhudi for the good work.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: H. Nguyễn Thị (20201020104) is a 34-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is the group leader of this six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm Xá 3 nhóm 19 (Nhóm 19). H. is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,100,000 VND a month. H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve her business. The loan will be her first from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Nghiêm Thị D. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Nguyễn Thị Tính (0) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 3. Nghiêm Thị Q. (0) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 4. Nghiêm Thị Huệ (0) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food. 5. Nguyễn Thị Tỵ (0) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** H. Nguyễn Thị (20201020104) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm Xá 3 nhóm 19 (Nhóm 19). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh D. chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương. H. thực hiện công việc kinh D. này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2.100.000 VND. H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh D. của cô ấy/ anh ấy. H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nghiêm Thị D. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Nguyễn Thị Tính (0) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 3. Nghiêm Thị Q. (0) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 4. Nghiêm Thị Huệ (0) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 5. Nguyễn Thị Tỵ (0) là 33 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh D. trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh D. là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các D. Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle to expand her business

loans.name: Samuel's Group
