texts.en: Samuel L. is from the village of Amunitan, Gonzaga, Cagayan. He is 42 years old. Samuel is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Samuel L.'s Group. Samuel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Samuel raises pigs for fattening and sale. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Samuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Samuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more soap, oil, milk, onions, tomatoes, sugar, tea, butter, hair grease, etc.

loans.name: Bwavu Mpologoma Men And Women's Group 1-Kayunga

texts.en:
By hook or by crook, 52 year-old N. Dumba who is affiliated with the Bwavu Mpologoma group 1-Kayunga took it upon herself to begin her poultry and livestock business in Tente-Kayunga. This business has been in existence since 2003.  It is a business she began with a micro loan. Before that, this mother of six, who is happily married, milled maize. 100,000 shillings is what she makes in a week.  N. principally sells eggs and milk. She also has a boda boda or commercial motorcycle business that she relies on to bring her supplementary profits. With this loan, N. says she is going to buy more chicken feed for her poultry.

N. belongs to Bwavu Mpologoma men and women group of Kayunga.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Nara

texts.en:
Mr. Nara K. is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sreymao Heng, is 24 years old. They have been married since 2006 and have two young children:  one son and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Nara is a farmer – he grows lotus. His wife is a garment factory worker. He hopes to expand his lotus farm but he does not have capital. So, Nara is requesting a loan of $1,000 to provide capital.

Mr. Nara K. and his wife are in the photo.

loans.use: To use for growing lotus

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El Sr. Javier es soltero, se dedica a la venta de prendas, cuenta con una variada clientela en especial comercializa atuendos femeninos en todo la ciudad de Pilar. Tiene casa propia ubicada en el B° san José de nuestra ciudad, también tiene móvil propio (moto).
Gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya espera crecer mas en su vida laboral tanto como económica y así lograr el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Javier is single.  He sells clothes.  He has a varied clientele but his specialty is selling women’s outfits throughout Pilar.  He owns his house in our city’s San José neighborhood; he also owns his own vehicle (motorcycle).

Thanks to Fundación Paraguaya he expects to grow more both in his work and economically thus attaining his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy jeans, blouses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Mr. Rene D. is from the village of Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old. Rene is married and has four school-age children. To make a living, Rene owns and operates a motor cab. He has been engaged in this kind of business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2010, Rene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rene is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to fully pay for his current motorcycle. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use, loan repayments, children’s education and possible business expansions.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita A. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business venture: dried fish and general store  businesses.  She lives in  Brgy.Tagbino, Vallehermoso, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her dried fish vending and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.  Juanita is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she  can continue to  purchase more dried fish to sell.   This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of Php 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Juanita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase more goods and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Christian Iván

texts.es:
Christian Iván M. A.  tiene 20 años de edad. Es Soltero, vive con los padres   en  el Cantón Ventanas en la  Provincia de los Ríos.  No tiene  hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO HORIZONTE se encuentra ubicada En el recinto Cachel y Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul., esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Christian Iván se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Agro Karlyta y vende su producto en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es culminar sus estudios.

Le gusta el deporte y bailar.
texts.en:
Christian Iván M. A. is 20 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Ventanas in Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

The members of the "Nuevo Horizonte" ["New Horizon"] Communal Bank are based in the Cachel y Grande precinct, which is part of the canton of Ventanas.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  They have all been doing this for a long time.

Christian Iván works in agriculture.  He grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He buys products at Agro Karlyta and sells what he produces at the market in Ventanas.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  The economic support provided by this loan will help him meet his needs.  He faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as the varying climate.  His dream is to finish his studies.

He likes sports and dancing.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe tiene 33 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Maura, de 25 años, y sus 4 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

El trabajo al que Noe se dedica es el cultivo de café y plátano, los cuales, después de la cosecha, lleva a vender a la ciudad, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que la ruta es muy accidentada. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras para incrementar la cantidad que produce normalmente.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Noe con MFP, en sus primeros créditos fue muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que contagia su alegría al resto de socias.
Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará abono para fertilizar mejor sus tierras.
texts.en:
Noe is 33 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 25 year-old Maura, and his 4 children for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Noe's business is growing coffee and bananas.  After he harvests his crops, he takes them to the city to sell as this is where he obtains the best prices for his products.

What Noe most likes about his work is cultivating his land.  He has been in this business for 18 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products since the route is very rough and rugged.  Over time, he hopes to buy more land to increase the quantity of crops that he produces.

This is Noe's second loan with MFP.  He was very punctual in paying back his previous loan and he hopes to continue being punctual in paying back this loan.  He is a very well-liked member of his community bank since his happiness is contagious and infects the other members.  Noe plans to spend the 700 Peruvian soles he has requested in buying manure to better fertilize his land.

loans.use: To buy manure

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F., 31 years old, is from the town of Trento. She is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Gina plants and harvests rice for sale. Aside from rice farming, she also grows hogs and runs a sari-sari store. Gina does her best to manage her businesses and her family well.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. 

Gina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pig feed

loans.name: 01 Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Han N. T. (9) is a 56 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Han is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 01 Dong Hai (10.01.01 Dong Hai).

Han is married and has three adult children. To making a living, Han prepares and sells food, primarily pork products, in the local community.  Han has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Han joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.  Han has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Han from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Han plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:
1. P. T. Huyen (11) is a 36 year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her food stall business.

2. N. T. Nhat (12) is a 52 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her food stall business.

3. N. T. Vien (18) is a 49 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

4. N. T. Lien (19) is a 71 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,789,900 VND loan to support her services business.

5. LeT. Luong (21) is a 60 year-old woman who is requesting a 5,787,900 VND loan to support her food stall business.

6.  P. T. Xuan (1) is a 58 year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Han N. T. (9) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Han là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 01 Dong Hai (10.01.01 Dong Hai).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ thịt heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Han thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Han kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND.  Vào 2004, Han đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Han đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:
1.  P. T. Huyen (11) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

2.  N. T. Nhat (12) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

3.  N. T. Vien (18) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

4.  N. T. Lien (19) là 71 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5789900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

5.  LeT. Luong (21) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5787900 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.

6.  P. T. Xuan (1) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more meat and charcoal to sell at market

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, aged 44 years, is married and a father of eight children with seven still in school. He has been in mixed farming for ten years, producing and selling milk, maize and beans to the local market. He  relies solely on farming to support his family.

He has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says an additional dairy cow will definitely improve his production, supplement family foods, and enable him to pay for his children's education in better schools. He is focusing on having five dairy cows and being a major supplier for the local market.

Joseph however laments scarcity of water and animal feed during dry seasons. He is happy to have access to loans from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chasquis Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHASQUIS” iniciará su noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani. Está compuesta por ocho integrantes y tiene como presidenta a la señora Benigna.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, venta de espejos, trenzado de mantas, venta de cosméticos, pizzeria, joyería.

La señora Benigna, presidenta de la asociación comunal, indica que es la novena vez que participa en Pro Mujer y que integra la institución gracias a la invitación de su cuñada Mercedes.

En la actualidad la señora Benigna tiene un negocio que consiste en una tienda de barrio que inicio por iniciativa propia hace 5 años; el crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su mercadería (arroz, aceite, azucar, enlatados, ace, javon), los que compra de La Ceja, en la ciudad de El Alto.

Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el crédito.
texts.en:
The “CHASQUIS” community bank is about to begin its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional office.  This group has eight members and its president is Benigna.  The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include, running a neighborhood store, selling mirrors, braiding blankets, selling cosmetics, running a pizzeria and selling jewelry.

Benigna, the president of this community bank, says that this is the ninth time that she has participated in Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution after being invited to do so by her sister-in-law Mercedes.

Benigna currently owns a neighborhood store that she set up on her own initiative 5 years ago. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to increase her merchandise (rice, oil, sugar, canned goods, detergent and soap).  She buys her products in La Ceja, in the city of El Alto.

Benigna's business allows her to make money to support her family as she is married and has four children.  When we asked her what she most liked about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc. for her store

loans.name: Trương Thị Khuyên's Group

texts.en:
K. Nguyễn Thị (20203050010) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. K. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ô Cách nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).
K. is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, K. works for a brick  factory naer her house. After working  hour, she raises pigs and  chickens. K. has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000,000 VND per month from  selling raising  products.
In 2009, K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to buy food for  animal. The loan will be her third from SEDA. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group
1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.
2.  Trương Thị H. (0) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture-making business.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


K.  Nguyễn Thị (20203050010) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  K.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Ô Cách nhóm 02 (Nhóm 02).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa pH..  K.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, K.  kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, K.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  K.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


2.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to buy  food for her  poultry

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Meeting life’s challenges head on is a habit that could be developed only by the brave. Erlinda C., 66, does just that. Erlinda is only an elementary school graduate but right now she manages her own micro business as she learns entrepreneurship as a community partner in CCT*. She is a widow, and takes care of her four children, who are all working.

Erlinda runs her own sari-sari (variety) store, located in the extension of their house. Everyday she observes the buying patterns of her customers and notes down their preferences in terms of the type of item they buy, the price, and the brand. She sees to it that her customers get what they deserve. Monthly, Erlinda earns Php11,000 on average.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan.  She intends to meet the demands of her customers.  As needed, she will buy more stocks of rice, soft drinks, and other grocery items. 

Erlinda acknowledges that no challenges are too hard to deal with.  She knows that the Lord will enable her to overcome, and  will uphold the future of both her children and her business. She dreams of making her sari-sari store grow.  As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she reads.

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie R. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenz, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Anna Marie is married and has three school-aged children. Anna Marie has a store that sells mobile phone credit loads (prepaid talking and texting) in the local community. Anna Marie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Anna Marie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Anna Marie is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cellphones and electronic loads for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anna Marie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cellphone and electronic load for sale

loans.name: Yophesi

texts.en: Yophesi, aged 24, is a government employee and a teacher by profession. He lives in a rented single-room house in the district of Kyenjojo Uganda. After realising that his salary was not sufficient, he decided to venture into the maize trade. Business has been profitable despite challenges in finances. Yophesi needs the loan to buy a maize mill.

loans.use: To purchase a maize mill.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
Juan de 63 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad comercial, agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

La actividad que realiza Juan es como carpintero, la que realiza desde hace 20 años, su negocio lo tiene en su propio domicilio, tiene su propia clientela por el buen trabajo que hace, pero a solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para mejorar el piso de su taller con la finalidad de tener mayor comodidad para que haga el trabajo que realiza, con los ingresos que obtenga  podrá pagar su crédito y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

Juan es una persona dedicada a su trabajo, responsable y desea  que el negocio que tiene sea más grande para que su familia se siag superando en especial sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan, 63, lives with his wife and children in his own home where they enjoy all the basic utility services, located in the province of Chiclayo. This region is characterized by its commercial activity, agriculture, livestock farming and tourism. 

Juan's business is carpentry, which he has done for twenty years. His business is located in his own home and he has his own clientele because of the good work that he does. However he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 soles in order to make improvements to the floor of his workshop so that he may be more comfortable while doing his work. With the income he obtains he will be able to pay off his loan and improve his family's standard of living. 

Juan is a responsible person who is dedicated to his work. He would like his business to be bigger so that his family may continue to get ahead, especially his children.

loans.use: to make improvements to the floor of his workshop.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio es técnico electrónico, su taller lo tiene ubicado en la calle muy concurrida ahí brinda servicio técnico en reparación de televisores, computadoras, dvd´s, radios y todo tipo de aparatos electrónicos, vive en la zona de Tacagua en casa de su mamá con su esposa y sus hijos. Su esposa es enfermera y ayuda  con los gastos en alimentación y en educación, ambos trabajan muy duro por el bienestar de sus hijos, don Julio hace poco también incursionó en el negocio de la compra venta de televisores, ahora el crédito que solicita es para la compra de televisores y así poder arreglarlos y venderlos obtenido ganancias y así incrementar su capital en este nuevo emprendimiento, don Julio trabaja con la institución demostrando responsabilidad con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Julio is an electronics technician.  His shop is located on a very busy street.  He offers television, computer, DVD player, radio and all kinds of electronic equipment repair services.  He lives in the Tacagua zone in his mother’s house with his wife and children.  His wife is a nurse and helps cover food and education costs.  They both work very hard for the wellbeing of their children. 

A short time ago Julio started selling television sets.  Now, the loan he’s requesting is to buy television sets to repair and sell to obtain profits and increase his capital with this new enterprise.  Julio works with the institution demonstrating responsibility with his payments.

loans.use: to buy television sets.

loans.name: Odelia

texts.en: Odelia is married with three children. Odelia is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. Odelia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for    years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. Odelia has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Elia Nancy Eulalia

texts.es:
Elia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”, ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos aún estudiando.  Cuenta con educación superior.
La señora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, desde hace dos años trabaja con  el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer  préstamo fue de  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles comprará mercaderías como arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc.  En el negocio  le ayudan sus hijos.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando y obtener más ganancia para sostener a su familia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo y el bajo interés.
texts.en:
Elia is a member of the "Medalla Milagrosa" (Miraculous Medal) Communal Bank, located in Pomata District, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 49 years old, is a single mother and has two children who are still in school. She has received higher education.

This lady works selling groceries. She has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years, and her first loan was for 300 new soles, which increased her business capital.

With this new loan of 500 new soles, she will buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. Her children help her with the business. Her dream is to continue working and earn more income to support her family.

What Elia likes about the Communal Bank are the easy loan terms and the low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 21 years old and a single business lady. She has been running a retail shop for two years, with a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to cater to her basic needs.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. She will use the loan to add rice, sugar and cooking fat to her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will start livestock farming. Her hopes are to purchase a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking fat for her shop

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Maribeth has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Maribeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maribeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Mercedes Asteria

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes es casada, tiene 02 hijos que todavía están en el colegio; ella se dedica a la venta D. comida para eventos o actividades D. fiestas por su localidad, dedicándose a este negocio por más D. 5 años para sacar adelante a toda su familia. El crédito otorgado lo va a utilizar para el mejoramiento D. su vivienda  (compra D. cemento para  tarrajeo en toda la casa); su principal desafío es que la Sra. Mercedes trabaja todas las madrugadas para entregar sus pedidos. Sus sueños es que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su segunda planta en su casa. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mercedes is married and has two children who are still in school. She sells food for events and festive activities in her area, and has been working in this business for over 5 years so that she could raise her family. 

This loan will be used to improve Mercedes' home - she will purchase cement to render the walls throughout the house. Her main challenge is that she works every morning to deliver her orders. Her dream is for her children to become professionals, and to build a second floor in her house. Mercedes is very grateful for the loan granted.

loans.use: to purchase cement to improve her home

loans.name: Jose Lucio

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus hijas de 12 y 16 años de edad, es empleado de un agroservicio, trabaja como vendedor desde hace 3 años, con su sueldo logra dar lo necesario en su hogar, apoyándose de su esposa para salir adelante.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para pagar mecánico, pues su vehículo presenta desperfectos y para darle mantenimiento debe hacer algunas reparaciones.
El objetivo de José es trabajar de la mejor manera, apoyar a sus hijas en los estudios y que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and daughters who are 12 and 16 years old.  He’s been employed at a farming supplies firm as a salesman for the last three years.  He manages to provide the basics for his home with his salary relying on his wife to help him get ahead.

At present, he needs a loan to pay a mechanic because his vehicle is having some problems and he has to service it and do some repairs.

José’s goal is to work the best way possible and support the education of his daughters so that they will be able to improve themselves.

loans.use: to pay auto repair costs.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 27 years old. He is married with two children. He is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last six years.


He learned about KADET  LTD  from registered KADET groups. This will be his third loan which he is planning to spend to prepare land for tomato planting. Tomatoes have been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to improve the living standards and education of his children. His dream is to prosper in the business of tomato farming. He is a hard-working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for tomato planting.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hardworking businesswoman aged 51. She is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. 
For the last three years, Catherine has been practising farming to earn a living. She has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She expresses gratitude to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for training her in good customer care. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio, tiene 38 años, es madre de 3 niños, y esta en Finca desde hace 4 años. 
Isabel tiene una tienda de abarrotes, ella empezó con poco capital, con Finca ella fue creciendo, y ahora le va muy bien en su tienda de abarrotes, pudo obtener una computadora, y aumentar su negocio, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder administrar mejor su negocio y su vida familiar, ahora el préstamo lo dividirá en la compra de Azúcar, arroz, fideos que es lo que mas vende y también comprará leña. Ahora su meta es poder techar el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Isabel, a member of the Lirio Communal Bank, is 38 years old and the mother of 3 children. She has been with Finca for some 4 years.

Isabel has a grocery store. She began with little capital but with Finca, she has been growing, and now, things are going very well in her grocery store. She has been able to get a computer and expand the store. The training she receives has helped her to better administer the business and her family life.

This loan will be divided between purchasing sugar, rice, and beans, which is what she sells most, and also, buying firewood.

Now her goal is to be able to put a roof on the 2nd story of her house.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and beans for her store, and to install a roof over her house.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Ludivina has a pigpen that sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 16 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Ludivina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ludivina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for pigs

loans.name: Inuka Shg Group

texts.en:
Violet is the facilitator of the Inuka SHG group. Violet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Violet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Violet takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to receive One Acre's best prices. In the recent 2011 season, Violet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 21 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Violet was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Violet will invest in livestock rearing and buy more land as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Inuka SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Violet with her group members. Standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 28-year-old married woman with one child who is still too young for school. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transport. 

Juliet has operated as a tailor for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase more fabrics and embroidery thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access capital to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and embroidery thread for her business.

loans.name: Daborah

texts.en:
Daborah is a 35 year old a married woman who has five children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food items in bor, south Sudan for three years.

Daborah requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan to purchase wheat flour and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, milk and onions to sell.

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo, de 26 años de edad, es un hombre muy alegre, dinámico y emprendedor, es conviviente con Silvia quien es comerciante, vive en compañía de su pareja, sus tres hijos menores, su casa es propia, la cual logró construir con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo que realiza Oswaldo es la venta de golosinas, la cual lo realiza en la puerta de un colegio ubicado cerca a su domicilio, la cual  viene funcionando desde hace 03 años, siendo muy concurrido por los jóvenes estudiantes de este colegio y por los que pasan por la zona, a los cuales atiende de manera amable y con alegría, para esto cuenta con la ayuda de una  señorita, en la atención al público.  Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le permite pagar los gastos de la casa,  y le da tiempo de ver a sus hijos, nos comenta que debido a que la actividad realizada es rentable, tiene planes de abrir una tienda de golosinas en la zona comercial ya que en ese distrito no hay siendo pionera y brindar esa facilidad a residentes de contar con una tienda de este giro de negocio, y además  así poder tener más ingresos. Este será su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo por que siente que son responsables, está agradecido con la institución por la confianza brindada, por lo cual se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Además espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes.
Con el préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará golosinas en general a precio por mayor para surtir su negocio, considera que a mayor variedad más acogida tendrá su negocio y obtendrá mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en: Oswaldo, who is 26 years old, is a very happy, dynamic and entrepreneurial man. He lives with Silvia, who is a merchant. He lives with his partner and his three young children in his own house which he was successful in constructing with the support of his partner. The work performed by Oswaldo is the sale of candies, which he does at the door of a school located near his home which has been operating for 3 years. He is still very popular with the young students from the school and those who pass through this area to whom he serves in a friendly manner and with joy, with the help of a young lady in the front office regarding customer service. What he likes about his work is that it permits him to make an income that allows him to pay the expenses of the home, and which gives him time to see his children. He told us that because the activity is profitable, he has plans to open a candy store in the commercial district, where there currently is none. He will be a pioneer and bring this facility to residents who will have a store in this line of business, and moreover, this way he can make more revenue. This will be his first loan with the institution MFP, he likes the group very much because he feels that they are responsible. He is grateful for the trust given by the institution, in exchange for which he agrees to be punctual in his payments. Moreover, he awaits your collaboration so that he can nail down his plans. With the loan of 1,000 nuevos soles he will buy candies generally at the best price to supply his business, he believes that the greater variety will increase his business and he will obtain larger profit margins.

loans.use: To buy more candies to supply his business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells charcoal in Abuenu. She is married to a farmer. Ekua has been selling charcoal for six years. She helps her husband to feed their children. Her loan will be used to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a mother of three children. In order to contribute to her family income she sells men’s clothing in her neighborhood. She started in this line of work about 5 years ago with the help of her mother who provided the start up capital. Rosa feels that her work is very important because her husband does not have much job security. He is often hired as a skilled worker in factories but his jobs are never stable and he is always at risk of being unemployed.

Rosa will use this loan in order to buy a new line of products for the upcoming Christmas season. She is very enthusiastic about her sales for this time of year. She hopes that she can fix up her home so that eventually she can run her business from there instead of having to sell at the overly competitive markets.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Increase her inventory

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en: Kwesi is a young man of 24 and single. He is a  refrigerator repairman in his community. The cost of brand-new fridges is beyond the means of many people and therefore they tend to service the old ones for reuse. Parts like motors are very costly yet due to frequent power outages they damage easily and must be replaced. Kwesi is therefore seeking a KIVA loan to purchase some to service his clients' fridges to increase his turnover.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Alex Juma

texts.en: Alex is married with three children who are all in primary school. He started his business in 2002 in order to sustain his family. He has not undertaken any training, but is an active member of the Catholic community church youth group, which educates the locals on fighting poverty.  Through a loan from PEMCI, he intends to buy onions in bulk from the locals, as it is harvesting period, and sell them in town at a higher price. Through his business, he has been able to provide for his family, employ some school dropouts, and serve the community as a whole by showing them various ways of eradicating poverty and building self-dependency.

loans.use: Boost his business

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Akossiwa A., age 48, is married and has 8 persons to support. For several years, she has dedicated herself to preparing cassava flour, generally called "gari". She is very devoted and has plenty of initiative. Revenues from commerce in gari allow her to provide for her family and to help with running her home. These revenues are not great enough for any investing. Thus, there is a need for working capital to acquire cassava, or entire fields of cassava, in order to increase her gari production. The success of this project will allow her to improve living conditions via an increase in revenues. She is requesting a loan of $800.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 48 ans, Madame A. Akossiwa est mariée et a en charge huit (8) personnes. Depuis plusieurs années, elle s'est consacrée à la préparation de la farine du manioc communément appelée « gari ». Elle est très dévouée et pleine d'initiatives. La commercialisation du gari lu procure des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins et de contribuer à la gestion de son ménage. Le revenu obtenu n'est pas aussi consistant pour lui permettre de faire des investissements d'où la nécessité d'un fond de base qui servira à acheter du manioc ou des champs entiers de manioc afin d'accroître sa production de gari. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d'améliorer ses conditions de vie à travers l'augmentation de son revenu monétaire. Elle sollicite un apport financiers de $800.

loans.use: To buy some cassava or  entire fields of cassava to increase her production of gari

loans.name: Isaq

texts.en:
Isaq is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 45, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli, in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Isaq owns a little shop where he sells spare parts. Every week Isaq goes to the wholesale market in the capital, Baku, to buy spare parts at reasonable prices. His son helps him and works as a shop assistant. (Isaq's son is the gentleman shown in the picture.)

Business is quite going well but Isaq needs more capital to develop his micro-business. For this purpose he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a US$ 500 loan. Using this additional capital, he feels sure that he can raise his monthly income from his shop by up to 30%.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his inventory

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
Miss Ángela Y. is 20 years old, single, and lives with her mother, Mrs. Arsenia Y.. The two women have worked together for three years in a space that they rent. Ángela studies in the morning and is in college.

Mrs. Arsenia is a single mother. For this reason, she struggles every day. Her daughter struggles with her to move forward. The two women run a catering business. Their main clients are the people that work in local businesses of the area. Ángela wants a loan so that she can buy a motorbike, as this will speed up distribution efficiency now that the business has more and more clients and the food weighs so much.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Ángela Y. tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive con su madre la Sra. Arsenia Y., ellas trabajan juntas desde hace 3 años en un salón que ellas alquilan. Ángela estudia por la mañana, esta en el nivel universitario.

La Sra. Arsenia es madre soltera por ello es que ella lucha día a día, junto con su madre, para salir adelante. Ellas realizan servicio de comidas en viandas (catering) a domicilio. Sus principales clientes son las personas que trabajan en los negocios de la zona. Ella desea el crédito para poder comprar una moto, ya que eso agilizará su reparto pues cada vez tienen mas clientes y las viandas pesan mucho.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. is a single parent (she is a widow). She comes from Okiafa in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 48 years of age and a mother of 5. She sells provisions and operates a business center. She has been in business since 1983 and needs a loan of $1200 to buy computer and a photocopier. This, she said, will help her serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy a computer and photocopier

loans.name: Lek

texts.en: Mrs. Lek H., 56, is a widow with five children and lives with her other two grand children in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She can only make meager money each day from selling the harvest of her rice crops and vegetables which she grows on her piece of land. Meanwhile, one of her children works selling Khmer food and rice in a town of Kampong Cham and another one is self-employed as a construction foreman and the rest of whom are married and live separately. Mrs. Leak H. is requesting a loan to purchase more construction tools for her son to make his work more convenient and effective.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools for her son to make his work more convenient and effective.

loans.name: Wilber Fernando

texts.es:
Wilber, 26, is a young entrepreneur, married, and has 3 young children who are at elementary school. His family lives in Laureles Sur, a rural region. Ever since his youth, Wilber wanted his own business and had the opportunity to study optometry at college. This passion led him to build his profession on it; approximately, 4 years ago, he set up his own optician shop with the help and financial support of his sister and that of his wife as well.

This family has also been involved to fully taking care of the business, attending to customers, and expanding. Currently, the shop serves customers from all the northern rural areas and some urban areas of the country, which is an indicator that this business has also provided jobs. In addition, the business depends on a great number of satisfied clients. These days, this young man needs a loan to buy lens and different colored frames, which are in great demand.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator. Wilber es un joven empresario, tiene 26 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos pequeños, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en primaria, esta familia habita en el asentamiento Laureles Sur, una zona rural. El señor desde muy joven deseó tener su propio negocio y aprovechó la oportunidad para estudiar en la universidad la carrera de Optometrista, la cual es una profesión que le apasiona, hace aproximadamente 4 años el señor monto su propia Óptica, con mucho sacrificio y con el apoyo económico de su hermana así como el apoyo de su esposa.

Esta familia se ha dedicado de lleno al cuido del negocio, la atención de los clientes y el de irse expandiéndose. Actualmente la óptica cubre todo el sector norte rural y parte urbano del país, a medida que crece este negocio ha sido generador de empleos, cuentan con un buen número de clientes los cuales están satisfechos con el servicio brindado por la óptica. En estos momentos el señor requiere de un préstamo para la compra de lentes y marcos de diferentes colores, ya que la demanda de sus clientes es cada vez mayor.

loans.use: buy lens and frames of various colors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Raúl Rodolfo

texts.es:
“I need to build a fence in the backyard of my house, as I feel my home is not safe and I want to offer protection to my family. I work the night shift at an in-bond factory and I’m not at ease knowing my family is unprotected. I am requesting $200 to build the fence.”

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo la necesidad de levantar una barda en la parte de atrás de mi vivienda, ya que la siento muy insegura y quiero darle protección a mi familia. Trabajo de noche en una maquiladora y no estoy tranquilo sabiendo a mi familia sin protección. Solicito 200 dólares para levantar una barda en mi vivienda”.

loans.use: Building of a fence/

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es:
The house that we own is one that was built inexpensively and, like others, somewhat small.  We want to add a room but we lack the materials to finish the work.  We're applying for a $500 loan to buy materials to finish the room.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
La casa que tenemos es de las económicas y están algo reducidas. Queremos terminar un cuarto pero nos esta faltando material para terminarlo. Solicitamos un préstamo de $500.00 dlls. Para la comprar de material para la terminación de un cuarto.

loans.use: Finish room.

loans.name: Yemisi

texts.en: Mrs Yemisi E. sells baby items and clothes in her community, a skill that she acquired over 2 years. She has been in this business since 2003. She is 37 years old and is married with 3 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years. Yemisi needs a loan of $425 to buy more clothes and baby items so that she can increase the growth of her business, thereby increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and baby items.

loans.name: Hernán Ricardo

texts.es:
Hernán is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his young daughters, whom he adores. He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals but in order to do this he would need to purchase livestock of better breeds, and these animals are very costly. He would need capital of 500 soles ($175), and at the moment he does not have that much money and he is requesting this loan. Hernán hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty. Help Hernán improve his livestock’s breed.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hernán es un padre muy amoroso y pendiente de las necesidades de sus pequeñas hijas, quienes son su adoración. Él se dedica a criar ganado, todas las mañanas sale a pastear a sus animales por los alrededores. Su anhelo es mejorar la calidad de sus animales, pero para ello tendría que comprar ganados de mejor raza, estos animales son sumamente costosos y tendría que tener un capital de 500 soles, y en estos momentos él no cuenta con esta cantidad, por ello solicita este préstamo. Hernán tiene la esperanza de que confíen en su trabajo y honestidad. Ayuda a Hernán a mejorar la raza de su ganado.

loans.use: Buy animals of a better breed in order to improve the quality of his livestock

loans.name: Hosanna Trust Group

texts.en: Elizabeth is 41 years old and is married with four kids (located in the front row of the picture in yellow). Elizabeth is the leader of a six member trust group called the Hosanna Trust Group. They all trade in food items such as, rice, plantain, vegetable oil, dried fish, palm oil, vegetables, charcoal, and more. They work really hard to support their households.  However, the best they do is not enough to make a meaningful impact because they are constrained by funds to grow these businesses. They are convinced that the loan facility will turn the situational wheel around to give hope and future for their businesses and families. Members in this group agree to guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support and assistance to help repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted food commodities like  rice, beans, yams, vegetables, vegetable oil, meat etc.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.en:
Zeynab (her father is pictured) is the mother of 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan, settled in the Fuzuli region, in Kayidish village, an area which was built specifically for IDPs. She was born in 1966.

Together with her father, Zeynab has been in the refrigerator sales business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of US$ 1200 to buy refrigerators to expand their business.

loans.use: to buy refrigerators for re-sale

loans.name: Romualda

texts.es:
Romualda M. tiene un taller donde elabora mantas y mantillas. Estas son comercializadas en su puesto, ubicado en la zona de San Pedro.
Romualda tiene cuatro hijas, todas trabajan en su taller y le brindan gran ayuda, de hecho, ellas son las responsables de la buena situación económica de la madre.
Romualda vive en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de lana e hilo.
Es la décima segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como una clienta excelente.
texts.en:
Romualda M. has a workshop where she makes capes and shawls. She sells them in her stall, located in the San Pedro zone. Romualda has four daughters, all of whom work in her studio and provide great help. In fact, they are responsible for the good economic situation of their mother. Romualda lives in the area of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. The loan will be set aside to purchase wool and yarn. It is the tenth time she has requested a loan from Impro; her record shows that she is an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ghulam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
G. Fatima baji is a wife of A. S. and lives in the Walton area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this place for the last five years. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in the local schools. G. Fatima baji’s husband is a tailor. G. Fatima baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by three other women: Rehana baji and another Rehana baji each want a loan to buy a rubbing machine. (Rubbing machines are used to plain marble floors.) Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy another movie camera for her movie making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gina Moises Sitoe

texts.pt:
Gina  Moises Sitoe A.  é natural do distrito de Chibuto província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 38 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 20, 14, 10 e 1 ano respectivamente, para alem dos filhos sustenta a sua sogra e sua mãe enviando dinheiro mensalmente.

Gina estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por ter ficado doente por muito tempo, em 1974 mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo,  para continuar com os estudos e aos 20 anos se casou dai mudou da cidade para distrito de Boane na companhia do marido que é militar e assim vive na casa do estado afecta ao marido.

Gina é negociante, qual possui um estabelecimento comercial cita dentro do mercado municipal de Boane, dona do negocio e trabalha sozinha, o negocio consista na venda de roupa usada, onde tem um rendimento diário aproximadamente 700,00mt.

Para Gina este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, e sempre aplicou o empréstimo na compra de mercadoria para aumento do seu estoque. Para ela é um negocio rentável assim o sonho é melhorar cada vez mais.
texts.en:
Gina Moises Sitoe A. is from Chibuto district, Gaza province, in the south of Mozambique. She is 38, married, and the mother of four children, aged 20,14, 10, and 1. Besides her children, she supports her mother-in-law and her mother, sending them money monthly. Gina studied till 9th grade and stopped due to extended illness. In 1974 she moved from Gaza province to Maputo to continue her studies. When she was 20, she married and moved from the city to Boane district in the company of her husband. He is in the military, and so they live in a house provided by the state. Gina is a businessperson and owns a commercial establishment located in the Boane town market. She works alone. The business consists of the sale of used clothes. The business makes approximately 700 meticais a day. For Gina, this is her third loan from Hluvuku and her first from Kiva. She has always applied her loans to the purchase of merchandise to increase her stock. For her, it's a profitable business, and it's her dream to continually improve it.

Translated from Portuguese by Ilse Ackerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of used clothing

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus O. is 45 years old and married with 6 children. He sells building paint of different colours. He has been in this business for a long time. The demand for his building paint is high, and he hopes to meet the needs of his customers. He needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more building paints to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more building paint to sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Srey, 54, and her husband, Mr. Morn Tem, 45, married in 1979 and have eleven children: seven sons and four daughters. One of their children is a monk, two children are married and live outside the family home; one child is a garment factory worker, another child assists his father in their fishing business. Four children attend school and the other children are still young. The family lives along National Road Number Five about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

C. and her husband have been farming and fishing since 1980. They sell the fish they catch from the river in the village and Prek Phnao market about five kilometers from their home. They also grow rice on their farmland, a bit far from their house. C. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase cows to use for growing rice and to buy a boat and a boat motor for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase cows and to buy a boat and a motor for fishing

loans.name: Cheveres Group

texts.es: El grupo "Chéveres" esta representado por la señora Liliana y conformada por 18 miembros que cursan su segundo ciclo demostrando unión, honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos. En su mayoría los socios (as) se dedican a la prestación D. servicios como domesticas, constructores, trasporte público D. pasajeros, niñeras y empleadas en empresas privadas, también se dedican a la venta D. productos como pan, comida y otros. La competencia en el ámbito laboral es granD. pero las socias saben que vale más su experiencia y su responsabilidad para realizar mejor su trabajo y tener mejor ingreso. El destino del financiamiento es la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas D. trabajo para brindar un mejor servicio y para tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su calida D. vida y la D. sus familias.  Los socios (as) cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios como lo que han demostrado en su anterior ciclo es por esa razón que la fundación Agrocapital les da su confianza
texts.en:
The “Chéveres” group is represented by Liliana and has 18 members that are in their second loan cycle demonstrating unity, honesty and responsibility in their payments. The majority of the members work as domestic employees, builders, providers of public transportation, childcare workers and employees in private businesses. They also work selling products such as bread, prepared food, and more. The competition in the labor market is high but the members know that their experience and responsibility are important in order to improve their businesses and have greater income. The financing will be used to buy consumables, materials and tools for their respective businesses in order to proviD. better serve and have greater income and improve each member’s quality of life and that of their families. The members have experience as a unified group and have demonstrated this in their previous loan cycle and therefore the Agrocapital foundation has every confidence in this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.en:
Zulkhumor E. is 38 years old. She is married and uses all the money she makes to care for her 4 children and provide for their education. Zulkhumor has an experience of 2 years preparing and selling dried apricots. She always makes very productive use of her capital, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her.

Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Today Zulkhumor requests 650 USD for a term of 9 months. She is going to spend the loan purchasing dried apricots with the purpose of processing them in order to increase the range of her goods. Zulkhumor expresses her gratitude for everyone supporting her and promises to repay her loan in a timely manner.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing dried apricots in order to increase the range of goods she has to offer

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Хасанова Мавчуда , женщина в возрасте 44 лет, разведена имеет двоих взрослых детей. Один её сын на заработках в России. Другой учится в высшем учебном заведении. Сама Мавчуда имеет бизнес продажи мелкой продажи( носки , нижнее бельё, колготки, полотенца, и.т.д.)  За товаром ездит сама в Истаравшан. Мавчуда хочет увеличить оборотный капитал при помощи кредита. Для чего она обратилась в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Mavjuda H. is a 44 year old woman, she is divorced and has two grown children. One of her sons is earning money in Russia. The other one is studying at an institution of higher learning. Mavjuda has a business selling small items (socks, underwear, pantyhose, towels, etc.). She travels by herself to Istaravshan for her products. Mavjuda would like to increase her working capital with the help of a loan. This is why she turned to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Rosana

texts.es: Rosana desde muy joven deseó tener una casa muy grande y bonita donde vivir, ahora, a sus 40 años ha logrado adquirir con mucho esfuerzo la casa que acaba de terminar de construir. A pesar de las circunstancias trabajó muy duro para terminar su casa, la cual es muy bonita y grande, pues tiene tres pisos y están adecuadamente ambientadas. Pero como no es muy agradable vivir sola dentro de una casa tan grande empezó a alquilar habitaciones a personas solteras y así tener un ingreso que le ayude a satisfacer sus necesidades. Hace 6 años que viene alquilando cuartos, tiene un terreno a lado de su casa y también desea construir para ampliar sus servicios de alquiler. Pero por el momento desea ambientar las habitaciones para una mejor atención a sus huéspedes, quienes le brindan calor de hogar a cada lugar de su casa, lo que la motiva a seguir manteniendo el sueño de casarse algún día y forman un hogar con muchos hijos que espera tener. Rosana está iniciando su primer crédito individual con MFP, pues los anteriores fueron grupales, lo cual la ayudó a relacionarse con las personas y tener mayor información sobre el ámbito financiero. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en los materiales que requiere para el acabado y decorado de sus habitaciones.
texts.en:
Since Rosana was very young, she wanted to have a very large and beautiful house to live in. Now at 40 years old, and with great effort, she’s been able to finish building her house. In spite of the circumstances, she worked very hard to finish this house, which is beautiful and large; it has three floors and is adequately furnished. But since it’s not very pleasant living alone in a very large house, she began renting out rooms to single women, in this way she has an income which helps her meet her expenses. She’s been renting rooms for six years now. She has a field to the side of her house that she wants to build on and broaden her renting services. But, for the moment she wants to furnish the rooms to better accommodate the guests, who provide warmth to every part of the house. This motivates her to pursue her dream of getting married one day and creating a home with children she hopes to have. Rosana is opening her first individual loan with MFP, the pervious were group loans which helped her to get acquainted with people in the financial world. She plans to invest the money in building materials required to finish and decorate the bedrooms.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials for finishing and decorating her rental rooms

loans.name: Buyan-Ulziy

texts.en:
Buyan-Ulziy S. lives with his wife, his son and his daughter-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son is a college student. Buyan-Ulzii's family moved to Ulaanbaatar from the countryside three years ago.

As soon as Buyan-Ulziy came to Ulaanbaatar, he started a small business with his wife in construction. Buyan-Ulziy and his wife have years of experience in construction. They mostly work on the interior design of new construction projects on a contract basis. In the future, he would like to expand his business by hiring more employees and creating a full team of construction workers. Buyan-Ulziy requests a loan to purchase raw materials used in his construction business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials used in his construction business

loans.name: Aku

texts.fr: Aku N. est une femme de 47 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse de pains à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Aku exerce ce commerce  depuis 3 ans. Avec ce crédit Aku souhaite  construire un four pour la production du pain. Ce faisant elle augmentera ses recettes et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aku N. is a 47-year-old woman, married, and the mother of three. She is a bread seller in Avetonou, a village located about 100 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She has been in this business for three years. With this loan, she would like to construct an oven for making bread. Once done, she will increase her receipts and consequently improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an oven and to buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Duch

texts.en: Duch S., 55, pictured here with her husband, lives with her husband and four of her children in Takeo province. She and her husband together work making baskets to earn a living and are able to make a combined US$5 every day. Besides making baskets, her husband also purchases and sells cows in the village and he can make an extra US$10 in revenue per day. This couple has four children, three of whom are in school and one is a worker. Duch S. would like to take out a loan to purchase cows for her husband to sell.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Đinh's Group

texts.en:
Bé Đinh Thị (20206050006) is a 54 year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Bé is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Vĩ 02 (2).

Bé is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Bé owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Bé has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.
