Bé joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Bé is requesting a loan for the first time from SEDA. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND to purchase additional products to sell. Bé plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Vũ Thị H. (20206050007) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Trần Thị H. (20206050008) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector providing waste management services.

3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20206050009) is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

4.  Trần Thị H. (20206050010) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business in raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.



*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Bé Đinh Thị (20206050006) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Bé là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Vĩ 02 (2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các pH. thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán cả hai loại thức ăn & các nhu yếu phẩm trong cộng đồng địa pH..  Bé thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bé kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Bé đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bé đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Vũ Thị H. (20206050007) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trần Thị H. (20206050008) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ quản lý chất thải.


3.  Nguyễn Thị C. (20206050009) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Trần Thị H. (20206050010) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
Carmelo es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa a la empresa PIL S.A.; la esposa es pequeña agricultora y también cuentan con un pequeño taller de bordados de ropa Folklórica que alquilan para diferentes entradas (parades in english); ambos son  de la tercera edad y por esa misma condición fue discriminada en otras instituciones y negada para otorgarle un préstamo.

Viven en la comunidad Villandrani de la provincia los Andes a dos horas y media de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (telas de colores, hilos, forros, etc.) para poder confeccionar mayor cantidad de ropa folklórica.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago que demostró con nuestra institución le permite acceder a otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Carmelo is a milk producer who markets to the PIL S.A. business. His wife is a small farmer, and they also have a small embroidery of folk clothing that they rent for different events. Both are in their old age, and were thus discriminated against in other institutions and denied the opportunity to be offered a loan. They live in the Villandrani community of the Los Andes Province, two and a half hours from the city of El Alto. The loan will serve to purchase raw materials (colored fabric, thread, lining, etc.) to be able to make a greater quantity of folk clothing. It's their third loan with IMPRO; their disciplined payment will allow them to access another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of colored fabric, thread, and lining for folk clothing

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn S. was born in 1980 and she lives in Ank Prasat village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn for a living. Her husband, Mr. Tith Pros, is a laborer and the rest of the time he uses to raise ducks. This couple has two children who are attending the local school. Mrs. Morn S.’s husband is shown on the right in the photo.

Mrs. Morn S.’s husband wants to expand his duck-raising business by purchasing more ducklings to raise. Thus, Mrs. Morn S. decided to ask for a loan for her husband’s purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more ducklings for her husband's business

loans.name: Ana Purisa

texts.en:
Ana Purisa R.'s main source of income comes from providing transport services in her community. She is 24 years old, married and has a baby. They are from the town of Pta. Miray, Baliangao Mis. Occ. Ana Purisa has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ana Purisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Ana Purisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Ana Purisa is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used for house repair. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to reserve her savings in case of future emergencies. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Mary Rosemond

texts.en:
Mary Rosemond A. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Her husband works with a transport company.

Mary Rosemond sells garden eggs, peppers, apples, and maize at a market in Cape Coast, which she has done for 8 years now. Mary Rosemond uses her income to take care of her family and for other home expenses. Mary Rosemond will use this loan to purchase more food supplies for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary Rosemond plans to save towards building a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies for resale

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She has a restaurant where she sells cooked foods and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Fafavi Ayélé

texts.fr: Cette femme n’a pas eu la chance d’apprendre un métier ; c’est cette raison qu’elle a pris la décision l’année dernière de se lancer dans la vente de chaussures au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle a dressé un petit étalage dans le marché pour pouvoir vendre ses chaussures. Avec ce commerce, elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins de son enfant, puisqu’elle n’est pas mariée. Elle aime bien son activité et compte dans l’avenir associer aussi la vente de sacs de sortie. Elle s’approvisionne auprès de différentes boutiques dans le marché. Elle a un besoin pressant en ce moment d’effectuer de nouveaux achats ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 cartons de chaussures différentes.
texts.en:
Fafavi Ayélé H. did not have the opportunity to learn a trade, which is why she decided last year to start selling shoes at the Great Market of Lomé. She set up a small stand at the market to sell her shoes. This business enables her to provide for her child, since she is not married. She likes this activity very much and expects to be able to sell also handbags in future. She gets her supplies from different stores at the market.

Right now Fafavi urgently needs to buy new shoes. That is why she applies to WAGES for a loan to buy 20 boxes of various shoes.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of shoes

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara es una socia dinámica y muy colaboradora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 41 años de edad, madre de tres hijos de los cuales dos son mayores, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, esta actividad lo realiza todos los días, ella vende en la vereda de su casa desde temprana horas de las mañanas hasta el medio día, ella es madre soltera y siempre a trabajado para salir adelante. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso” desde hace cinco años,  el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó para comprar gaseosa  para vender, en la actualidad Clara necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra  de productos para implementar la venta de menús. La meta de Clara es tener un restaurante para vender platos regionales.
texts.en:
Clara is a dynamic and very collaborative member who lives in the city of Pucallpa. She is 41 years old, and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are grown up. She dedicates herself to selling meals. She does this every day on the path by her house, from early morning until noon. She is a single mother and has always worked to get ahead.

Clara has been a part of the “Women for Progress” Communal Bank for 5 years. The first loan she received was for 300 sols which she used to buy soda water to sell. At present, Clara needs to borrow 1000 sols to buy products to facilitate the sale of items on her menu.

Clara's goal is to have a restaurant and sell regional dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY PRODUCTS AND SUPPLIES FOR HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Dina Esmeralda

texts.es: Dina Esmeralda D. D. H. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Dina vive con su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar como albañil y agricultor, y sus tres hijos D. 13, 10 y 7 años D. edad. Dina inicio con su negocio a raíz D. la inestabilidad D. los trabajos D. su esposo y sueldos pocos remunerados,  Dina instalo una venta D. tortillas a las afueras D. su casa, donD. actualmente ya es muy conocida en la zona y desea seguir ampliando su negocio, para ello es el destino del crédito que solicita.
texts.en:
Dina Esmeralda D. D. H. is 35 years old, and lives in La Libertad department. Dina lives with her husband who works as a mason and farmer and their three children of 13, 10 and 7 years of age. She began her business because of her husband’s instability in his jobs and the low wages. Dina set up a tortilla shop near her home, where she is very well known in the area. She needs the loan, as she wishes to keep growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material for the sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Joyitas De Alto Lima Group

texts.es:
Rosa C. es integrante del grupo Joyitas de Alto Lima, con 46 años  es casada y madre de 4 hijos, desde hace 10 años ella se dedica a vender plásticos, como bañadores, baldes, vasos, platos y otros, Rosa está trabajando con la familia de Pro Mujer desde hace 4 años, pero por razones de viaje se ha retirado, pero ahora está retornando a formar parte del grupo Joyitas de Alto Lima, un grupo nuevo y quiere seguir haciendo crecer a su negocio, por lo que necesita préstamo para comprar bañadores ya  que es el producto con mayor demanda.
Las compañeras de grupo de Rosa también tienen diversos negocios y todas necesitan para comprar mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa C., 46, is a member of the Joyitas de Alto Lima (Little Jewels of Upper Lima) group. She is married and the mother of 4 children. For the past 10 years she has sold plastic items like: bathing tubs, buckets, glasses, plates, etc. Rosa had been cooperating with the Pro Mujer family for the past 4 years but, due to travel, had been absent for some time. However, now she has returned to form part of the Joyitas de Alto Lima group, a new group, and she wants to continue to see her business grow. She needs a loan to buy plastic bathing tubs since this is her highest-selling item. Rosa's fellow group members also have various lines of work and all of them need to buy merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic merchandise.

loans.name: Chijoke

texts.en:
Chijoke sells building materials to make a living in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria. He is 32 years old and is single without children. He hopes to get married very soon.

Chijoke has been in this business for eight years. He is a hardworking man and he hopes to expand his business in future. He is requesting a loan of 170,000 NGN to purchase more building materials to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora A. is from the city of Sta  Cruz Tangub City. She is 48 years old. Nicanora is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Nicanora owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling banana cue in the local community. Nicanora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nicanora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicanora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nicanora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ena

texts.en:
Ena I. is 28 and married with 4 children (ages 7 - 2-months).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Ena has 2 years of experience in this business.  Ena needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Ena joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ena's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

Overall Social Metric Score:*                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD : http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Dried fish retail

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Mr. Rithy Y., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Touch San, 38, have been married since 1985. They have two children. All of them are in school. The family lives suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Rithy has been driving taxi for ten years. He drives passengers everywhere around Phnom Penh, and sometimes to the beach town of Sihanoukville and Kosh Kong. His wife stays at home. 

Under his raised house is open air space, an area that partially sheltered but still is exposed to the elements. It’s difficult for him to find a proper place to keep his taxi. So, Rithy is requesting his first loan of $500 to build a concrete walls to make a place to keep his taxi.

loans.use: To build a storage room to keep his taxi.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa, D. 52 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. sus 4 hijos; Jessica (23), Javier (18), Jonathan (17) y Judith (12). Esta familia, en unión, busca salir adelante cada día.

Cuando se quedó sola y tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos, no dudó en trabajar en lo que mejor sabía hacer, cocinar, lo hizo y nadie la detuvo. Ya han pasado varios años desD. que empezó a vender chicharrón (cerdo aderezado y frito), el cual prepara en su casa para después venderlo en la calle, donD. instala un pequeño puesto. Este negocio le es muy rentable, pues le genera muy buenas ganancias económicas, ya que tiene varios comensales que se acercaban a comprar su platillo. Es por esta razón que después D. 20 años ha continuado en el negocio, ahora ya cuenta con el apoyo D. sus hijos y pueden vender sin problemas. 
Siendo una madre luchadora, que no se detiene ante ningún problema, ya tiene pensado para el futuro empezar otro negocio D. venta D. comida, paralelo al que tiene en la actualidad.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y está infinitamente agradecida con todas aquellas personas que D. una u otra manera hace posible que reciba el crédito para seguir trabajando. Por otro lado, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo D. su grupo, ya que todos son muy responsables con el pago D. sus cuotas. Elisa tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. una salchipapera (cocina móvil donD. fríe papas y salchichas), pues tiene pensado en las mañanas seguir vendiendo su chicharrón y por la noche salchipapas.
texts.en:
Elisa is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her four children: Jessica (age 23), Javier (age 18), Jonathan (age 17), and Judith (age 12). As a family, they work together to find a way to get ahead each day.

When she had to start raising her children by herself, Elisa did not hesitate to begin work in what she does best – cooking. No one was able to dissuaD. her. She started her business several years ago selling chicharrón (seasoned fried pork), which she prepares at home and then sells on the street from a small vending stand. This business is very profitable because she generates good earnings from having several customers pass by to purchase a meal. Elisa has remained in business for twenty years and now has the assistance of her children so that she can continue to sell without problems. She is a determined mother who will not let any problem stop her. Her plans for the future incluD. opening another food business in addition to the one she has today.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Elisa is infinitely grateful to everyone who maD. it possible for her to receive loans to continue her work. She is also very pleased with the work of her Communal Bank, who have all been very responsible in completing their payments. Elisa will use the money to by a “salchipapera” (a mobile cart equipped for selling fried potatoes and sausages) so that she can continue selling chicharrón in the morning and then salchipapas in the evening.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a mobile cart for selling "salchipapas"

loans.name: Dios Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
El grupo Dios nos Ama lo integran tres personas emprendedoras, luchadoras y trabajadoras. Los cuales han ido mejorando poco a poco sus negocios gracias a la combinación de crédito y capacitación-formación en desarrollo empresarial y autonomía personal que adim ofrece según expresaron.

“Tuvieron mucha influencia cambiaron mi forma de trabajar en cuanto al orden, el ahorro y la mejor forma de invertir” dijo Idalia María Alejo Áreas la cual comercializa verduras y frutas desde hace 7 años. Sin embargo el sueno de ella es lograr tener más negocios es por ello que este préstamo lo invertirá en la creación de una  fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en la venta de alimentos fritos.

Don Florencio Roman P. López es otro de los integrantes del grupo el cual desde 1995 se dedica a la compra y venta de cosechas. 

Mientras Meling Guadalupe Áreas Rodríguez es una joven trabajadora y esforzada que desde su niñez ha laborado en el comercio de verduras junto con su madre hasta hace un año que se independizo y creó su propio negocio en el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos.  Por otra parte está muy feliz ya que podrá realizar su sueño que es estudiar la licenciatura en Ingles lo cual no había podido por falta de recursos económicos.
texts.en:
The group “Dios nos Ama” (God Loves Us) consists of three enterprising, determined, and hardworking individuals. They have been slowly improving their businesses through a combination of loans and training courses in business development and personal self-management that ADIM offers. “They have had a great influence in changing the way I work. The savings are the best way to invest,” says Idalia María Alejo Áreas, who has been selling fruits and vegetables for seven years. However, her dream is to start more businesses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to start a “fritanga”, a popular type of restaurant that sells fried foods. Don Florencio Roman P. López is another member who has been part of the group since 1995. He buys and sells produce. Meling Guadalupe Áreas Rodríguez is a hardworking and determined young woman. Since she was a child, she had been working in her mother’s vegetable business until a year ago. She wanted to become independent and decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. On the other hand, she is happy to be pursuing her dream of studying English literature, which was put on hold due to a lack of financial resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials to set up a restaurant selling fried food

loans.name: Julia Balbina

texts.es:
La señora Julia A. es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive en la comunidad  San Miguel, en la parroquia El Valle ubicada al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta localidad  es reconocida por su importante producción de maíz, y por sus atractivos turisticos como las lagunas de Chochapamba llenas de Totoras.

Julia  tiene 61 años de edad se divoció hace 25 años porque su esposo bebia mucho, con él procreo tres hijos que se encuentran de 42, 33, 26 años ellos ya son casados e independientes pero vive con 12 nietos quienes le hacen compañía, tres de ellos ya trabjan, y sólo tres nietos de los doce estan a su cargo porque su madre viajó al exterior en busca de un mejor porvenir,  los nietos restantes viven con sus padres pero siempre le hacen compañia,  su vivienda es propia por lo que vive tranquila.

Julia es negociante de frutas, granos tiernos y hortalizas, labora en esta actividad hace 30 años, anteriormente contaba con su puesto propio pero debido a su avanzada edad ha tenido que venderlo y  ahora labora solo los días miércoles y sábados y el resto de la semana se dedica a su casa, también  nos comenta que tenia una tienda pero la cerró por falta de tiempo pero esta pensando en reabrirla.

Se encuentra ocho años trabajando con los créditos de la fundación y éstos le  han beneficiando en sus negocios, con el nuevo crédito  va a  comprar  cerdos y alimento  para engordarlos y venderlos  y tiene como meta montar nuevamente su tienda de viveres.
texts.en:
La señora Julia A. is a member of the communal bank Los Talvos. She lives in the San Miguel community, El Valle parish, which is located southeast of the city of Cuena. This area is known for its important production of corn and its tourist attractions such as the Chochapamba lakes full of bulrushes. Julia is 61 years old. She divorced 25 years ago because her husband drank a great deal. She had three children with her husband, and they are now 42, 33, and 26 years old. They are married and independent, but Julia has 12 grandchildren who always keep her company. Three of the grandchildren already work, and only three are in her care because their mother left the country in search of a better future. The rest of the grandchildren live with their parents but always spend time with their grandmother. Her dwelling is her own, which makes her life calm and peaceful. Julia has sold fruits, fresh grains, and vegetables for 30 years. She had her own sales site, but because of her age she had to sell it. Now she only works Wednesdays and Saturdays, and the rest of the week is spent in her house. She also told us that she had a store but she closed it because she couldn't spend enough time in it. Nevertheless, she is thinking of reopening it. She has borrowed money from the foundation over the last eight years, which money helped her business. With this new loan, she will buy pigs and food to fatten them. Then she will sell them. Her goal is to reopen her supply store.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and pig food

loans.name: Nanita's Group

texts.en:
Nanita E. is from the village of Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Nanita is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nanita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nanita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nanita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nanita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Nanita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 5 hijos, del que solo vive en su casa propia con su hija Mary que estudia en la Universidad. El negocio al que se dedica Rosa, es la venta de salchipapas (papas y pollo frito), por lo que empieza a partir de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 12 de la noche,  trabajando arduamente, friendo y vendiendo sus platillos. Desde entonces su puesto de salchipapas lo realiza en la puerta de su casa atendiendo a sus clientes, resultándole muy rentable el negocio. Generalmente trabaja sola, pero los fines de semana su hija mary la apoya. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y darles un trato cordial; es así que lleva 5 años en esta labor, sólo que a veces no termina de vender todo; y pierde parte de su capital. En el futuro planea incrementar  mesas y sillas para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su crédito número 32 y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además en su grupo comunal es un cliente risueño. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una parrillero y toldo para ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55, is a very hard-working woman. She has 5 children but only her daughter Mary, who is a university student, still lives at home with her. Rosa sells salchipapas (fried chicken and potatoes) from 5pm until midnight. She works hard frying and selling her dishes. Her food stand is located at her doorstep and the business is quite profitable. She usually works alone but her daughter Mary helps out on weekends. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers and treating them cordially. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. Sometimes, she doesn’t sell out all her product and incurs a loss. For the future, she would like to increase the number of tables and chairs to offer her customers more comfort. This is her 32nd loan and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is a cheerful member of her communal group. She plans to use the requested funds to buy a grill and a tarp cover to provide better customer care.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grill and a tarp cover for her stall.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a wife of M. R. and lives in the Pakistani city of Borewala, which is famous for its shrines. She is 33 years old and married. She owns a small, one-roomed house with a kitchen and bathroom, and has been living there with her family for the past 15 years.
Sakina is a very hardworking lady. She is skilled at making artificial flowers and different decoration pieces. She learned this skill from her mother and now uses it to make money. Although Sakina is not educated, she wants to give her five children a good education. She has three sons and two daughters. Her elder son is 12 years old and in 7th grade; her next son is 10 years old and in 10th grade; her youngest son is in kindergarten. Her elder daughter is also in kindergarten, and goes with her brother into school, while her youngest daughter is not of school age yet.
Sakina's husband is a salesman and works in a grocery store for a monthly wage. To support him financially, Sakina operates her own business. They are both very hardworking and work to improve the family's standard of living. They want to give their children a good education so they have a good future and make their parents proud.
Sakina has successfully repaid her first loan to Kiva partner, Asasah – a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Now she is applying for her second loan, which will be used to purchase groceries to start a grocery shop for her husband. He has obtained good experience of sales now and can better run his own grocery shop.

loans.use: To purchase groceries to start a grocery shop for her husband

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Houn H., the group leader of this bank loan, was selected by the four members living in Chiev Bdei Khang Kaeut village in Takeo province. Each of the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mr. Houn H. is a farmer who owns over two hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. He is also a farm laborer. His problem is that his rice field is infertile and far from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mr. Houn H. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline and to rent machines to plow his field. His wife, Mrs. Vaney Chheng, is a Khmer cake maker. Mr. Houn H. is the father of three children who are studying at the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline and to rent plowing machines

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich T., 47, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She rents karaoke rooms to her new and existing clients for an income of USD 8.30 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of about USD 5 per day. 

T. is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase a generator. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. T.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: buy a generator

loans.name: Felix Bernabe

texts.es: El Sr. Q. A. Felix Bernabe vive en el caserio la joya perteneciente al Distrito de Santiago. Vive con su esposa quien es ama de casa. El Sr. Q. es pensionista, cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa. El Sr. Q. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Felix Bernabe Q. A. lives in the La Joya settlement in Santiago district with his wife who is a housewife. Mr. Q. is retired and owns his house that he’s making improvements on. He is asking for funds to finish the work on the house in order to provide his wife with better quality of life. Mr. Q. is grateful for any help we might be able to provide through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Nua Seneuefa

texts.en: Nua Seneuefa S. is 30 and married with three children, aged from 3 to 8. She is starting a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale and needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Nua Seneuefa plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or USD 125 per week) to improve and expand her business. Nua Seneuefa joined SPBD In 2010 and this is her first loan with them. SPBD's loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates about SPBD.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba T. is married and has five dependents. She has not received any form of education.  Aba sells foodstuffs at Elmina. Her husband is a security man.  Aba uses her earnings from her sales to help her husband take care of her children. Aba will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: purchase additional foodstuffs to resell

loans.name: Aaster

texts.en:
Aaster Perveen lives in a historic city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the capital city of Punjab Province. It is also known for its history, gardens, culture, and food.

Aaster lives in Nishat Colony which is near the Cantt area. She is 42 years old, and married to I. G., who is an electrician by profession. He not only does electrical repair work but also operates a shop in the market where he sells electrical supplies to his customers. His business is doing very well and he earns a good income every month.

Aaster lives in a three-room brick house with her husband and five children: three girls and two boys. All of them are getting their education. The two eldest children have completed their school education and are now studying in college, while the other three are still in school and studying in the 9th, 4th, and 2nd standard, respectively.

Over the years Aaster has proved herself to be a great mother and housewife, who not only takes care of her children very well, but has also made her house into a home with her good management skills. She supports her family financially by doing embroidery for her neighboring clients. She gets regular orders due to her reputation of as an expert dress embroiderer.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband, who wants to expand his electricity business by putting more electric supplies, such as tube-lights, wires, and switches etc. to his shop. He also has a plan to hire an electrician to provide electrical repair services to his customers on a timely basis because sometimes he can’t handle emergencies alone.

Aaster is a regular loan user of Asasah. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has maintained a good credit history and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To purchase electrical supplies for resale

loans.name: Pamela Jepkosgei

texts.en: Pamela is a 38-year-old mother of four, married to Mr K..She sells used clothing and materials. She was introduced to KADET by a member. With this first loan, she plans to buy additional used clothes and materials to sell at a profit. She has been in this business for five years making a comfortable income that has fed the family and schooled the children. Her future plan is to own a fully stocked retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for sale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Evelyn owns & operates a general store. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a twenty-seven-year-old man, married with two children and living in a temporary house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He farms lemon grass which has enabled him to maintain a good standard of living. However, Christopher is facing a challenge of prolonged drought which sometimes affects his periodic harvest. His business dream is to have spread-out pieces of land with lemon grass. Christopher needs the loan to clear land and pay for labor as he plants his lemon grass on one acre.

loans.use: Clearing land and paying for labor as he plants lemon grass on one acre

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene vive en la zona  Mariscal Sucre,  de la Ciudad de El Alto, actualmente se encuentra casado, cuya esposa se dedica a la confección de mantas. Rene solicito 800 $us y se dedica al transporte en minibús,  en  rutas definidas de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito es para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo.
texts.en: Rene lives in the Mariscal Sucre area of the City of El Alto. He is married, and his wife works making blankets. Rene is seeking $800. He works as a minibus driver, on defined routes across the city of El Alto. The loan is to pay for repairs to the vehicle.

loans.use: To pay for minibus repairs

loans.name: Saum's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people, located in Lekh Pram village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Saum S. A. is a 40 year old married woman and was selected as the group leader for this group loan. 

S. A. and her husband, Mr. Nov SambA., are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate vegetables for a living. With this farm, they face a problem because they don't have enough money to support it. Thus, S. A. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for laborers to plow her farm to cultivate vegetables. This couple work very hard to support their two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory and another is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides, and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm to cultivate vegetables.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 43 años, convive con Juan, de 48 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, Fredy, de 15, Mery, de 22 y Edwin de 18 años, los que junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente, en su casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural de Yaroka. Como una familia unidad; Ana, Juan y sus hijos se las ingenian para salir adelante. Todos ellos se dedican a la agricultura; la siembra de gladiolo, arveja, papa y choclos, son su principal producción, desde entonces llevan 24 años dedicándose a la agricultura. En épocas de cosechas, viaja junto a su hija a la ciudad de Tarma y a la capital del país, donde comercializa sus productos a los diferentes compradores. Por su parte Juan y su hijo, se dedican al trasporte público, donde todos los días con los 3 autos que poseen, trasladan a los pobladores en la ruta de Tarma-Yaroka; lo que les brinda buenos ingresos, pues la zona es alejada y los pobladores necesitan trasladarse constantemente a la ciudad para realizar sus actividades. Ahora ella desea seguir trabajando y sembrar cada día más. Ana es una mujer responsable y luchadora, en cada cuota con MFP; incentiva a sus integrantes a  seguir adelante. Ya es el octavo crédito que tiene y desea seguir trabajando para concretar sus objetivos. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar abono orgánico, para su cultivo de gladiolo, de la misma manera contratará personal para arar su terreno agrícola, en el que está planeando sembrar zanahoria y espinaca.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 and lives with Juan, 48. They have three children, Fredy, 15, Mery, 22, and Edwin, 18. Together with her husband, her kids work hard in their own home, located in the rural zone of Yaroka. As a united family, Ana, Juan, and their kids think up ways they can get ahead. 

They all work in agriculture, mainly growing gladiolus, peas, potatoes, and corn. They have been working in agriculture for 24 years. During the harvest, Ana travels with her daughter to the city of Tarma and to the capital of the country, where she sells her products to the different purchasers. 

For his part, Juan and his son work in public transportation. Every day using the 3 automobiles they own, they transport inhabitants along the Tarma - Yaroka route. It provides them good income because the area is nearby and the citizens constantly need to go to the city to do their activities.

Ana wants to continue working and planting more each day. Ana is a responsible woman and a fighter. Every loan payment with MFP gives incentive to the members to get ahead. This is Ana’s eighth loan, and she would like to continue working to achieve her goals. With the requested loan, she will be able to purchase organic fertilizer for the cultivation of gladiolas, and similarly, will be able to hire help to plow her fields, where she is planning on planting carrots and spinach.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for the cultivation of gladiolas and to hire field hands for planting carrots and spinach

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is married to M. B. who has a grocery store business. He operates his store in the market where he sells daily-use items such as soaps, tooth paste, and rice. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house in Khanewal, a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She doesn’t have any children, so she spends her time staying at home doing her household responsibilities. Her brother also lives with her and he works in the field. He grows different seasonal crops to improve his financial condition.
 
Zubaida has applied for a loan from Asasah, a Kiva field partner, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy more groceries so his grocery store can serve many more clients. He opened his business 2 years ago. Zubaida hopes that a loan will make her husband's business more profitable. 

She is a new Asasah borrower and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her. 

In the photo, Zubaida is the woman with he Asasah Passbook.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina  C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 3, Brgy. Canalum, Siaton, Negros Oriental.  She earns her living by operating a rice farm business.  Her husband Alberto C., who is 68 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 43 and 41 years old.  Crispina  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Crispina  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy fertilizer for her rice field to save up for future improvements of her business. Crispina C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her rice field

loans.name: Ayoavi William

texts.fr: M. William est âgée de 38 ans et a un enfant.  Il est informaticien de profession mais  il a associé la vente des accessoires des ordinateurs.  En effet, il  a commencé en 2007 cette activité et s’approvisionne dans le magasin computer plus au niveau du quartier protestant. Il revend ensuite dans son magasin à Dékon.  Il demande un prêt pour acheter 50 cartons de CD et DVD et un ordinateur.
texts.en: M. Willima is 38 years old and has one child. He is a computer scientist by profession, but in addition he sells computer accessories. In fact, he launched this business in 2007, stocking up in a computer store in the Protestant district. He then resells in his store in Dékon. He is seeking a loan to purchase 50 boxes of CDs and DVDs and one computer.

loans.use: Puchasing CDs, DVDs, and a computer

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
AMIGAS UNIDAS

Majella es integrante del grupo de Alcancía Comunal “AMIGAS UNIDAS” tiene ya 5 años llevando el cargo de presidenta del grupo este grupo esta conformado actualmente por 7 personas que se conocieron por medio de la presidenta que fue buscando gente honrada y cumplida para así poder crear su grupo.
Majella tiene 50 años de edad es madre casada de 1 hijo que es mayor de edad Majella tiene ya 19 años trabajando en su casa vendiendo cerveza y así  poder poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y tanbien a logrado construir su vivienda si Majella    tuviera un capital de trabajo lo invertiría en poner una tienda propia por el momento Majella invertirá su dinero del préstamo en aumentar la cantidad cerveza para vender.
texts.en:
AMIGAS UNIDAS [Friends United]

Majella is a member of the Amigas Unidas [Friends United] Communal Bank and has been president of the group for 5 years. This group currently has 7 members who met through the president, who was looking for honorable and reliable people to form her group.

Majella is 50 years old, married, and has an adult son. Majella has spent 19 years working out of her house selling beer, thereby being able to help her husband with the household expenses and also to manage to build their home. If Majella were to have working capital, she would invest it in opening an expanded store. For the moment, Majella will invest the money from her loan in increasing the amount of beer she has to sell.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 36 years old. Melissa is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 15 years old and the youngest is only 4. To make a living, Melissa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Melissa also tills a rice farm. She sells her harvest at the market.

Melissa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melissa has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Melissa is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta T. is from the town of San Francisco. She is 42 years old. Antonieta is married and has eight children. Her eldest child is 21 years old while the youngest is only 2. To make a living, Antonieta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Antonieta does her best to provide for the needs of her family. 

Antonieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonieta is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antonieta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kutuma

texts.en: Kutuma Y. is a single parent with 3 children. She has been through junior high school and is now a poultry farmer at Korfofordo, near Jukwa. She uses her income to see to the upkeep of her home, and will use this loan to purchase poultry feed to enhance the growth of her chicks so she can sell them for more money. With the new profits from her expanded business, Kutuma plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin D. is from the city of POB. 1, OROQUIETA CITY. He is 55 years old. Benjamin is single. To make a living, Benjamin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Benjamin has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Benjamin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benjamin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Benjamin is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP. A portion of this loan will be used to purchased piglets and feeds to help expand the business. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Benjamin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchased piglets and feeds to help expand the business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien habita en el Memorial Sandino. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 10 años e invertirá el crédito en ropa y perfumes por la temporada de verano
Gladys inicio con Adim en un grupo solidario llamado “Las Amigas II” y en la actualidad es un crédito individual.
texts.en: Gladys is a hard-working, driven and enterprising woman who lives in Memorial Sandino neighborhood.  She has owned a small business selling used clothing for 10 years and she will invest her loan in buying clothes and perfumes for the summer season.  Gladys started working with ADIM as a member of a community bank called "Las Amigas II" (Friends II) and she is currently requesting an individual loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfumes.

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha is the mother of two children who are enrolled in local public school. She was born in 1982. She is married to Mr. Chruy and both of them are farmers who owns a small piece of land where they grow rice.  They sell part of the rice and use the rest of the rice to support their family.  They own an  agric machine.  Mr. Chruy is also a fisherman.

In their rice field, they face a problem because their field has infertile soil. In order to improve rice production, Mrs. Pha is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline and pesticides. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticides

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth P. is from the village of Insibay, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Lilibeth is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, bread, eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & instant noodles. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & instant noodles.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion A. is 49 years old, married to a carpenter and has four children, some of whom are employed. She lives with her family in Caloocan City, Metro Manila. Conception makes a living selling usable junk as well as bottles and old newspapers for recycling. She also runs a “sari-sari” (or variety) store in an area adjacent to her house. She earns about PHP 12,000 and is applying for a loan of PHP 22,000 to keep both of her businesses operating and reach her goal of earning a greater profit. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a variety store and a recycling business.

loans.name: Sro

texts.en:
Sro is a resident in the Komong Chame Province. She is a domestic farmer. She was married, but her husband passed way from an illness many years ago. 

Sro grows different kinds of crops on her existing farmland. From this business, she can make a profit of about $2 each day to cover the family’s needs. She will be using her loan to dig a pond, and to buy fish food and small fish for feeding. Sro lives in a wooden house with her five children, two of whom are working in different locations while the other three are single.

loans.use: to dig a pond, and to buy fish food and small fish for feeding.

loans.name: Uyen's Group

texts.en:
Uyen is 39 years old and has two children who attend high school and secondary school. She makes a living as a farmer, raising rice and vegetables for her family and also to support a flock of 200 chickens who lay about 150 eggs a day. Local merchants come to her house to buy her products, and she is applying for a loan for 5,014,000 Vietnamese Dongs to buy more feed for her chickens 

Hien is 30 years old and has two children. She has a flock of chickens and is applying for a loan for 6,322,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to buy feed for two flocks of chickens.

loans.name: Virginia Adela

texts.es: La señora Virginia se dedica a la venta de masitas de repostería como ser donas,, galletas, alfajores, empanadas y otros actividad que la realiza hace 12 años,  el requerimiento del préstamo es para la compra de un carrito para la venta de sándwich en una escuela por que hay la oportunidad de tomar una tienda en alquiler esta razón le lleva a solicitar el crédito, la señora vive en casa de su mama que ya es de edad avanzada ella se hace cargo de su manutención y los gastos por enfermedad que ella tiene.  La señora Virginia está muy contenta con el financiamiento que se le otorgó por que indica que esta actividad que va a emprender le va a generar un ingreso extra y es una forma de empezar algo nuevo, sin dejar de lado la actividad de repostería, ya que le va muy bien con esta actividad, es una persona trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Virginia has sold assorted baked goods like donuts, cookies, sponge cake, turnovers and others for 12 years.  The loan is needed to buy a small cart to sell sandwiches at a school because she has the opportunity to lease a store and this is why she’s asked for the loan.

She lives in her mother’s house because she is elderly and Virginia takes care of her and covers the medical expenses for the illness she has.  

Virginia is very happy with the loan she was granted because she indicates that this new activity she is going to start will generate extra income and it’s a way to start something new without having to set aside her pastry business because she does very well with it.  She is a person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Vilma Yaneth

texts.es: Vilma Yaneth D. treinta y siete años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en el lugar donD. resiD., el lugar es muy humilD. pero muy higiénico para el trabajo, se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues sus tortillas son muy ricas, D. buena calidad. Vilma siempre está adelante D. la competencia siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita; ella piensa que hay que valorar todo lo que se anhela y se tiene;  quiere ver crecer el negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir vendiendo el producto. Vilma Yaneth tiene la confianza que su trabajo le ayudara a llevar seguridad económica al hogar y a ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en: Vilma Yaneth is thirty-seven years old and she lives with her life partner and their children in a house of their own. She has a tortilla factory in her house. The place is very humble but hygienic for her work. She has earned many clients especially because her tortillas are very delicious and of good quality. Vilma is always ahead of the competitions because she always has what the client needs. She thinks that one must value everything that we long for and everything that we have. She wants to make her business grow and for this reason she requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner). It will help her purchase corn in wholesale to be able to keep selling her products. Vilma Yaneth is confident that her work will help her bring financial security to her household and to proviD. a better life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase corn in wholesale.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro oriundo de la torre de Chuquisaca, no es casado pero convive con la señora Rossilda tienen un hijo pequeño, su actividad es de albañil constructor, esta prestando su servicio en la zona del torno y el transportarse para el es dificultoso por tal motivo solicita el, crédito para poder comprarse una moto y a si tener su propio medio de transporte, es una persona muy responsable, y con ganas de superación,  el sr. Pedro esta agradecido con nuestra entidad por haber confiado en el y brindarle un apoyo para poder obtener una moto y así obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Señor Pedro is a native of La Torre, Chuquisaca.  He is not married but lives in a common law relationship with Señora Rossilda.  They have one small child.  He works as a mason and offers his services in the surrounding area.  Getting around is difficult for him so he is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike so that he can have his own transportation.  He is a very responsible person, who is eager to excel.  Señor Pedro is grateful to our organization for having confidence in him and giving him support so that he can buy a motorbike and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie is 32 years old and lives in Airport community. She stopped her education in 8th grade. She is married and has five children between 3 and 14 years old. They are all in school and live at home. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

For the past two years, Amie has been selling slippers. She started this business with her husband's salary and learned it from her friends. She likes her business because of the way people buy from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers for her business. Her plans is to send her children to school and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase slippers for her business.

loans.name: Jati 9 Utara 7 Group

texts.en:
Sri is 52 years old. She lives in North Jakarta with her husband and children. 

Since 1970, she has been selling gado-gado (a vegetable salad with peanut sauce) and juice in Perempatan Jati.

This is the third time Sri is borrowing from VisionFund Indonesia. She requested 2,300,000 Indonesian Rupiahs to buy more materials to make gado-gado and juice. 

From the profits of her business, she can send her children to school, and in the future she hopes she can have her own shop. She also wants to repair her house.

loans.use: to pay for materials to make gado-gado and juice.

loans.name: Juntos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
L.  socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTOS PARA EL PROGRESO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac, en L. Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

L.  socia  María; tiene 62 años D. edad,  L. socia es conviviente; L. socia tiene 4 hijos ya independientes; L. socia trabaja en L. venta D. huevos cocinados acompañados con papas cocidas y ají picante; L. socia también por las tardes se dedica  a L. venta D. golosinas, elL. venD. D. forma ambulatoria, en L. plazoleta D. centenario desD. hace 20 años, por las mañanas en su canastita pequeña lleva los huevos con papas cocinadas y también su pequeña carreta con golosinas, elL. es comerciante minorista así que no requiere comprar una carreta granD. ni nada por el estilo, elL. acondiciono una caja y acomodando sus golosinas lleva a venderlas en un costado D. L. plazoleta. L. socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para invertir en L. compra D. golosinas para aumentar su negocio y comprara papas, mas huevos para las semanas que vienen. L. socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra D. huevos, papas, golosinas para incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.

L.  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Juntos para el Progreso” (Together for Progress) communal bank located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

The member is María, 62.  She has a spouse and four children who are already living independently.  She works selling cooked eggs with cooked potatoes and hot chili.  In the afternoons she’s also a snack vendor in the Centenario Square; she’s been in this business for 20 years.  During the morning, she takes her cooked eggs and cooked potatoes in her little basket as well as her snack cart.  She is a retailer so she doesn’t need to buy a larger cart or anything like that.  She equipped a box to display her snacks along one of the square’s streets.

On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy snacks to increase her stock and to buy potatoes and more eggs for the coming weeks.  She is asking for the loan to buy eggs, potatoes and snacks to increase business and improve profits.

She is grateful for the support she’ll get and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy eggs, potatoes and snacks.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, es empleado y agricultor, es soltero, vive con su madre, él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 8 años y también es empleado, trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 4:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades atendiendo las dos ocupaciones al mismo tiempo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y herbicidas para las plagas, con estos materiales podrá dar un cuido adecuado a la siembra y garantizar una mejor producción de maíz para su familia.
El objetivo de José es el futuro tener su propia casa, apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
José is an employee and also a farmer.  He’s single living with his mother.  He’s been farming for the last 8 years and he’s also employed; he works daily from 7am until 4pm.  To date, he’s had no problem doing both jobs simultaneously.

He’s asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicide.  These supplies will make it possible for him to provide adequate care to his crops and guarantee a better corn harvest for his family.

José’s goal for the future is to have a house of his own and to help his mother with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
El señor Fidel es casado, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, es dueño de un taller de reparaciones de Motocicletas, trabajo de tornerías, reparaciones en general y su señora es costurera. Tienen tres hijos, uno de ellos posee trabajo seguro, los dos son menores y están en edad escolar. El señor tiene casa propia, con las comodidades dentro del bienestar familiar, posee móvil de transporte propio que es una motocicleta.
Comenta que se dedica a este trabajo hace 25 años, por lo que ya tiene una vasta experiencia en lo que hace. Además de eso gracias a todo este tiempo ha podido formarse ya una clientela que frecuentemente acude hasta él.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para las reparaciones que realiza, pues de esa forma puede cumplir mejor con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Fidel is married and lives in the city of Pilar.  He is the head of a motorcycle repair workshop.  He works with lathes and does repairs in general, and his wife is a seamstress.  They have three children, one of whom has a secure job.  The other two are younger and still school-age.  The Señor owns his own home, with amenities for his family's well-being.  He has is own mode of transport, which is a motorcycle.

He comments that he has been doing this work for 25 years, and so has vast experience in what he does.  Additionally, he is grateful that during this time he has gained a customer base who frequently come to him.

He is requesting the loan for the purchase of spare parts for the repairs he does, as in this way he will be better able to service his customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro, tiene treinta siete   años de edad, es casada con  tres personas a su cargo, y estas se encuentran en edad escolar
 Una de las necesidades que atraviesa ella, es la urgencia de comprar mercadería para su negocio ya que para este tiempo las ventas se ponen buenas. Es  por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito que le permita mejorar sus condiciones económicas tanto en su negocio como en su familia. Ha trabajado once préstamo con ceprodel, agradece a la institución ya que con este nuevo préstamo podrá tener mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Socorro, 37, is married and has three people who are school age in her care.  One of the needs she has at present is that it’s urgent that she buy merchandise for her business because this is a time when sales become good.  Because of this, she’s calling on Ceprodel so that she can be the beneficiary of a loan that will make it possible for her to improve her economic conditions both in her business and in her family.  She has had 11 Ceprodel loans and she thanks the institution because this new loan will lead to better family income.

loans.use: to buy dairy products.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by providing tailoring services in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more materials and supplies for her business. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and supplements her income by selling frozen foods. Her goal is to earn enough money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies and materials for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar es un señor de 42 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

El tiene el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposa, que le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita Oscar es un micro crédito de ¢400,000(cuatrocientos mil colones), para comprar una motocicleta para vender repuestos, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Oscar es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 42 year old man who lives with his wife and children in a community called Osa, located in Caña Blancal which is in the Puntarenas province. This community is known for being a rural area and is much visited for its beaches. Its main economic activities are tourism and agriculture. 

Oscar has the support and help of his wife who makes it easy to continue with his business. Furthermore, the business is very exciting to him since he has seen it grow a little at a time with increasing demand and since those in the community have felt satisfied with the service he’s provided. 

For this reason, Oscar is asking for a loan of ¢400,000 to buy a motorcycle to sell parts and to give the best service and support to his business. 

Oscar is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal communal bank, one of 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. With this loan he hopes to benefit personally and economically.  He also notes that, thanks to this type of organization and to methods of facilitating loans, he can spend more doing working in his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to sell parts.

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Mr DAOUDA   est marié et Père de 01 enfant. Il a 02ans et personne ne va à l’école. Il a 04 personnes en charge.

Mr est couturier  depuis 09ans. Il s’approvisionne au  marché de toecin (secteur 20 Ouaga). Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les enfants.

Il veut  s’acheter  220m de tissus pour doublure, 10m de tissus pour double col, 03 sachets de boutons, 10 paquets de dentelles, 02 paquets d’aiguilles, 36 fermetures, 10 paquets de fils à coudre et 10m de tissus satin.

Mr  utilise ses bénéfices pour  améliorer les conditions de travaille en achetant d’autres machines et accessoires. Il  ambitionne  ouvrir une boutique pour vendre les accessoires de couture (mercerie) tout en assurant sa couture et améliorer les conditions de vie des membres de sa famille en assurant leur santé, éducation et leur alimentation.
texts.en: Mr Daouda is married and the father of a two year old child, who does not attend school. He is responsible for four persons. He has been a tailor/seamster for the past 9 years, sewing clothes for women, men and children. He stocks up on cloth at the Toecin market (near Ouaga). He is asking for this loan in order to purchase 220m of cloth for lining, 10m of cloth for double collars, 3 packs of buttons, 10 packs of lace, 2 packets of needles, 36 zippers, 10 packets of sewing thread and 10m of satin. Profits from these sales will be used to improve his working conditions, through the purchase of machines and accessories.
