In the future, he would like to open a store in order to sell sewing accessories in addition to continuing his sewing business, in order to improve the living conditions of his family and covering their health, education and nutrition expenses.

loans.use: purchase 230m of cloth for sewing, 3 packets of buttons, 10 packets of lace, 2 packets of needles, 36 zippers, 10 packets of sewing thread and 10m of satin

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали энергичный способный молодой человек Он женат, на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Он очень перспективен и все делает по расчету. В настоящее время строит новый дом для своей семьи. Он занимается предоставление услуг такси на своей автомашине Газель. Полученный доход тратит на строительство. Наступает зима и к наступлению зимы надо порыть кровлю дома, а не то все может испортиться. Он просит займ на покупку стройматериалов для покрытия крыши. Он заранее благодарен за предоставленную помощь.
texts.en: Kurbonali is an energetic, talented young man. He is married and raising four children. He is very forward-looking and does everything for . At this time he is building a new home for his family. He provides taxi services in his Gazelle. He spends this revenue on construction. Winter is coming and he needs to cover the roof of his home; otherwise it might deteriorate. He is requesting a loan to buy building materials for covering his roof. He is grateful in advance for your help.

loans.use: purchase building materials to cover his roof

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de dos de las miembros del grupo, quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, ellas invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 21 mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
Claudia es una de las integrantes, quien comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de joyas. Su venta es muy buena, ya que siempre tiene mucha variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, sumado a eso su amabilidad y su buena forma de venta. Cuenta que gracias a su negocio ha podido ayudar a su familia y salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar cadenas, pulseras, anillos, tobilleras, y demás tipos de joyas con las cuales podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by two members of the group who had gone to the office of the Paraguayan Foundation in order to get better acquainted with the Committee of Enterprising Women's programs. They invited their friends and acquaintances from the neighborhood and decided to start working together to get ahead and thereby improve their lifestyles. They are 21 hardworking, modest women who must earn a living every day. 

Claudia, one of the members, mentions that she makes a living selling all types of jewelry. Her business is very good because, on top of her friendliness and good sales approach, she always has a lot of variety to offer her clients. She says that thanks to her business she has been able to help her family and get ahead. 

She is asking for the loan to buy chains, bracelets, rings, anklets, and all other types of jewelry she can stock up on to satisfy her clients.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, rings, and anklets to resell.

loans.name: Cristobal De Jesus

texts.es:
Cristóbal, es agricultor vive con su esposa y sus hijos, su trabajo inicio desde joven, siembra en lo propio, no tiene por un horario fijo.
Actualmente comprara insumos agrícolas como abono y herbicidas para aplicarlos al cultivo, por esto solicita un préstamo que le cubra dicho gasto y poder fortalecer la plantación.
Su aspiración es que sus cultivos mejoren y que la cosecha sea abundante.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is a farmer who lives with his wife and children. His job began when he was young, planting on his own; He does not have a set schedule.

Now he will buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer and herbicides to put on the crops. This is why he is asking for a loan, to cover said cost and to be able to strengthen the plantation. 

His goal is that his crops will get better and that the harvest will be plentiful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Ovidio Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Ovidio  tiene como actividad la de artesano en construcción de botes, ya que  los botes que fabrica los realiza de madera y de forma manual, estos botes los vende para ser utilizados  para la navegación en el lago Titicaca, esta trabajo lo realiza juntamente con su esposa, juntos realizan diferentes trabajos, el momento de la visita se encontraba pintando el barco, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de madera para cubrir la demanda actual que tiene ya que en época de vacaciones mucha gente se va al lago y las personas que trabajan con estos botes tienen mucha demanda y le piden al Sr. Ovidio que fabrique estos botes en cantidad, el Sr. Ovidio es una persona muy trabajadora, por su experiencia realiza trabajos de muy buena calidad.
texts.en: Ovidio makes a living building hand-made wooden boats. He sells these boats for use on Lake Titicaca. He does the work alongside his wife, doing different tasks. At the time of the picture he was painting a boat. This business is the main source of income for Ovidio and his wife, and they are requesting the loan to purchase wood so they can meet their current demand. During the vacation season a lot of people go to the lake, and the people who make these boats are in demand, so Ovidio is asked to build boats in bulk. Ovidio is a hard-working person and thanks to his experience he produces high-quality work.

loans.use: to purchase wood to build boats.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es: La señora Maria Sonia a sus 55 años de edad se dedica desde su propio taller adecuado en la sala de su casa a confeccionar principalmente cortinas, manteles y acolchados, esta actividad la ha realizado durante toda su vida y con la cual ha generado sus propios ingresos para su sostenimiento y apoyo económico en su hogar. Debido al invierno, la señora Maria Sonia ha pasado por dificultades puesto que sus pedidos disminuyen drásticamente, por lo cual requiere de la compra de nuevas telas e insumos que le permitan realizar sus productos, poderlos vender, así reactivar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus padres.
texts.en: Señora Maria Sonia, who is 55 years old, works in her own workshop, set up in the living room of her home, where she principally makes curtains, tablecloths, and quilts. She has been doing this work her entire life, and with it she has generated her own income to sustain herself and to help with the household finances.  She had some difficult times because of the winter, since her orders diminished drastically, so now she needs to buy new fabrics and other items that will allow her to make her products to sell. Thus she will reactivate her business and improve her quality of life and that of her parents.

loans.use: to buy items such as fabric and thread

loans.name: María Lina

texts.es:
La señora María, tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos.

Ella se dedica desde aproximadamente un año y medio a la elaboración y venta de comida en su casa a los obreros que trabajan en la construcción de la carretera longitudinal del norte. María aprendió a elaborar los alimentos, mediante unas capacitaciones que recibió en la unidad de salud de su comunidad.

Antes de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de alimentos, ella elaboraba y vendía chocobananos, charamuscas, refrescos, entre otros. Los insumos que necesita para elaborar sus alimentos, ella los compra en un pequeño pueblo, que esta a  15 minutos caminando a pie desde su casa. 

María solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar más insumos para elaborar los alimentos y para instalar una pequeña tienda en su casa y vender azúcar, jabón, aceite, frijoles, arroz, entre otros y para comprar 2 mesas con sus sillas plásticas, para que los clientes puedan comer cómodamente, ya que actualmente lo hacen en unas pocas sillas que tiene y en el muro de su casa. Así María atenderá mejor a sus clientes y podrá recibir a más personas y con la instalación de la tienda recibirá un ingreso adicional para sostener a su familia y brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old and lives with her life partner and their two children. For about a year and a half, she has been producing and selling food in her house for the laborers who are constructing the northern highway. She learned to cook through training she received at her community health unit.

Before María started to work in food production and sales, she made and sold Chocobananas, frozen juices and soft drinks, among other items. She purchases supplies for her business from a small town, which is a 15-minute walk from her home.

Mary applied to Fundación Campo for this loan so that she can purchase more ingredients for producing food, and to establish a small shop in her home where she will sell sugar, soap, oil, beans, and rice, among other items. She will also buy two plastic tables and some chairs so that her customers can eat comfortably - she currently only has a few chairs and a wall. 

María will be able to provide better service to her customers and accomodate more people, and the establishment of the shop will generate an additional income to support her family and provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for producing food, and to establish a small shop in her home where she will sell sugar, soap, oil, beans and rice, among other items, and buy two tables and some chairs.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois est âgé de 14 ans. Les membres qui le composent travaillent en parfaite collaboration. Leur principale activité est le commerce et l'embouche.
Fatou, debout à droite de la photo est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont 4 garçons et 3 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte acheter 2 moutons, l'un à 30 000f et au bout de 4 à 5 mois elle va les revendre.Elle va acheter aussi de l'arachide 100kg, le kg à 500f; et 10 bassine de bissap, le prix d'achat de la bassine à 1750f et la vente à 4000f.
Les bénéfices lui serviront à payer la scolarité de 3 enfants, d'assurer le petit déjeuner, l'achat de l'huile dont la famille aura besoin pour la préparation des repas et de se prendre en charge pour les frais médicaux.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" is 14 years old. The members who make it up work in perfect collaboration. Their main business is shopkeeping and animal fattening.

Fatou, standing on the right in the photo is 40 years old. She is married and mother to 7 children of whom 4 are boys and 3 are girls.

With the loan received she plans to buy 2 sheep, one at 30,000f and at the end of 4 to 5 months she is going to resell them. She is also going to buy 100kg of groundnuts, each kg at 500f, and 10 basins of hibiscus flowers. The price to purchase a basin is 1,750f and it sells for 4,000f.

The profits will serve to pay for the schooling of 3 children, and to ensure breakfast and the purchase of oil which the family will need for the preparation of meals and to take care of herself for medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy 2 sheep, 10 basins of hibiscus flowers and 100kg of groundnuts.

loans.name: Jabra

texts.en:
Jabra, is a 56 years old married, she has five children .She started sewing from home twenty years ago to assist her husband to provide their family income and provide all needs for her children study. She has a smart boy studying in school .
Jabra is requesting a 1500$ loan from Izdiharona to pay her son school fees uniform, books and other school expenses. 
The story of Jabra and her son is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients that are able to get better education. 
She preferred to blur her face for cultural reason.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Victor Javier

texts.es:
El señor Víctor un hombre luchador de 36 años, es casado la esposa no trabaja pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos de esta relación tienen 4 hijos el mayor de 17 años y la ultima de 5 meses, el viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos, tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para poder ayudar a su familia, solo tienen primaria ya que por falta de recursos no pudo continuar con sus estudios en la actualidad el lucha y se esfuerza para ayudar a sus hijos a tener un futuro mejor y no tengan que pasar por todo lo que el a pasado 
Vive y tiene el negocio en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos un lugar tranquilo de clima cálido húmedo rodeado de gente amable y trabajadora, este canto es muy conocido por sus diferentes atractivos turísticos, se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha.
Se dedica al comercio de ganado, aprendió de esta actividad por su propia iniciativa al mismo le dedica un promedio de 5 horas diarias, solicita el crédito para invertir en su vivienda, con esta inversión podrá mejorar la estabilidad de su familia, el señor Víctor agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Victor is a 36 year old, hard-working man.  He is married and his wife doesn't work as she stays home to care for their children. They have 4 children, the oldest is 17 years old and the youngest 5 months.  He comes from a low income family and he had to work since he was quite young to help his family.  They only studied until primary school, due to the lack of financial resources they couldn't keep studying. 

Currently, he fights and strives to help his kids have a better future so that they do not have to go through everything he did.  He lives and has his business in Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos, a quiet place with warm, humid climate surrounded by nice, hard-working people.  This canton is very well known for its different tourist attractions.  It is located in the north west of the province of Pichincha.  

He earns his living trading livestock.  He learned this activity by himself and he dedicates about 5 hours per day to this task.  He is requesting the loan to invest in his home, with this investment he will be able to improve the stability of his family.  Mr. Victor thanks the Alternativa Foundation and Kiva for their help and the opportunities they bring.

loans.use: to invest in his home, with this investment he'll be able to better the quality of life of his family.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a country woman and the mother of 9 children, for whom she has had to go through a lot of adversity. Nevertheless, she has always had the strength to get ahead, and to continue progressing with her family. Jane is a wise farmer, whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Eldoret, in the Rift valley region of Kenya. For the past 20 years she has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Jane has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has been making a profit selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of the produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Jane mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy another motorbike. Jane is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market in order to fetch a high price. With this loan, Jane is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Jane feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality among their male counterparts. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Jane will suffer fewer losses due to delays in the delivery of her produce to the market. She will also increase her sales volume, because she will be able to transport more goods to the market and increase her income level. Jane is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community, because she intends to employ someone who will be making deliveries on the motorbike, and helping with farm work. With your loan, Jane will improve her living conditions, and assure her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future.
Support a hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for transporting produce to the market

loans.name: Saliou

texts.en:
This group loan will be shared by the sixteen members of the Jalki Jeg Association, located in the seaside fishing village of Palmarin. Loan funds will be used to invest in better fishing equipment for the group members, including new fishing lines, nets, hooks, sinkers, and floaters, as well as transportation of their catch to market. The group, represented by Saliou S., described their business plan as follows:

“This project intervenes in a zone where fishing is the main way of earning a living. Paradoxically, the fisherman finds it very difficult to obtain the equipment needed to practice his trade. This project aims to find a solution to this state of affairs. The objectives of the loan are: 1) to provide local fishermen with appropriate fishing equipment; and 2) to provide the local population with quality seafood at a good price. Activities include: 1) investment in fishing equipment; 2) selling at the market and on order; and 3) a post-purchase quality guarantee.”

Original French:

\"Le projet intervient dans une zone où la pêche est l’activité principale. Paradoxalement, le pêcheur ne trouve sur place aucuns matériels à sa disposition. Le projet se propose de trouver un correctif à cet état de fait.

Objectifs du Prêt :

- mettre à la disposition des pêcheurs de la localité du matériel adapté et approprié

- fournir à la population locale du matériel de pêche de qualité et à bon prix

Activités :

- avitaillement en matériels de pêche

- vente sur mesure et sur commande

- service de garantie après vente\"

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Fishing equipment purchase

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi, a member of MBK, is requesting for a loan of $100. Emi and her husband have been in selling coconut milk rice, cooked rice in banana leaf, iced drinks and light snacks. The entire loan from MBK will be used for supplies for the store. The daily revenue amount to IDR80,000 with a profit of IDR40,000. Currently, Emi is reinvesting the profits from her store by purchasing goats and chickens.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Pheng Tan, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Sells coconut milk rice

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria sells cheese, potatoes and chuño, a traditional Bolivian staple of freeze-dried potatoes. Her husband works in a brickmaking factory. Together, they raise their three children, 1, 8 and 10 years of age. She lives in the rural area of La Paz, in the municipality of Achica Baja in Ingavi Province. This loan will go to the purchase of a dairy cow so Ana Maria can make more cheese. This is her second loan through IMPRO. Her good borrowing history gives her access to another loan so she can increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

Ana Maria, es comerciante de queso de leche, papa y chuño, su esposo trabaja como ayudante en una empresa de ladrillos constituyendo estas sus fuentes de donde provienen sus ingresos para la manutención de sus tres hijos de 10, 8 y 1 año; vive en el area Rural de La Paz, localidad Achica Baja Provincia Ingavi. El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una Vaca lechera, misma que le permitirá producir mayor cantidad de quesos. Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, su buen antecedente le permite acceder a otro crédito para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Mirna Concepción

texts.es:
Mirna is 35 years old. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is divorced and a mother of three children; they are 5, 9, and 15 years old. She started her own business selling tamales so as to obtain the necessary resources for her family, especially since she does not receive any support from her ex-husband. Mirna works from her own home, which has allowed her to remain close to her children. She works very hard every day with the hopes of improving her family's quality of life and being able to offer her children an education.

Right now she receives special requests for events; however, she does not have the necessary means to meet these demands. She asks for a loan of 475 dollars to purchase larger steam pots and a bigger tank of gas. With these she expects to increase her production. She pledges to pay off the loan within 4 months. You can be a part of this business' growth. Mirna and her family sincerely appreciate any support you may offer.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mirna tiene 35 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, es divorciada y madre de tres hijos, de 5, 9 y 15 años de edad. Inició su propio negocio con la venta de tamales para obtener los recursos necesarios para su familia, ya que no recibe un buen apoyo de su ex esposo. Mirna trabaja en su casa lo que le ha permitido también estar al pendiente de sus hijos, ella desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poder ofrecerles una buena educación para lo que se esfuerza día a día.

Actualmente recibe pedidos para eventos especiales pero no cuenta con los medios necesarios para poder cubrir su demanda, ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de vaporeras más grandes y un tanque de gas de mayor capacidad, con lo que espera incrementar su producción, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Se parte en el crecimiento de este negocio, Mirna y su familia agradecen sinceramente cualquier apoyo que puedas brindarles.

loans.use: To purchase work equipment

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en: I am Kubra A. and I want to help my husband to increase our fruit business that he does near the local university campus. Our present income is very small and we hardly manage our living. You can help me by lending $175, which we can invest in our business to increase our income.

loans.use: Expand the existing fruit business.

loans.name: Kethy

texts.es:
Ketthy is a strong-will woman who strives each day to reach for her goals. Due to her effort and strength , for the past 8 years she has been able to get the support from her family, especially from her husband who obtained a loan to opened up a hardware store in La Oroya by making deliveries. With time and dedication, the business has grown substantially.

A little while ago, she found a small place that she is now leasing in the city of Huayucachi. Ketthy works the store by herself making sure that all her clients are well-taken care of, and by offering sales/promotions to acquire more clients. Her business is growing due to good customer service.

Thanks to this business, they have been able to support themselves for the past years since there are no formal jobs in this area. She is an obstetrician by profession, but due to the lack of jobs and current circumstances she is unable to exercise her career. Regardless, she has decided to serve her community.

She wishes to open up another store in another nearby location close to her hardware store. This way she can sell more of her products. She is requesting a loan and she promises to repay it by working very hard. She wants to provide a better living condition and happiness to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Ketthy es una mujer valiente que se esfuerza para lograr lo que se ha propuesto de manera decidida; el ahínco y fuerza de su propuesta le ha permitido conseguir beneficios para su familia ya que hace 8 años recibe el apoyo de la familia de su querido esposo con el préstamos de un capital para que se inicie en el negocio de ferretería en La Oroya de manera ambulante; con el transcurrir del tiempo y la dedicación que le otorgó a su labor este negocio ha dado frutos y le ha permitido crecer de manera sostenida. Hace poco se estableció en un pequeño local de la ciudad de Huayucachi donde hasta el día de hoy se desempeña y permanece; Ketthy atiende personalmente en los ambientes de su ferretería y siempre ofrece ofertas y promociones de sus productos para tener más clientes, el buen trato que la caracteriza se ha convertido en un punto a su favor y observa satisfecha que su negocio va en aumento. Gracias a este negocio ella y su familia se han podido sostener durante años y fue una salida favorable ante la escasez de un empleo formal, ya que ella es obstetra de profesión pero debido a la falta de empleo y a las circunstancias no puede ejercer su carrera; sin embargo tiene en mente servir a la comunidad que la alberga y apoyarlos con sus conocimientos. Anhela aperturar una sucursal en otra zona cercana a su ferretería y así incrementar la oferta de sus productos para ello recurre a vuestro generoso corazón y se compromete a seguir trabajando para otorgarles bienestar y alegría a los miembros de su familia.

loans.use: To lease retail space

loans.name: Ericka

texts.es:
Ericka belongs to the communal bank “La Familia.” She lives at 520 Jr. Atahualpa in the Calleria district in the department of Ucayali. She is 28 years old and has one young son. Her husband works selling motorcycle parts, but his income is not enough to cover the household expenses. With her first loan of $100 (S./300.00) from Manuela Ramo, Ericka decided to invest in tires and motorcycle parts.

Currently, she has a motorcycle parts sales shop that she works in all day. She gets up very early to tend to her young son, prepares breakfast, then goes to work at her store.

With this loan from Manual Ramos of about $669 (S/.2000), which she will pay back in four months, she will increase her merchandise with the purchase of a dozen tires, 25 units of motor oil, 2 packages of parts, and other supplies.

Ericka is very happy with all aspects of her life. Her business grows a little everyday, and it is frequently visited by motorcycle drivers that are able to find what they need there. Additionally, she has the unconditional support of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ericka pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, vive en Jr. Atahualpa 520, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad y es madre de 1 hijo que aun es pequeño, su esposo se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motos, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para solventar los gastos de su casa, es así que Ericka, con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300.00 (US$100.00) decide invertir en llantas y repuestos de motos.

En la actualidad cuenta con una tienda de venta de repuestos de motos, donde atiende todo el día, se levanta muy temprano para atender a su pequeño hijo, prepara el desayuno y luego se va atender su negocio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2.000 (US$ 669.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, incrementará sus productos con la compra de1 docena de llantas, 25 unidades de aceite de motos y motokar, 2 paquetes de repuestos, etc.

Ericka se siente muy feliz en todos los aspectos de su vida, su negocio crece cada día mas, es muy concurrido por motocarristas que ahí encuentran lo que necesitan, además cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of parts and tires for motorcycles and motorcars.

loans.name: Joweria Nakazibwe's Group

texts.en:
Joweria is 40 years old. She sells used clothes for her income. She plans to 
construct a poultry house from the profits from her business.

loans.use: To expand her clothe selling business

loans.name: Khabibullo

texts.en:
B. Khabibullo is 31 years old. He is married with two children, the elder just started at school and the younger is only 2 years old. 

Khabibulo is an expert in audio editing of video tapes and discs with records of  family events of  his clients. He has been in this business for 4 years already. Khabibullo tries to use modern up-to-date technologies in his work so that he can satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. For instance, now he is planning to purchase a mputer in order to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business.

With this purpose Khabibullo requests 1450.00 Somoni (425 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan of Khabibullo and he thanks all for their support and promises not to let them down and to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of a computer

loans.name: Gloria Vilma

texts.en:
Gloria has been an associate of the community bank Manantial for 14 years. Through the bank, she has learned to save and to be responsible.

Gloria is 39 years old. She is married and has two children who are twenty and seventeen years old. Gloria is from the community of Chacco, in the region of Ayacucho. Gloria and her husband work in the agricultural sector. They have fields where they grow cilantro, carrots, and cauliflower. They sell their products at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Gloria also raises cattle.

Gloria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying seeds, fertilizers, and renting additional fields.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest earning savings account that each associate has. Gloria plans to use her savings to build a home. Her dream is that her children will be professionals, be able to open a fertilizer store, and to increase the number of cattle she raises.

loans.use: Gloria needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will invest in buying seeds, fertilizers, and renting additional fields.

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngo Thi N., 46 years old, is living with her husband and 2 children in Minh Phu, Soc Son. When the TYM Fund came to her village in 1992, she participated in the program and borrowed 30 USD to invest in breeding pigs. In the first year, her family situation experienced positive changes. Since then, she borrowed more money to expand her breeding plan. Her income from breeding pigs increased over years and as a result, she was able to send her children to school. Currently, her family income is 330 USD/month. Because of her successful business, in 2004, Mrs. N. was able to have her own well-furnished house built. During recent years, she always borrow the maximum allowed money. Her plan is to borrow 1200 USD to buy more pigs, ducks, fishes and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Ngô Thị Ngợi, 46 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Minh Phú, Sóc Sơn. Năm 1992 khi có Quỹ Tình Thương về thôn chị xin tham gia và được vay 30USD để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Trong năm đầu tiên kinh tế gia đình đã có những sự thay đổi, các vòng vốn tiếp theo được vay mức cao hơn chị Ngợi đã đầu tư mở rộng dự án. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi tăng dần lên qua các năm đã giúp chị Ngợi có điều kiện cho con cái học hành đến nơi đến chốn. Hiện nay mỗi tháng gia đình chị thu 330USD. Nhờ làm ăn hiệu quả đến năm 2004 chị Ngợi đã xây được nhà mái bằng khang trang có đầy đủ tiện nghi sinh hoạt. Trong những năm gần đây chị luôn vay mức vốn tối đa. Dự định của chị là sẽ xin vay 1200USD để mua thêm lợn, vịt, cá và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy pigs, ducks, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Señora P. has worked with our institution since about nine years ago when she used a loan to invest in working capital, reinvesting her profits in improving her house and lifestyle. She has noticed growth in her business. She is married, and her husband helps her with the business and works for a security company. She has two children, one married and one sickly.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora P. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace unos nueve años los que ha utilizado para invertir en capital de trabajo, reinvirtiendo utilidades en mejoras de su casa y condiciones de vida se nota un crecimiento del negocio es casada su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y trabaja en una empresa de seguridad, tiene dos hijos una casada y un hijo con problemas de enfermedad.

loans.use: Working Capital for General Merchandise

loans.name: Adeyemo

texts.en: T. Adeyemo lives in Imude, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells unbreakable plates, coolers and plastic items, and she has been in this business since the year 1994. She is 43 years old and married with 3 children. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years. She needs a loan to buy more plates, coolers and plastic items to sell in her shop. She remains grateful to Kiva and the lenders for coming to her aid financially.

loans.use: To buy unbreakable plates and coolers for sales

loans.name: Filomeno

texts.es:
Filomeno has had a store in his house for 6 years. Previously it was dedicated only to the sale of beverages. Then he wanted to grow his business, so he began offering delicacies and basic foods.

Filomeno is a bricklayer and, when some opportunity for work is presented, he does not doubt that he will be going to work.

The loan that he has requested will serve to supply the store.

He would like the business to grow more so that he will be able to fix his house.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomeno tiene una tienda en su casa desde hace 6 años. Antes solo se dedicaba a la venta de bebidas. Luego fue haciendo crecer su negocio hasta ofrecer golosinas y alimentos de primera necesidad.

Filomeno es albañil, por lo que cuando se presenta alguna oportunidad de trabajo, él no duda en ir a laborar.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para surtir más la tienda.

Él quisiera que su negocio crezca más y así poder arreglar su casa.

loans.use: To supply his store with products for sale: basic foods, beverages and delicacies.

loans.name: Leddy's Amkeni Group

texts.en:
Leddy is 27. She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 8 and 12. She opened a tailoring shop in 2003. Every day, she works from 7 am to 5.30 pm and earns about $25 each month.

Leddy is asking for a loan to buy inventory for her tailoring business. She will share this loan with her group members, who run businesses selling soap.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en:
Abiodun A. lives in Igbede in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with three children. She sells baby wears. She's been in this business since 2007.

Abiodun is a LAPO client. She needs a loan for $425 to buy more baby wears to sell. She says, "Thank you."

loans.use: To buy more baby wears to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El Comitè “San Miguel” se encuentra en la ciudad de Guarambare, todas sus integrantes son vecinas del barrio San Miguel de dihca ciudad. 
Las integrantes del comité se unieron y decidieron formar un comité de mujeres porque necesitaban creditos para capitalizar sus emprendimientos, pero no podian acceder a ninguno de los creditos ofrecidos normalmente en el mercador financiero. Formando un comité pudieron acceder a un credito rápido y facil que les reporta toda la utilidad para el tipo de trabajos que realizan. En principio el comité encontró muchas dificultades en su organización, y si bien todas las integrantes son vecinas, hubieron personas que no pudieron adaptarse al trabajo en equipo y tuvieron que apartarse de la organización. Hoy dia San Miguel ha logrado una plena integración de todas sus integrantes y una excelente organización, con lo que ha accedido a creditos cada dia mas incrementados en monto, que les permite trabajar con mayor cantidad de capital. Todas las integrantes del comité son madres de hogares y cada día trabajan para incrementar los ingresos del hogar y mejorar su nivel de vida.
En la fotografia adjunta no se encuentran las señoras Lorenza V. e Isacia F.. El detalle de actividades de cada señora se cita a continuación:
1 - Ceferina V. Mora.
2 – Maxima B. – venta de ropas.
3 – Maria Cristina A. – Venta de carbon.
4 – Maria Apolonia G. – Fabricacion y venta de detergentes.
5 – Cecilia Beatriz V. – Venta de frutas.
6 – Maria Aurora B. – Venta de frutas.
7 – Juana M. – Venta de comidas.
8 – Melitona T. – Venta de ropas.
9 – Pablina A. – Venta de frutas.
10 – Mariza Catalina Mendoza – Despensa.
11 – Isacia F. – Costurera.
12 – Lidia A. – Venta de ropas.
13 – Isidora A. – Venta de Ropas.
14 – Elisa Evangelista R. – Venta de frutas y verduras.
15 – Fidelina V. – Venta de frutas.
16 – Liz Paola R. –  Venta de ropas.
17 – Gabriela A. de Arce – Despensa.
18 – Cristina Dora T. – Venta de frutas.
19 – Sonia Beatriz V. – Venta de Carbon.
20 – Lorenza V. – Venta de tortas.
texts.en:
The "San Miguel" committee is located in the city of Guarambare and all of its members are neighbors in the San Miguel neighborhood. The members of the committee joined together and decided to form a women’s committee because they needed loans to capitalize their enterprises, but they were not able to access any of the loans normally offered on the financial market. By forming a committee they could access loans quickly and easily which is useful for all of the jobs that they carry out. In the beginning, the committee encountered many difficulties in their organization, and although all of the members are neighbors there were people who could not adapt to working as a team and had to separate themselves from the organization. Today San Miguel has accomplished a full integration of all of its members and an excellent organization, with which the loan amount of increased each day allowing them to work with a greater quantity of capital. All of the committee members are mothers and homemakers and each day they work to increase the incomes of the households and improve their quality of life. In the attached photograph Lorenza V. and Isacia F. do not appear. The details of the activities of each woman are noted in the following: 1 - Ceferina V. Mora. 2 Ð Maxima B. Ð clothing sales . 3 Ð Maria Cristina A. Ð charcoal sales. 4 Ð Maria Apolonia G. Ð production and sale of detergents. 5 Ð Cecilia Beatriz V. Ð fruit sales. 6 Ð Maria Aurora B. Ð fruit sales. 7 Ð Juana M. Ð food sales 8 Ð Melitona T. Ð clothing sales. 9 Ð Pablina A. Ð fruit sales. 10 Ð Mariza Catalina Mendoza Ð Despensa. 11 Ð Isacia F. Ð Seamstress. 12 Ð Lidia A. Ð Clothing sales. 13 Ð Isidora A. Ð Clothing sales. 14 Ð Elisa Evangelista R. Ð Fruit and vegetable sales. 15 Ð Fidelina V. Ð Fruit sales. 16 Ð Liz Paola R. Ð Clothing sales. 17 Ð Gabriela A. de Arce Ð Store. 18 Ð Cristina Dora T. Ð Fruit sales. 19 Ð Sonia Beatriz V. Ð Charcoal sales. 20 Ð Lorenza V. Ð Sale of cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegatables, meats, sugar, yeasts, canned goods, clothing, chemical products, etc.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús inició el negocio por la necesidad de que su hijo terminara sus estudios en Ingeniería en Sistemas, además de que los pagos de servicios y manutención se incrementaban y su esposo siempre ha tenido ingresos variables. Comenzó hace más de 11 años haciendo costuras a sus amistades y familiares, quienes la han ido recomendando y actualmente goza de buena reputación por la calidad de su trabajo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material de trabao y poder hacer unas pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Maria de Jesus started her business because of the need to help her son finish his Systems Engineering degree and also because living expenses started to increase and her husband doesn’t have a steady income. She started more than 11 years ago, doing tailoring and alterations for her friends and family, who have recommended her and she currently has a good reputation because of the quality of her work. She needs a loan of US$300 that will be repaid in three months to purchase material and fulfil pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Shalala

texts.en: Shalala (her husband is pictured) was born in 1985. She and her husband have one child. Her husband has been in the taxi business for one year. Now they need a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet has a shop in Benin City where she sells provisions and drinks. Juliet is 24 years and married with 4 children. Juliet hopes to meet the needs of her customers during this festive season. She needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth W. sells food supplies at the Elmina new market. She has received junior high education, is married and has 6 dependants. Her husband is a trader. Elizabeth has been selling food supplies since 2000. She is responsible for meeting the family's financial needs as well as paying the children's school fees. Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase her purchases of food items for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards a house which she wants to build, with her husband, for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital to enable her to increase her supplies of food items for resale.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis M. y su esposa la señora Patricia Juárez tienen una bonita familia de 2 hijos menores de edad y los cuales están estudiando. 
  A su vivienda le está haciendo falta un cuarto al frente para sus niños tengan su propio espacio y vivan mejor, es por eso que solicita esté préstamo para realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible. Planea pagarlo con sus ingresos como ingeniero de instalación de Internet.
texts.en:
José Luis M. and his wife Patricia Juárez have a beautiful family of 2 young children who are in school. Their house needs a front bedroom so that their children will have their own space and have better living conditions. For this reason he is requesting a loan in order to carry out this improvement as soon as possible. He plans to pay this loan with his income as an Internet installation engineer.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add a front bedroom to their home

loans.name: Ni Luh Raini

texts.id:
Ni Luh Raini sangat bersyukur ketika ia mendapatkan pinjamannya untuk yang pertama kali. Semua pinjaman itu duipergunakannya untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Pinjaman itu dipergunakan untuk membeli barang dagangan untuk melengkapi barang dagangan yang sudah ada. Kini usaha warungnya sudah lengkap dengan semua kebutuhan masyarakat sehari – hari. Hal itu berimbas dengan banyak pelanggan yang dimiliki pleh Ni Luh Raini.
            Karena usahanya makin maju, Ni Luh Raini dapat melunasi pinjamananya yang pertama dengan baik. Untuk periode kedua ini, Ni Luh Raini berencana untuk merenovasi warungnya agar lebih luas lagi. Selain itu, Ni Luh raini juga berencana untuk membeli sebuah rak kaca untuk meletakkan barang dagangannya agar kelihatan lebih rapi dan menarik. Untuk mewujudkan hal itu, Ni Luh Raini mengajukan pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- Ni Luh Raini berharap, semoga ia segera bisa mendapatkan pinjaman tersebut agar semua impiannya bisa terwujud.
texts.en:
Ni Luh Raini was very grateful of her first loan from Kiva/DINARI that helped her grow her business. She used the loan to purchase merchandise to increase the variety of her merchandise. Now her kiosk has more complete offering for her community's daily needs. This also increased Ni Luh Raini's client base. Due to her business' growth, she managed to successfully paid off her first loan. For this second loan, Ni Luh Raini plans to renovate and expand her kiosk. She also plans to purchase a glass rack to showcase her merchandises. To realize her plans, she is applying for $425 loan. She hopes to obtain funding in time to realize her dreams.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renovate her kiosk and buy glass shelves

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein Y. is a 20 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon.  Hussein has been working as a floor polisher for three years.  He requests a loan of $1000 US dollars to purchase tools for work.  This is the first time he has requested a loan.  Hussein is special because he does his work well.  His clients come from the region. When Hussein first started his business, he didn't have start up capital. He decided to go into business because of his experience.  Hussein plans on expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase tools for work.

loans.name: Norma Del Pilar

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Kusirikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua.
Norma es casada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Norma vende frutas variadas, de manera ambulatoria, caminando por diferentes calles para lo cual tiene una carretilla, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de manzanas, sandia.
Los sueños de Norma son ahorrar, tener una casa bonita para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the community bank Kusirikuy, which means “Be Happy” in Quechua. Norma is 37, married and has 4 children. Norma sells various fruit on the street. She walks down different streets, which is why she has a cart. Her children help her sell fruit. Norma needs a loan of 1,050 PEN to buy apples and watermelon. Norma’s dream is to save money to have a nice house for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy apples, watermelon.

loans.name: Tuwe Wa Kweli Group

texts.en:
Mwantatu makes a living selling charcoal and firewood in the Melinne neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Tuwe wa kweli loan group, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. She works at her trade for 12 hours a day.  

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania, which she will use to buy more charcoal and firewood to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and grow her business.

Mwantatu is 30 years old, widowed and a three-year-old child. She will be sharing this loan with her loan group members, Salma and Kibibi, each of whom runs a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est un jeune homme de 31 ans, marié et père d’une petite fille. Il est compté parmi les meilleurs menuisiers de sa localité. Pour mieux exécuter ses travaux et satisfaire aux commandes de sa clientèle, Komi désire avec ce crédit acheter des matériaux de travail et des planches pour l’exécution de ses œuvres. Ceci lui permettra de gagner plus de fonds pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi A., age 31, is married and the father of a little girl. He's among the best carpenters in his village. To improve his work and execute his customers' orders, Komi wishes to use this loan to buy work materials and planks to realize his works. This will enable him to increase his income to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials and planks

loans.name: Shakeela Muhammad Akram Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy another juicer machine for her juice corner.

Shabana nasreen baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her cosmetics-selling business.

Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Salma baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

Shakeela baji, wife of M. A., has lived in Borewala, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Her husband runs a timber selling business and has been in this business for the past five years.

Shakeela baji is a very hardworking lady. She runs a clothes-sewing business. She takes order from her neighbors and charges them by $2 per stitching. She does this work to pay off the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy timber to expand her husband’s timber-selling business.

loans.use: To buy timber for her husband's business
